required_skills: Analytics and Data AnalyticsBusiness Intelligence (BI)
location: Meyer Turku · Turku, Southwest Finland, Finland  2 days ago  · 7 applicants
job_description:
Haluatko työskennellä maailman upeimpien ja edistyksellisimpien risteilyalusten parissa? Tule osaksi yhtä maailman vahvinta laivanrakennustiimiä!Etsimme nyt BI-asiantuntijaa tuotannon kehitysosastolle. Mitä BI-asiantuntijan tehtäviin kuuluu?BI-asiantuntijana olet osa tuotannon kehitysosastoa, jossa pääset kehittämään monipuolisesti erilaisia tiedolla johtamisen ja analytiikan ratkaisuja. Kehitysosaston ohella kommunikoit ja teet läheistä yhteistyötä telakan eri osastojen ja johtotoimintojen, DataOps-tiimin sekä ulkoisten yhteistyökumppaneiden kanssa.Tehtäviisi kuuluu kuunnella ja tunnistaa liiketoiminnan tarpeita sekä pystyä kääntämään niitä teknisten vaatimusten kautta toteutettavissa oleviksi ratkaisuiksi, jotka tuottavat lisäarvoa loppukäyttäjille ja liiketoiminnalle. Datan käsittelyn, analyysin ja visualisoinnin lisäksi kykenet myös ohjeistamaan loppukäyttäjiä dataratkaisujen hyödyntämisessä ja vastaamaan liiketoiminnan kysymyksiin. Edistät tiedolla johtamisen kulttuuria ja mahdollistat paremman dataperusteisen päätöksenteon ja toiminnan kehittämisen.Pystyt hahmottamaan yksittäiset käyttötapaukset kokonaisuutena ja osallistumaan myös arkkitehtuurisuunnitteluun data-, analytiikka- ja raportointikerroksissa. Haet aktiivisesti uusia sovelluskohteita datalle ja toimivia tapoja työskennellä dataan liittyvän kehityksen parissa. Uusien ratkaisujen toteuttamisen ohella yksi osa työnkuvaasi on olemassa olevien dataratkaisujen kehittäminen tehokkuuden, tarkkuuden ja ylläpidettävyyden parantamiseksi.Mitä odotamme sinulta?Etsimme henkilöä, joka on tiedonjanoinen, omatoiminen ja työskentelee sujuvasti sekä sisäisten että ulkoisten sidosryhmien kanssa. Työotteeltasi olet ratkaisukeskeinen ja näet haasteet mahdollisuuksina. Sinulla on tehtävään soveltuva korkeakoulututkinto ja mahdollisesti jo useamman vuoden työkokemus vastaavista BI-ratkaisujen ja analytiikan kehittämistehtävistä liiketoiminnan ja IT:n rajapinnassa.Tehtävän menestyksekäs hoitaminen vaatii osaamista tehokkaiden datamallien rakentamisesta aina ratkaisujen toteuttamiseen liiketoiminnan tarpeisiin. Odotamme sinun olevan matemaattisanalyyttinen henkilö, jolla on monipuolista kokemusta tietokannoista ja tietomallinnuksesta sekä BI-työkaluista.Arvostamme erityisesti syvää osaamista BI-kehityksestä (Power BI, Power Query M, SQL, DAX) ja Excel-ohjelmistosta. Eduksi luemme aiemman tuntemuksen MS Azure-ympäristöstä, MS Power Platform ja muista BI-työkaluista. Osaaminen muista kielistä (esim. Python, R) voi olla eduksi työtehtävässä. Kielitaidon osalta edellytämme sujuvaa suomen ja englannin kielen taitoa.Työnkuvaa on mahdollista rakentaa osaamisesi ja kiinnostuksesi perusteella.Huomioithan, että edellytämme valitulta henkilöltä hyväksyttyä huumausainetestiä sekä terveystarkastuksessa todettua sopivuutta työsuhteen tehtäviin.Mitä tarjoamme sinulle?Meyerin pitkä ja luotettava laivanrakennushistoria takaa positiiviset näkymät urallesi. Telakalla pääset osaksi innostavaa työyhteisöä, jossa teemme tiiminä intohimolla töitä suurien projektien eteen. Meillä sinulla on mahdollisuus toteuttaa itseäsi monipuolisesti. Yrityksessämme on paljon mielenkiintoisia työtehtäviä, ja kannustammekin työntekijöitämme sisäiseen työkiertoon. Laivanrakennusoppilaitoksemme tarjoamilla koulutuksilla laajennat osaamistasi entisestään. Tässä yhteisössä sinusta voi tulla maailman paras osaaja ammatissasi!Työntekijöidemme hyvinvointi ja viihtyvyys niin töissä kuin vapaa-ajalla ovat meille tärkeitä. Telakan työterveysasema tarjoaa työntekijöille monipuoliset terveyspalvelut heti telakan porttien ulkopuolella. Muun muassa telakan kuntosali sekä meyerilaisten lentopallo-, koripallo- ja salibandyvuorot takaavat tekemistä vapaa-ajalle. Tuemme myös omia harrastuksiasi Smartum-edulla.Laivan lähtiessä meiltä maailmalle voit olla siitä todella ylpeä! Itseasiassa koko Suomi voi olla siitä ylpeä.Meyer TurkuMeyer Turku on yksi maailman suurimmista ja moderneimmista telakoista. Rakennamme maailman uudenaikaisimpia ja ympäristöystävällisimpiä risteilyaluksia, autolauttoja ja erikoisaluksia. Osuutemme maailman risteilyrakentamisesta on noin 15 prosenttia, ja tilauskantamme ulottuu vuoteen 2026.Meyer Turku Oy toimii Turun telakalla, jossa on rakennettu laivoja vuodesta 1737 alkaen. Meyer Turku Oy:n tytäryhtiöitä ovat Piikkiössä sijaitseva hyttitehdas Piikkio Works Oy, kokonaistoimituksia laivojen yleisiin tiloihin tarjoava Shipbuilding Completion Oy sekä Raumalla sijaitseva laivanrakennus- ja offshore-alan suunnitteluyritys ENG’nD Oy. Yhdessä Saksassa toimivien Meyer Werftin ja Neptun Werftin kanssa Meyer Turku Oy muodostaa Meyer Groupin, yhden maailman johtavista risteilyalusten rakentajista.Meyerin perinteikäs perheyritys sai alkunsa, kun Willm Rolf Meyer perusti Meyer Werft -telakan vuonna 1795 Papenburgiin, Saksaan. Tänä päivänä Meyer Groupiin kuuluvat Turun ja Papenburgin telakoiden lisäksi myös Rostockin telakka Neptun Werft.Meyerin telakoilla suunnitellaan ja rakennetaan maailman edistyksellisimpiä risteilyaluksia, jokilaivoja ja matkustaja-autolauttoja, jotka räätälöidään vastaamaan asiakkaiden tarpeisiin – ja ylittämään korkeimmatkin odotukset. Maailmanlaajuisesti tunnettua ja arvostettua perheyritystä johdetaan jo seitsemännessä polvessa.
 
Etsimme nyt BI-asiantuntijaa tuotannon kehitysosastolle. 
 
Mitä BI-asiantuntijan tehtäviin kuuluu?
Mitä odotamme sinulta?
Mitä tarjoamme sinulle?
Meyer Turku

location: Alexandria Group · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  2 days ago  · 1 applicant
job_description:
Vuonna 1996 perustettu Alexandria Group Oyj on yksi Suomen suurimmista sijoituspalveluyhtiöistä ja pörssinoteerattu First North -listalle. Tehtävämme on auttaa suomalaisia kasvattamaan varallisuuttaan ja elämään rikkaampaa elämää. Palveluksessamme on noin 200 sijoitusalan ammattilaista 30 paikkakunnalla palvellen yli 35 000 asiakasta. Konsernin muodostavat Alexandria Group Oyj, Alexandria Rahastoyhtiö Oy, Alexandria Markets Oy, Premium Advisors Oy sekä Alexandria Yritysrahoitus Oy. Haemme SENIOR BI-ASIANTUNTIJAA Alexandria Groupille Helsinkiin Askel kohti rikkaampaa työelämää Vahvistamme kehitystiimiämme ja etsimme liiketoimintatiedon hallinnan osaajaa. Tehtävässäsi pääset kehittämään konsernimme raportointi- ja analytiikkapalveluita tiiviissä yhteistyössä kehitystiimin, ylimmän johdon ja liiketoimintayksiköiden kanssa. Tuotat liiketoiminnan ja johtamisen kannalta kriittistä tietoa ja olet mukana toteuttamassa strategisesti tärkeitä hankkeita. Panoksesi auttaa meitä hallitsemaan ja hyödyntämään liiketoimintatietoa laadukkaasti ja tehokkaasti.Olet kokenut data-ammattilainen ja Microsoft full-stack osaaja, jolla on aito kiinnostus dataa, analytiikkaa ja liiketoimintaa kohtaan. Sinulla on vahva ymmärrys tietovarastoinnista- ja mallinnuksesta, datan analytiikasta, visualisoinnista sekä näihin liittyvistä parhaista käytännöistä ja sudenkuopista. Pystyt hahmottamaan suuria kokonaisuuksia, viemään projekteja maaliin ja olet aina valmis oppimaan uutta. Ennen kaikkea olet innokas liiketoiminnan ongelmien ratkaisija. Tehtävässä menestymiseksi odotamme  Vahvaa osaamista Microsoftin full-stack-ratkaisuista (SSIS, SSAS, Power BI)Käytännön kokemusta analytiikan ja tietomallien arkkitehtuureista, metodeista ja malleistaHalua työskennellä tiiviissä yhteistyössä eri liiketoimintayksiköiden kanssa Ulospäinsuuntautuneisuutta ja palveluhenkisyyttäHyvää kirjallista ja suullista suomen sekä englannin kielen taitoa – käytämme molempia kieliä työtehtävissä
  Miksi Alexandria Alexandrialla olet osa asiantuntijajoukkoa, joka tekee intohimoisesti töitä rikkaamman elämän eteen. Henkilöstömme hyvinvointi ja viihtyvyys ovat meille sydämen asia, ja olemmekin ylpeitä siitä, että henkilöstömme viihtyvyys on erinomaista vuosi toisensa jälkeen. Nyt sinulla on mahdollisuus olla osana viemässä finanssialan kiinnostavimman yrityksen tarinaa seuraavalle tasolle. Tarjoamme työtilat pääkonttorillamme Helsingin Eteläesplanadilla. Tämän hetken hybridimallissa työskentelemme joustavasti myös etänä. Lisäksi tarjoamme lounas- ja virike-edun sekä kattavan työterveyshuollon.  Ota askel kohti rikkaampaa työelämää ja jätä hakemuksesi sekä CV:si palkkatoiveineen viimeistään to 30.11.2023 alla olevalla lomakkeella. Käsittelemme hakemuksia jo hakuaikana ja paikka täytetään heti sopivan henkilön löydyttyä.Jos sinulla herää kysymyksiä tehtävään tai meillä työskentelyyn liittyen, lisätietoja antaa Kehitystoimintojen johtaja Riku Laukka puhelimitse +358 40 5120 626 ja sähköpostitse riku.laukka@alexandria.fi

required_skills: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Data Science, MLOps, Machine Learning, and PyTorchConvolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Learning, Model Training, Object Detection, and TensorFlow
location: Verso Vision · Lappeenranta, South Karelia, Finland  2 days ago  · 42 applicants
job_description:
We are looking for a Machine Learning ExpertHey machine learning enthusiast, here’s your chance to use your skills for something meaningful! We at Verso Vision are actually saving lives and making life better for a large number of people with our Fall and incident prevention and detection solution.Our AI-based patient monitoring system prevents falls and other accidents in hospitals and nursing homes. As “AI-based” implies, much of the work revolves around building machine learning models. We are growing fast and looking for a top-notch expert of the field to help us keep our system the best in the World.The team is still small, but we are growing our tech team with carefully chosen professionals who have already made career in machine learning. We’d like to see you every now and then at our office in Lappeenranta but this can be also a hybrid position. Residency in Finland is a requirement.Requirements to fill this role Master’s or doctoral degree in computer science, data science, machine learning, or similar fieldGood grasp of machine learning fundamentals (linear algebra, probability theory, optimization, supervised learning)Up-to-date knowledge of machine learning models and methods for image and/or video data in classification, segmentation and object detection (convolutional neural networks, visual transformers, etc.)Hands-on experience in data normalization, data augmentation, dataset curation and class balancing, and understanding how these factors affect model training performanceHands-on experience in debugging and troubleshooting model training, performance analysis, hyperparameter search, and architecture customizationTrack-record of successful end-to-end machine learning deployments, and maintenance of deployed solutionsFluent in Python and Pytorch or Tensorflow frameworksA good understanding of model deployment and MLOps principlesExcellent problem-solving skills and capability for independent workFluent communication skills in EnglishGood documentation habits
The skills and experience in the following will be considered an advantage Semi-supervised and unsupervised/self-supervised learning, or domain generalizationTraining strategies such as curriculum learning, student-teacher-approachesGenerative image/video models (e.g., deepfake, img2img)Scaling machine learning deploymentsModel architecture optimization methods, e.g., neural architecture search, model pruning, knowledge distillationExperience in higher-level frameworks such as Ultralytics or OpenMMLabC++DockerKubernetes
We are looking for someone who is an experts in their field, can jump into action straight away and already has proven track record. Our business is at the stage where we can only hire people who already know their stuff.We would also love to hear if you have software engineering business, you’ve done AI/ML-related, open contributions or you have participated in competitions such as Kaggle or similar. Our main working language is English but most of your team would be native Finnish speaker so any Finnish language skills will be appreciated.Your work would consist of building and trying out new model architectures, training and optimizing models, analyzing data, finding ways to extract more information out of images and making sure all of this works in production. You would be working with a small team of experts with lots of freedom – and responsibility. Your location does not matter that much, but we’d like to see you every now and then at our office in Lappeenranta.We would love to tell you more about the position! Call our Tech Team Lead Topi Mäenpää at +358 40 774 7749.
 
We are looking for a Machine Learning Expert
 
We are growing fast and looking for a top-notch expert of the field to help us keep our system the best in the World.
 
Residency in Finland is a requirement.

required_skills: Data Analysis and EnglishCommunication, MS programs, Problem Solving, Project Management, Sustainability, Waste Water Treatment Plants, Wastewater Treatment, and Water Treatment
location: Lindström · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  5 days ago  · Over 50 applicants
job_description:
Are you looking for the next steps to shine professionally in a multicultural environment with circular economy present in your everyday work? Get ready to work in an innovative textile service business named as one of the most interesting companies in the circular economy, with a turnover of 495 million. With a 175-year-long history (not retiring anytime soon!) of caring for our people and customers, we are ready to expand our Lindström family. Currently we, a Finnish family-owned company awarded with the Family Business of the year 2021 in Finland, have over 5,000 inspiring people in 23 countries around Europe and Asia. Now is your chance to become part of the journey of helping our customers to grow more in a sustainable way. Take a leap with us as our new:WASTEWATER PROCESS SPECIALISTAs Lindström’s new Wastewater Process Specialist you will be responsible for the continued development of wastewater processes. Understanding new solutions and technologies in this field are at the heart of this role, and you will be in a key position to integrate and implement them in Lindström’s operations. The position will include travelling to Lindström’s operating countries in Europe and in Asia on a regular basis. Your location will be at our Head Office in Kalasatama, Helsinki, where we are working in a hybrid model. Your key responsibilities in this role include: Providing technical and regulatory expertise on global (Europe and Asia) and local water quality rules, regulations, and policiesPreparing long-term plans and strategy to improve water efficiencyKeeping up to date on wastewater emissions control trends in Europe and AsiaRemaining informed on solutions and technology related to water management development Supporting corporate sustainability strategy in reaching for carbon neutralityMaintaining and continually developing the Environmental Management SystemOrganizing and facilitating workshops with internal and external partners Preparing training and communication materials, as well as facilitating training sessions for e.g. local managers
We are looking for an experienced expert who has a deep understanding of wastewater treatment equipment and processes, as well as practical work experience in the field (e.g. water treatment plant). Keeping the full environmental impact of wastewater and operations in mind is essential for this role, as well as the ability to strategize, analyse and handle data, and staying informed on current developments in the field. If you understand wastewater measurement rules and relevant water and wastewater management trends, you might be the one we are looking for!Our ideal candidate has: 3 – 5 years of practical working in wastewater managementRelevant technical degree, e.g. Bachelor of Science in Environmental or Chemical Engineering, or equivalentStrong understanding of the principles, practices, and techniques of chemistry and biologyUnderstanding of the basic principles and practices of water and wastewater treatmentUnderstanding of the laws and regulations related to wastewaterUnderstanding and knowledge of SBTi, GHG protocols, GRI standards, and UN sustainability development goalsAbility to understand the resource efficiency drivers in a sustainable business environment, and experience in working in a matrix organizationGood data analysis and interpretation skills as well as good problem-solving skillsGood project management and training skillsGood presentation, communication, and cooperation skillsGood written and spoken English language skills, and familiarity with MS programs
We offer you a unique position in a value-driven organization with a strong culture of caring. In this position you will get the opportunity to expand on your expertise and bring forward your own ideas. At Lindström you can feel appreciated for who you are and be encouraged to develop yourself and utilize your strengths in the best possible way. We will support you in your professional growth and be with you every step of the way. In everything we do, we want to live our purpose: we care for people and our planet by inspiring people to shine and businesses to grow in a sustainable way. Interested? For more information, please don’t hesitate to contact Erika Szász, Head of Continuous Services Europe. You can reach Erika by phone at +36 703 803 750 on Friday, November 3 between 14:00 – 15:00 CET or on Friday, November 17 between 14:00 – 15:00 CET.  To apply, please fill in our online application form no later than Sunday, November 19. Act fast as we will be reviewing applications during the application period and the position will be filled as soon as a suitable candidate has been found. The starting date is negotiable, but we wish to have a new team member as soon as possible. The position is permanent.
 
 
Take a leap with us as our new:

Your location

required_skills: Data Engineering, Data Science, Data Warehousing, Databases, Extract, Transform, Load (ETL), and Google Cloud Platform (GCP)Apache Kafka, Cassandra, Communication, and Problem Solving
location: Schibsted Finland · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  2 days ago  · 13 applicants
job_description:
THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELLYou? A data engineer with interest in Data Mesh who is passionate about building high quality software and infrastructure and loves collaborating with others.Role? We are currently seeking a full-time Data Engineer with interest in Data Mesh for the Schibsted Data Enablement and Infrastructure team.Tech stack? Some examples of our tech stack consists of Terraform, Kafka, Github Actions, KubernetesLocation? You can apply to work at one of our hubs in Aarhus or Helsinki. Most of us work some days from home a couple of days a week and love meeting our colleagues weekly for collaboration. If you like, you can of course work from the office every day.Company? Bilbasen and DBA in Denmark, Oikotie and Tori in Finland, Blocket in Sweden and FINN.no in Norway recently joined forces, now collectively forming Schibsted Nordic Marketplaces. Together, we serve over 325 million monthly visits. Our technology unit is instrumental to our success story, deploying new code to production over 1800 times per week.Why us? You will be joining a dynamic and innovative team that will lead the data mesh strategy for all the marketplaces in the Nordics. You will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact for other developers and make systems that are used by millions of people.Sounds like your cup of tea? Check out the details below!WHO ARE YOU?You are passionate about building high quality software and infrastructure, enjoy sharing knowledge , and making a difference together with others. You have a genuine interest in our products and the needs of our end-users, and you always consider what’s best for the company when making technology decisions. When you see something that needs to be done, you step up and do it. You are curious and driven to develop your skills to solve problems.Additionally, you have: Good understanding of the principles of Data Mesh. Knowledge of Java and the JVM platform BSc or MSc degree and at least three years of experience within IT Experience with any of the following or similar is an advantage: Kafka, Kotlin, GCP, AWS, Git, Kubernetes, Spring,, PostgreSQL, Cassandra Experience working in an agile environment (Scrum, Kanban etc) A high degree of effective, proactive communication skills in English, both verbally and in written form. 
WHO ARE WE?Join our innovative Data Platform team! We're on an exciting journey towards Data Mesh, fostering shared, reliable, and secure data. As a team member, you'll collaborate closely with other Nordic Marketplaces teams, crafting custom vertical solutions and creating decentralized data products through our centralized Event Stream. We value teamwork, continuous improvement, and a flexible workday that puts the "Team first." Be part of our tight-knit community, learn from each other, and help shape the world's best marketplace.GOT YOUR ATTENTION? Let us hear from you!If you are looking for a workplace and the role in which you could share your knowledge and expertise, learn and grow, get inspired, be yourself, and make a difference, let us hear from you by November 19th. We value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds.QUESTIONS?Engineering Manager Lotte Johansen is happy to tell you about the daily work and answer any questions you may have about the role. Lotte is best available at LinkedIn, or email (lotte.johansen[at]schibsted.com).

job_title: Data Scientist, Pohjola Insurance Analytics, Helsinki
required_skills: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Data Science, and EnglishAnalytical Models, Application Programming Interfaces (API), Communication, Customer Analysis, Data Collection, Datasets, and Predictive Analytics
location: OP Financial Group · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  1 day ago  · 10 applicants
job_description:
Are you skilled in handling extensive datasets? Are you enthusiastic about solving complex problems? Are you fascinated by automated decision-making models, machine learning, and analytics solutions related to the field? Do you want your work to have a genuine impact at the core of the insurance business?In the role of a Data Scientist in the Customer Relations at Pohjola Insurance, you'll get to do just that! We are now looking for a new addition to our Customer Process Analytics team for a permanent position based in Helsinki with partial remote working possibility. The start date for the position is according to the agreement.About The RoleAs a Data Scientist in Pohjola Insurance's Customer Relations, you'll work in a team responsible for developing the customer analytics in the short and long term. You'll be working alongside an end-to-end capable team that provides support across all stages of analytics development.You'll be involved in planning data collection and storage. Using the gathered data, you'll develop analytical models that meet the needs of the business. The role combines opportunities for continuous professional development, learning from skilled colleagues, and developing ambitious solutions. The specific job description will be refined based on your previous experience and skills.The migration of the IT environment to Microsoft's cloud services is part of OP Financial Group's updated IT strategic directions, and you'll play an important role in implementing the utilization of cloud-based data capabilities in collaboration with various stakeholders.The opportunity is available in Vallila Helsinki, and like the rest of OP, we work in a flexible manner, combining both office days and remote work within Finland.To succeed in this role We're looking for someone already proficient in data science practices and related software development. You understand the requirements for implementing an AI product, such as data streams, models, databases, and interfaces. Our most active APIs receive several hundred queries per second, so mere modeling skills are not sufficient.Experience in cloud analytics tools and/or setting up and maintaining production AI systems (ML Ops) is a significant advantage. Likewise, experience in neural network modeling and NLP is a plus.In terms of technology, we use mainly Python, Spark, SQL, AWS products and Databricks. We'll transition to Azure, so expertise in Azure is also considered advantageous . We invest heavily in learning new things and technologies and sharing knowledge and expertise. Therefore, we hope you share our desire to develop the team and the group's data work maturity in the field of analytics.We utilize agile methods in our daily work, so we hope you're familiar with them or are eager to learn more about them. You have experience collaborating with various stakeholders and enjoy networking beyond team and business boundaries. Your work is characterized by goal orientation, analytical thinking, and solution-focused approaches. You're skilled at leading yourself. With strong communication and collaboration skills, you can motivate others to participate and create new solutions together!You hold a higher education degree in a relevant field and communicate fluently, at minimum, in English. Proficiency in Finnish is considered a strong plus.What We Aim To Offer YouAn accountable and independent role with the opportunity to influence the development of analytics at Pohjola Insurance through advanced analytics and machine learning. Your area of responsibility would consist of customer analytics, including both retention analytics, customer experience-related analytics, and text modeling. We believe that modern text models provide the best understanding of customer needs, thus creating the best customer experience. We primarily use open-source libraries, allowing you to work extensively with the latest technologies. You'll have the autonomy to decide the content of your work within the team's objectives and influence how we progress. Moreover, as we develop data products for Pohjola’s own use, your work will be long-term, allowing you to delve deeply into their development.You'll be working in a skilled team as a part of the broader Pohjola Insurance data community. OP Group is one of Finland's largest data houses, so you'll have a lot of colleagues supporting you. Curiosity, activity, creativity, and an endless interest in working with extensive data sets unite us. With our agile approach, we trust our experts and encourage making bold decisions.You'll notice that in our team, the development of skills and challenging oneself isn't just words to us. We employ the 70-20-10 principle, meaning you'll spend 70% of your time on daily tasks, 20% refining work methods, and the last 10% freely learning new skills. For instance, you can utilize this time in OP Software Academy, where you can expand your expertise in various fields — and best of all, during working hours!In balance with responsible work, we take care of your well-being and offer forward-looking work arrangements. We provide you with a stable environment where responsibility, human-centeredness, and mutual success are core values.You'll have access to diverse staff benefits, including a staff fund and staff-based banking, insurance, and loan services. We also offer comprehensive occupational health care, extensive medical expense insurance, and full-time accident insurance. We prioritize work sustainability through everyday balance and flexibility, offering you access to lunch, exercise, and cultural benefits, as well as the opportunity for cost-effective holidays in OP holiday apartments.What's next?If you're convinced of the suitability of this role for you, tell us about your skills and in your application. Apply through the provided link by the deadline 19th of November 2023.If you'd like to learn more about the roles or working with us, our Product Owner, Antti Rahtu, would be happy to provide additional information. You can reach Antti at +358 50 306 6946 or antti.rahtu(at)pohjola.fi.In the financial sector, our business is founded on trust and accountability, which is why the successful candidate will be checked for credit history and corporate connections, must take a drug test.Equality and diversity are highly valued at OP Financial Group. We welcome job applications from people of all kinds, regardless of their gender identity or age, or the culture or minority group with which they identify.OP Financial Group is the leading financial services group in Finland. Owned by our customers, we are one of the most alluring employers in the Financial sector. OP Financial Group employs over 13,000 professionals and provides banking, asset management, wealth management, insurance and brokerage services for our four million customers. For more information about OP as an employer and for all vacancies, go to www.op-careers.fi

job_title: Data Steward, Group Data Management Office
required_skills: Data Management and EnglishCommunication, Data Governance, Data Quality, Documentation, Metadata, Metadata Management, Nordic Countries, and Processes Development
location: Nordea · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  3 days ago  · 8 applicants
job_description:
Job ID: 19646 Would you like to be a part of defining meaning of data, improving its searchability and interoperability as levers for effective data management? We are now looking for a Data Steward to continuously support in securing high quality metadata capabilities. At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.  About this opportunityWelcome to the Data Governance & Metadata Management team. We add value by exercising a broad range of responsibilities including definition and maintenance of policies and operating models, coordination and advisory, and metadata management.  As the Data Steward, you’ll play a valuable role in safeguarding that our metadata management services, used by business and IT across the bank, are continuously improved and add value for Nordea.What you’ll be doing: Develop and implement efficient and effective metadata management processes and operational instructions that support to continuously maintain high meta data quality Hands-on support to the metadata owners and users by managing metadata in the services Support the development, as well as provisioning of relevant trainingListen carefully for new development ideas As a member of DG&MM team you will also have opportunities to contribute and collaborate broadly across our area of responsibility
 What we offerYou’ll join a dynamic team where we all have a role as organizational change ambassadors, supporting the alignment and implementation of the DG Framework i.e. people, processes and technology coming to place in a good way. This will provide you excellent possibilities to learn and grow professionally. We are implementing a Hybrid working model with added flexibility for remote work. As we are a part of an international organisation, English is our main working language. The role is based in Helsinki (Finland), Stockholm (Sweden) or Gdynia (Poland).  Who you areCollaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us. To succeed in this role, we believe that you: Are passionate about business meaning of data and its role in enabling world class financial servicesIt would be perfect if you’ve worked with metadata in some context, particularly in financial industry, but we’re above all observing your persistency to every day achieve high quality results, eagerness to learn more and solid ability to communicate with a service-minded attitudeAre proactively proposing new ideas, approaches and insights, and you continuously seek opportunities for organisational improvement Are able to work independently while you’re a true team-playerHave a positive can-do attitude, always curious and not hesitating to ask questions
 Your experience and background:  Previous work experience in controlling/reporting and projects as e.g. analyst, specialistExperience in process documentation or process developmentYou have professional level fluency, both written and spoken, in English language. Proficiency in Nordic languages is a definite advantageExperience within IBM InfoSphere Suite: Information Governance Catalog, Information Analyzer and Orion Governance is a plusWhile we prefer a university degree in technology or business, the full combination of you is that will matter the most
 If this sounds like you, get in touch! Next stepsSubmit your application no later than 30/11/2023. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Hannu Pertti Tapani Pitkänen at hannu.pitkanen@nordea.com.At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are. Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered. Please note that we will proceed with potential candidates already during the application period. Only for candidates in Sweden - For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.Only for candidates in Poland - Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdfWe reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

required_skills: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Extract, Transform, Load (ETL), Programming Languages, and SQLData Vault, PL/SQL, and Vault
location: Gofore · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  4 days ago  · 6 applicants
job_description:
Etsimme joukkoomme data-arkkitehtia kehittämään ja määrittelemään Goforen omaa tietoalustaa!Data-arkkitehtina työskentelet Digital Gofore-tiimissä, jossa on koottu eri alueiden osaajat yhteen. Tiimin kehittää ja tukee koko Goforen organisaatiota palvelevaa digitaalista alustaa, jossa yhdistyvät myynnin, osaamisen sekä toiminnanohjauksen kokonaisuudet – sekä tietysti tiedon esittäminen ja analytiikka omassa tietoalustassamme. Digitaalinen alustamme palvelee puhtaasti omia tarpeitamme. Pääset kehittämään tietoalustaamme, jolla on tärkeä rooli koko yrityksemme menestymisen kannalta, ja joka takaa jatkuvuutemme it-alan suunnannäyttäjänä.Olet data-arkkitehtina määrittämässä alustan tietorakenteita ja tietolatauksia, ja osallistut myös toteutukseen ja alustan ylläpidollisiin tehtäviin. Osallistut lisäksi koko digitaalisen alustan arkkitehtuurin määrittämiseen tietovirtojen ja tietorakenteiden näkökulmasta Tietoalustamme on alati kasvava vauhdikkaasti laajentuvassa organisaatiossamme. Meille ajankohtaiset teemat, kuten kansainvälistyminen, yrityskauppojen mukanaan tuomat laajat integraatiot sekä tekoälyn mahdollisuudet pitävät huolen siitä, että kehitys on jatkuvaa ja mielenkiintoista niin alustalla kuin sinulle henkilökohtaisesti.Mitä odotamme sinulta  Aiempi kokemus tietovarastojen, nykyaikaisten data-alustojen sekä tietolatausten (ETL) arkkitehtuurisuunnittelusta ja rakentamisesta.Kyky tiedon mallintamiseenTiedonhallinnan ymmärrystä ja sen vaikutusta laajempaan kokonaisuuteenSujuvaa SQL-osaamistaOmistajuutta ja näkemyksellisyyttä alustan pitkäjänteiseen ja tietoturvalliseen kehitykseenItseohjautuvaa työotetta
Tehtävässä menestymisen eduksi on:  Ymmärrys yritysarkkitehtuurista ja sen käytännöistäPL/SQL-osaaminenIntegraatiot + infraosaaminenKokemus Data Vault 2.0 mukaisista toteutuksistaKiinnostus tai kokemus AI:ta ja sen soveltamista kohtaan tietoalustakehityksessäSujuva suomenkieli
Mitä tarjoamme sinulle Sen lisäksi, että tarjoamme merkittävän roolin vakaassa, vastuullisessa ja menestyvässä organisaatiossa, tarjoamme sinulle lisäksi seuraavaa:Osaamisen kehittäminen: Sinua haastavan ja eteenpäin vievän roolin lisäksi pääset kehittämään itseäsi myös esimerkiksi sertifikaatteja opiskellen ja kursseille tai yhteisiin osaamisen jakamisen tilaisuuksiin osallistuen. Lisäksi ympärilläsi on laajempi Goforen data-asiantuntijoiden yhteisö josta ammentaa parhaita käytänteitä omaan työhösi.Joustava & yhteisöllinen arki: Meillä pääset nauttimaan työnteon vapaudesta ja joustavuudesta. Työajat ovat sovitettavissa omaan arkeesi, ja töitä on mahdollista tehdä sieltä, missä se sinulle sopii parhaiten. Toivomme kuitenkin, että olet valmis vierailemaan ajoittain Tampereella, missä tiimisi säännöllisesti kokoontuu. Työajan ulkopuolella tuemme yhteisöllisyyttä erilaisten aktiviteettien kuten sporttikerhojen, lautapeli-iltojen ja lajikokeilujen muodossa - tietenkään yhteisiä juhlia unohtamatta.Edut: Tarjoamme sinulle laajan paketin etuja tekemään elämästä mukavampaa niin työssä kuin ja vapaa-ajalla, esimerkiksi: Opiskelumahdollisuudet (Udemyn koko koulutustarjonta)Lounas-, liikunta-, työmatka-, polkupyöräetuVapaavalintaiset työvälineet ja mahdollisuus varustaa myös kotikonttoriaVälipalat, snacksit ja virvoitusjuomat toimistoillamme – viihtyisiä puitteita unohtamatta!Sairaan lapsen hoitoetu sekä mahdollisuus palkalliseen vapaaseen lähiomaisen sairastuttuaHieronta- ja hammaslääkärietuKattava työterveyshuoltoCrewShare-osakesäästöohjelma kaikille goforelaisille
Rekrytointiprosessimme Haethan tehtävää painamalla apply ja täyttämällä hakulomakkeen verkkoisivuillamme.Hae tehtävään pian, sillä haastattelemme henkilöitä tehtävään jo hakuaikana, ja teemme valinnan sopivan henkilön löydyttyä. Tehtävän hakuaika päättyy 22.11.2023Lisätietoja saat tehtävän esihenkilöltä ja Digital Gofore –yksikön vetäjältä Mikko Kattilakoskelta numerosta +358407725364. Mikko vastaa tehtävään liittyviin kysymyksiin 2.11. klo 12.00-13.00 ja 8.11. klo 10.00-11.00.

required_skills: Cybersecurity, English, and Microsoft AzureAzure Active Directory, Cloud Security, Incident Response, Information Security, Microsoft Defender, Network Security, and Office 365
location: Nixu Corporation · Espoo, Uusimaa, Finland  1 week ago  · 9 applicants
job_description:
Are you an expert in Azure security stack? Or are you experienced with Azure cloud platform and willing to learn more about Azure security? We are seeking an Azure XDR expert to join our growing XDR security team.The role in shortAs an XDR (Extended Detection and Response) Specialist, you'll be at the forefront of our cybersecurity efforts. Your role involves proactively identifying and analyzing cyber threats across various environments, responding swiftly to incidents, utilizing advanced tools and platforms for real-time threat detection, and continuously enhancing our defences. Your expertise is crucial in safeguarding our clients’ digital assets.The position can be located in Espoo, Stockholm, Herlev or Amsterdam.Your daily routines will be To implement and maintain the Azure XDR based services for our clientsTo manage your client’s XDR framework via Microsoft 365 Defender portalTo analyse client’s environment configuration and security postureTo recommend and help implement client’s security posture improvementsTo create reports and hold regularly Azure XDR related operative meetings with your clients
You have the following Passion for cybersecurity issuesPositive “People attitude” and willingness to work daily with customers“Service attitude” and willingness to develop and enhance continuous servicesPrudence especially in schedules and in timelinesAbility to learn and adapt what you have learnedExperience in teamwork and taking responsibility of your own workAbility to communicate fluently (spoken and written) with customers and colleagues in English
The ideal candidate for this position should have experience with Azure Cloud and Azure-based security services and tools such as: Defender for Endpoints, Defender for Identity, Defender for Cloud Apps, Defender Office 365, Azure AD Identity Protection, Defender Anti-virus, and Defender for Cloud. They should also be open to learning new skills and believe in continuous improvement. Previous experience in information security and Azure cloud certifications are considered as advantages, but not necessities.The candidate should be interested in proactive security for modern enterprise environments (cloud, infrastructure, workstation, servers), Additionally, a general understanding of Microsoft enterprise IT infrastructure components is required for this role.The ideal candidate should also have practical experience with Azure XDR systems and an understanding of Microsoft Azure security solutions for threat detection, incident response and security posture with Microsoft 365 Defender portal and Microsoft Endpoint Manager.Be one of usAs Nixuans, we are passionate about cyber security and encourage you to excel professionally. Through certification, knowledge sharing or doing more demanding cases. Our life is not only about work, we also like having fun and sharing hobbies with colleagues. If you are into floorball, golf, music, or anything else, we support Nixuans to have hobbies with coworkers in our Hobby Clubs.In 2023, Nixu was acquired by DNV, an independent expert in assurance and risk management operating in more than 100 countries. The merge will create one of Europe’s fastest-growing cyber security services businesses. This brings more opportunities for our consultants to hone their skills in cybersecurity. If you are a seasoned professional or just starting your journey in cybersecurity, we are the place for you.With us, you will have a proper way to impact our work and decisions. You will join a company that prioritizes employee development and growth. At Nixu, we seek you who like and thrive in an expanding organization. Our work impacts the society that we live in, and you can be a crucial person in that.If you're ready to inspire, and make a difference in the world of cybersecurity, we invite you to join our team and embark on an exciting and rewarding journey with us. Take the next step in your career and become our new XDR Specialist!Apply now!We are excited to connect with you, so please apply today!Need more information?If you have any questions regarding this position, please reach out to Juha Fiskari, (Service Unit Lead, Managed Capabilities), juha.fiskari[at]nixu.com. A security background check will be a part of the recruitment process.

required_skills: Analytical SkillsCommunication, Stakeholder Management, and System Monitoring
location: Nordea · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  3 days ago  · 23 applicants
job_description:
Job ID: 19733  Do you want to make a positive change in the world by helping to tackle Financial Crime? Join us in building the next generation platform and techniques to stop money flowing into illegal activities such as terrorist financing, corruption, drug smuggling, tax evasion and human trafficking.The techniques criminals use to evade detection are becoming ever more sophisticated and  continue to challenge the status quo of current best practices. The approach to solving this now demands new ways leveraging artificial intelligence, machine learning, natural language processing and cognitive automation.Financial Crime Intelligence, Investigations & Analytics (FCIIA), situated within Group Financial Crime Prevention, provides specialist capabilities to support enterprise-wide Complex Investigations, Proactive Strategic Intelligence and Financial Crime Monitoring capabilities. FCIIA also provides subject matter expertise to support analytics initiatives to drive great efficiency and effectiveness across traditional financial crime monitoring and detection capabilities.  At Nordea, we’re committed to being a partner that our customers and society can count on. Joining us means you’ll have a positive impact on how we do banking in the right way – today and tomorrow. So, bring your ideas, skills and unique background - with us, you’ll be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger. About this opportunity This is a role within the Monitoring unit of FCIIA with a responsibility of aiding cross jurisdictional special investigations and coordinating both operational and strategic intelligence through development of mitigation solutions using advanced analytics products and services. What you will be doing: Provide Financial Crime detection expertise in the business interpretation of financial crime risk to analyse, identify & implement data driven mitigation & monitoring solutionsDrive the design, delivery and ongoing oversight of appropriate risk-based monitoring and detection solutions, preferably utilizing Quantexa Deliver appropriate governance & oversight standards to multiple complex threat interpretation & mitigation solutionsUtilising subject matter expertise and technical skillset to perform complex assignmentsDrive development opportunities to enhance mitigation effectiveness, and to identify and promote continuous improvements and contribute to development initiativesManage stakeholder relationships within and outside the unit
 The role is based in Helsinki, Stockholm or Tallinn. You will join a team that is built on hybrid skill-sets and has a dynamic work environment. Who you are Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  Your experience and background: Experience and proven track record in solving business problems with Financial Crime Monitoring and Surveillance solutionsPossess a strong understanding of Quantexa monitoring platform - is a mustExperience working in financial crime prevention within the financial services industry Robust appreciation and approach with governance and oversight of regulated processes and proceduresAdvanced education qualifications in related, including but not limited to risk managementPossess knowledge of analytical and reporting tools is a nice to haveAbility to communicate clearly on complex topicsEnjoy collaboration with team members and stakeholdersFluency in English
 If this sounds like you, get in touch! Next stepsSubmit your application no later than 14/11/2023. For more information, feel free to reach out to Jason Abbey (Jason.abbey@nordea.com), Head of Monitoring in FCIIA.At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are. Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered. Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

required_skills: Analytics, Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Data Science, and Digital Marketing ChannelsBusiness Analytics, Communication, Marketing Analytics, Marketing Automation, and Web Analytics
location: Nordea · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  2 weeks ago  · 48 applicants
job_description:
Job ID: 19131 Would you like to work at one of the most skilled and ambitious data units in the Nordics as well as learn how to master some of the most advanced marketing technologies available on the market? We are now looking for a Digital Analytics Specialist, with a focus on data activation, who can help us on our journey to become the bank that delivers the best customer experience, across all our online and offline channels. At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger. About this opportunity Welcome to the Web Analytics & Online Optimization team. We add value by supporting business units across all of the Nordics with a wide range of tasks related to data collection, analytics and data activation for marketing activities. We strive to become the bank that creates the best omnichannel experience for our customers. In achieving this, we need a skilled person to orchestrate data and technologies to help serve relevant and targeted communication through a wide range of marketing channels. As a Digital Analytics Specialist focused on Activation, you will play a valuable role in helping us become more efficient and effective with our relevance to customers, through our applied marketing channels, as well as increase the total number of targeted activities across the entire group.What you’ll be doing: Contribute to the overall data activation strategy and help identify valuable data points and marketing channels/destinations that will enhance the overall segmentation capabilitiesDrive data activation use cases across countries, business units, product areas & marketing channels. Responsible for building and maintaining high-quality audiences for targeted marketing activities like website personalization, marketing automation and programmatic/social buying.Keep oversight of the audiences catalogue and make sure that a proper structure, data governance and privacy preferences are enforced at all times. Help build and improve on internal capabilities for data activation and audience management, e.g. by enabling and educating business stakeholders in the activation of relevant data (Web-and CRM) through the applied Ad- and MarTech platforms. 
 You will join a highly skilled team of specialist who are relentlessly passionate about data and technologies, and who are always seeking new ways to improve and drive real value for our customers. The role is based in Helsinki, Finland.Who you areCollaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us. To succeed in this role, we believe that you have: A desire to work with large amounts of data and a talent for identifying data elements that has the potential to bring additional value to business.An open mindset that is good at navigating in a landscape that is constantly changing.An intrinsic drive to constantly make things better and more efficient.An internal go-to-person for questions related to audiences, data and platforms (Mar-/AdTech).Are passionate and relentlessly focused on challenging the status quo and improve/refine on own skill-set. 
Your experience and background:  Proven experience driving data activation projects for marketing campaigns/automation tracks - preferably as in-house specialist or in an agency capacity. Practitioners experience one or more digital marketing channels in a multi-channel marketing setup (Internal and/or external channels).Well versed within marketing technologies – preferably with experience with the Adobe tech stack (or comparable cloud based marketing technologies). Experience working with technologies like DSPs, DMP/CDPs and Campaign Tracking platforms. Knowledge about how to manage data collection (e.g. through a TMS) is preferred .Experience working with and communicating to multiple stakeholders with different capabilities and backgrounds. Strong analytics skills and a data-driven approach with solid commercial experience.Demonstrated ability to learn new skills and pick up new technologies quickly.Fluent in Finnish and English, both verbal and written
 If this sounds like you, get in touch! Next stepsSubmit your application no later than 09/11/2023.  For more information, you’re welcome to contact Nikolaj Bardram, nikolaj.bardram@nordea.com or Jesper Baastrup Hjort, jesper.baastrup.hjort@nordea.com.At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are. Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

required_skills: Computer Science, Data Warehousing, Databases, and Extract, Transform, Load (ETL)Business Understanding, Communication, Data Modeling, Snowflake, Snowflake Cloud, and Wizard
location: Schibsted Finland · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  5 days ago  · 35 applicants
job_description:
THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELLYou? A data engineer with an analytic mindset or an analyst with data engineering skills. Whether you have a few years of experience or have been around for a while, we’re interested in hearing from you.Role? As a Data Warehouse Engineer in our company, you will take part in constructing state-of-the-art Data Warehouses tailored for Nordic Marketplaces, empowering data-informed decisions. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders and cross-functional teams to engineer robust, agile solutions.Tech stack? AWS, Snowflake, Redshift, Matillion, Python, DBT, TableauLocation? You can apply to work at one of our hubs in Aarhus or Helsinki. Most of us work some days from home a couple of days a week and love meeting our colleagues weekly for collaboration. If you like, you can of course work from the office every day.Company? FINN.no in Norway, Bilbasen and DBA in Denmark, Oikotie and Tori in Finland, and Blocket in Sweden, recently joined forces, collectively forming Schibsted Nordic Marketplaces. Together, we serve over 325 million monthly visits in the Nordics. By joining forces, we are on a transformative journey toward becoming a next-generation marketplace. To achieve this ambitious goal, we're building a marketplace platform that will propel our verticals (Jobs, Mobility, Real Estate, ReCommerce) to a leading position in all countries. Our technology unit is instrumental to our success story, deploying new code to production over 1800 times per week.Why us? In this role, you will have an unique opportunity to build and form the Data Warehouse for Nordic Marketplaces to empower the organisation to take data driven decisions. We believe that the best solutions come in collaboration with others and that freedom and a sense of responsibility are more effective than detailed management.Sounds like your cup of tea? Check out the details below!WHO ARE YOU? A data wizard with at least Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (Computer science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance) Passionate about data as basis of analysis and decision support Profound business understanding and communication skills Manages fundamental data modelling techniques relevant to data warehousing Experience with our tech stack or equivalent ETL/ELT tools like Talend, BODS, Informatica or other data wrangling tools like DBT, Databricks, Fivetran, Spark, Airflow etc and you don’t need ChatGPT to write your SQL Experience with AWS services like Snowflake, S3, Lambda or other cloud platforms and comparable tools 
WHAT’S THE JOB LIKE?Day-to-day work & projects cookingAs a part of our team you will work in close collaboration with both domain teams and analysts as well as your peers within our team and sister teams. Having a structured and analytical mindset is essential, as well as being able to decipher domain data models and data products, and transform those into analytical models to support business requirements by analysts and other stakeholders. You will be working with building high quality data pipelines to feed those models for different verticals as well as horizontal models across. This will be done using the Schibsted Common Analytical Model as one of the core building blocks.ColleaguesWe are a large, distributed and highly diverse team spread across most out the Nordics and Poland. Our team consists of 12 people, with broad diversity in both background and age-span. We're part of the data platform area, together with other teams like data platform engineering, data management, recommendation as well as data enablement teams for data science and data mesh. We are one out of 50 teams of talented individuals with diverse backgrounds, intellects and identities.We work closely with the technical domain teams to understand the data we are dealing with as well as our main stakeholders within insight and analysts as well as functions like finance and sales. We work according to agile principles with continuous deployment and improvements. We meet up several times during the year in our different locations.Not everything is cotton candy clouds, so here’s the main opportunity to improveRight now we are navigating around in the new, Nordic organisation, balancing both the legacy systems while building the new stuff, which is both demanding and exciting at the same time.On the other hand, this brings along a great opportunity to leave your fingerprint on how our future Data Warehouse is drafted and to support the rest of the organisation with key metrics and analyses both during and after the transition! Is your curious mind asking for this kind of adventure?GOT YOUR ATTENTION? Let us hear from you!If you are looking for a workplace and the role in which you could share your knowledge and expertise, learn and grow, get inspired, be yourself, and make a difference, let us hear from you by 20.11.2023. We value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds.QUESTIONS?Engineering Manager Kristin Hybertsen is happy to provide information about the daily work and answer any questions you may have about the role. Kristin is best reached through Linkedin or email kristin.hybertsen(at)schibsted.com

required_skills: Analytical Skills, Data Engineering, Data Mining, Data Science, Deep Learning, and Natural Language Processing (NLP)Data Visualization, Predictive Analytics, Statistical Data Analysis, and Statistics
location: Dagmar · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  2 weeks ago  · 27 applicants
job_description:
“Meillä kaikki tyypit ovat piinkovia asiantuntijoita, joilla on usein monta rautaa tulessa, mutta täällä huokuu sellainen hyvä tekemisen meininki ja arvostus toisiamme kohtaan.”Dagmarissa meitä ajaa ihmisten lisäksi datalähtöinen näkökulma markkinointiin ja olemmekin yksi Suomen suurimmista markkinointitoimistoista. Seuraamme alan muutossuuntia globaalisti ja haluamme olla askeleen edellä siinä, mitä asiakkaamme tulevaisuudessa tarvitsevat.Asiakkaamme ovat kiittäneet meitä tuloksellisuudesta, eri toimialojen ymmärtämisestä, vahvasta digitaalisuudesta, modernista markkinointiosaamisesta sekä vastuullisuudesta.Kanssamme pysyt aina ajan tasalla, maan parhaiden asiantuntijoiden seurassa.Millaista meillä on tehdä töitä?Pääset osaksi kunnianhimoista, mutta rentoa ammattilaisten työyhteisöä. Olemme kiinnostuneita näkemään asiat toisin ja luomaan rohkeasti uusia polkuja. Meille hakeutuu ihmisiä, jotka arvostavat vahvaa ja kannustavaa yhteishenkeä ja inspiroituvat yhdessä tekemisestä. Sparraamme päivittäin toinen toisiamme, sekä jaamme tietoa ja taitoa koko yhteisön hyväksi. Haastamme tekemistä ja ajattelua hyvässä hengessä.Meillä on huikea työyhteisö, jossa tekeminen on hauskaa ja työtä tehdään tiiminä. Saat joustavuutta ja vapautta päättää miten työtäsi teet – arvostamme aidosti työntekijöidemme näkemyksellisyyttä ja luovuutta. Tuemme sinua kehityspolkusi määrittämisessä ja työssäsi menestymisessä. Saat tehdä työtä sillä tavoin, miten se sinulle parhaiten sopii - esimerkiksi viihtyisällä toimistollamme Helsingin ydinkeskustassa tai etänä, siellä missä luovuutesi kukkii parhaiten.Meille on tärkeää olla inhimillinen työnantaja, ja haluamme tukea työntekijöidemme kokonaisvaltaista hyvinvointia tarjoamalla esimerkiksi mahdollisuuden käyttää osan työajastasi itsesi kehittämiseen tai liikuntaan. Lisäksi tarjoamme tietenkin lounasedun, polkupyöräedun, kattavan työterveyden, sekä erilaisia mielen ja kehon hyvinvointiin liittyviä etuja.TyönkuvaEtsimme tiedolla johtamisen yksikköömme Advanced Analytics -tiimiin vahvistusta tuotteidemme kehittämiseen ja niiden käyttöönottoon asiakkaillemme. Tehtävänäsi on kehittää uusia markkinoinnin mittaamisen palveluita asiakkaillemme, joissa hyödynnetään tekoälyä ja algoritmeja sekä automaattisia dataputkia. Tehtävä edellyttää vahvaa menetelmäosaamista, mutta myös markkinoijien päivittäisten käytännönläheisten ongelmien ymmärtämistä.Arvostamme kokemusta ja sen tuomaa näkemystä. Toivomme, että olet toiminut kehitys- ja asiakastyön vastuullisessa roolissa jo useamman vuoden ajan. Työskentelytapasi on itsenäinen, toimeen tarttuva ja ripeä, et pelkää vastuuta. Olet utelias ja nöyrä oppimaan jatkuvasti uutta. Siedät kiireisiäkin tilanteita, pystyt johtamaan aikaasi ja osaat pyytää apua, kun sitä tarvitset.Toivomme Sinulta Intohimoa kehittää tulevaisuuden markkinoinnin mittaamisen työkalujaVähintään 3 vuotta kokemusta vastaavanlaisista tehtävistäLaajaa menetelmäosaamista (esim. AI/ML/Customer analytics)Monipuolista työkalujen ja kielien tuntemusta (R, Python tai vastaava ja SQL)Kokemusta työkalujen ja menetelmien hyödyntämisestä käytännön ongelmiinTuntemusta pilvipalveluistaKykyä toimia itsenäisestiHalua oppia jatkuvasti uuttaSoveltuvan koulutuksenSuomen ja englannin kielen sujuvaa kirjallista ja suullista taitoaEsiintymisvalmiutta.
Lisäksi Arvostamme Kokemusta asiakas- ja myyntityöstäKokemusta Google Cloud PlatformistaKokemusta projektien johtamisesta.
Kiinnostuitko? Hienoa! Lähetä hakemuksesi, palkkatoiveesi ja CV:si viimeistään 5.11.2023. Käsittelemme hakemuksia jo hakuaikana. Haastattelut alkavat marraskuun aikana.Lisätietoja antaa Ilkka Keskiväli (Director, Advanced Analytics) p. +358 40 861 8967 25.10. klo 10–12 ja 2.11. klo 10–12.Dagmarin joukkueessa on 200 datavoimaisen markkinoinnin erikoisosaajaa. Tänä päivänä olemme yksi Suomen suurimmista markkinointitoimistoista. Menestyksemme perustuu osaamisen jatkuvaan, systemaattiseen kehittämiseen yhdessä asiakkaidemme kanssa. Seuraamme alan muutossuuntia globaalisti ja ennakoimme tulevaa valmistautumalla hyvissä ajoin myös huomisen palveluihin. Asiakkaamme ovat kiittäneet meitä tuloksellisuudesta, eri toimialojen ymmärtämisestä, vahvasta digitaalisuudesta, modernista markkinointiosaamisesta ja vastuullisuudesta. Kanssamme pysyt aina ajan tasalla, maan parhaiden asiantuntijoiden seurassa.

required_skills: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Cloud Computing, Databases, Extract, Transform, Load (ETL), Microsoft Azure, and SQLData Modeling, Infrastructure, Master Data, and Microsoft SQL Server
location: Cloud1 Oy · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  1 month ago  · Over 50 applicants
job_description:
Cloud1 tunnetaan vaativien integraatio-, arkkitehtuuri- ja dataratkaisujen toteuttajana. Tehtävämme on kehittää asiakkaidemme liiketoimintaa ja tuottaa heille kilpailuetua. Teemme sen rakentamalla älykkäitä pilvipohjaisia ratkaisuja Microsoft Azure -teknologialla. Olemme monialainen dataosaajien joukko, ja ainutlaatuinen tapamme työskennellä on saanut laajasti kiitosta. Näemme, että maailmassa on paikka meidän tavallamme tehdä asioita.Kiinnostavatko sinua Azure tekeminen sekä data platform kehittäminen? Ovatko visionäärisyys, modernit teknologiat, työympäristö sekä järkevät toimintatavat sinulle avaintekijöitä? Meillä tehdään töitä hyvässä hengessä yhteistyössä kumppaneiden ja asiakkaiden kanssa. Edistämme aidosti niin omia kuin asiakkaiden kyvykkyyksiä hyödyntäen Azuren teknologioita ja käytäntöjä.MeistäOlemme nopeasti kasvava Azuren data-analytiikka ratkaisuihin erikoistuva konsulttitalo, joka auttaa yrityksiä maksimoimaan dataan pohjautuvan päätöksen teon ja sen hyödyntämisen potentiaalin. Arvoihimme kuuluvat – Inhimillisyys, Reiluus, Visionäärisyys, Ammattimaisuus sekä Asiantuntijuus, mitkä näkyvät toiminnassamme. Cloud1 on 2012 vuonna perustettu neljän Microsoftin teknologiaekspertin toimesta. Nykyään yli 70-henkinen yritys koostuu raudankovista osaajista sekä tulevaisuuden lupauksista. Meillä on vankka ymmärrys integraatioista, tietokannoista, raportoinnista sekä infrastruktuurista. Olemme Microsoftin kumppaneita seuraavissa kategorioissa: Digital & App Innovation, Data & AI sekä Infrastructure, jotka mahdollistavat pääsyn ensimmäisten joukossa uusiin teknologioihin sekä toimimisen haastavissa ja mielenkiintoisissa projekteissa. Takana on jo yli 600 Azure- ja data-alusta projektia.Meillä pääset toteuttamaan vaihtelevia ja haastaviakin hankkeita yhdessä alan kovimpien osaajien kanssa. Rohkaisemme sinua kehittämään osaamistasi jatkuvasti, ja tarjoamme käyttöösi aina uusimmat Azure-teknologiat. Vaikka saatkin vapautta ja vastuuta työsi tekemiseen, emme Cloud1:lla työskentele yksin. Tiimi ja koko Cloud1-yhteisö ovat aina tukenasi rennolla ja hyvällä meiningillä ilman turhaa byrokratiaa. Tervetuloa mukaan innostavaan ja kehittävään työyhteisöön!TehtävänkuvausAzure Data Engineer -roolissa suunnittelet ja toteutat teknisiä ratkaisuja vaihtelevissa pilviprojekteissa alan uusimmilla teknologioilla. Hyödynnät osaamistasi tietokannoista, integraatioista ja tietomallinnuksesta asiakkaidemme liiketoiminnan kehittämiseksi. Voit vaikuttaa omaan tehtävänkuvaasi osaamisesi, vahvuuksiesi ja toiveidesi mukaan.Sinulla on muutaman vuoden kokemus tietovarastoinnista (esim. ETL) tai integraatioista, ja erityisesti Microsoft SQL Server -tietokannoista. Toivomme sinulta teknisten taitojen lisäksi kokemusta tiimityöstä asiakasrajapinnassa ja kykyä edistää kehitystyötä itsenäisesti. Arvostamme kokemusta Azuresta, Microsoft on-premises -analytiikkaratkaisuista ja Master Data Managementista, mutta kokemusta tärkeämpää on halusi oppia ja kehittyä kivenkovaksi Azure-osaajaksi.Azure Data Engineerin työtehtävät voivat vaihdella projekteittain, mutta tehtäviisi voi kuulua esimerkiksi: Tietovarastojen ja data-alustojen suunnittelu ja toteutus Azure-pilvessäDatan integrointi eri järjestelmistä AzureenAnalytiikkaratkaisujen suunnittelu ja toteutus Azure-pilvessäDatamallinnuksen suunnittelu ja toteutusTietoturvallisuuden varmistaminen datan käsittelyssäTiimityöskentely asiakkaiden ja muiden sidosryhmien kanssa
Työhön liittyvät edutHaluamme sinun viihtyvän meillä ja suoriutuvan työsi tekemisestä niin, että sinulla on siihen tarvittavat edut ja työvälineet. Tätä tukeaksemme tarjoamme sinulle:Modernit työvälineetKannustava bonusmalliHenkilöstön palkkiorahasto ja osakeantiSertifioinnit ja erilliset koulutuksetLaaja työterveyshuolto sekä vapaa-ajan tapaturmavakuutusLiikunta- ja kulttuurietu, hierontaetu, työmatkaetu ja lounasetuPuhelinetuOma CS & PUBG-tiimi sekä erilaiset harrastekerhotVirkistystoiminta – tapahtumat ja yhteiset aamiaisetAamiais- ja välipalatarvikkeet toimistollaVuosittainen etätyömatka mukavien työkavereiden kanssaToimistomme sijaitsee Vuorikadulla aivan Helsingin ytimessä, hyvien kulkuyhteyksien äärellä. Työtä tehdään hybridimallilla eli osittain toimistolla ja valitsemastasi paikasta.Kiinnostuitko?Hae uuteen vakituiseen tehtävään alla olevan painikkeen kautta, tai ota yhteyttä ja kysy lisää! Hakuaika päättyy 31.10.

job_description:
Looking to showcase your talent in a leading global technology company?Basware, an established high-growth tech company operating around the globe, seeks a skilled and experienced(Senior) Data Scientistfor our Networked-AP area at Basware.As a (Senior) Data Scientist, you will be working with invoices, purchase orders, and other associated data. In the role, you will be responsible for leading Networked-AP’s data science activities and actively contributing towards data strategy. You will work with our existing machine learning features and create new features in collaboration with the development teams. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to make a significant contribution to Basware’s business success by increasing data literacy and leveraging data across the organization.The ideal candidate has extensive hands-on knowledge of statistics, machine learning, SQL databases and has experience in training machine learning models at scale. We are looking for a candidate who has M.Sc. or above in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.Other qualifications: Excellent understanding of machine learning algorithms.Excellent ability to solve data science problems with code (Python / R).Expert in data visualization and storytelling.Good communication skills and ability to guide and mentor other data practitioners.Basic understanding of cloud architecture (AWS, Azure, GCP).Basic understanding of ML operations. 
At Basware, we have diverse multi-national teams, and our preferred language of communication is English.Next stepsWe would love to hear from you! Go to careers.basware.com and click "I'm interested". In case you have any questions about the position, our recruiter Jaana (jaana.kettunen(at)basware.com) is happy to answer.Our recruitment process will include pre-employment actions such as security background and reference checks.Our offeringWe offer flexibility in how you work, giving you the freedom and support to deliver your best results. As a company, we are committed to your well-being and want to make sure you have an excellent work-life balance. We offer you an opportunity to build your career in an international environment and to develop and learn continuously.Your office will be in Espoo, Tampere, or Pori, but you also have a flexible opportunity to work partly remotely with our hybrid working model.In addition, we offer: Competitive salary and company incentive programLunch and recreational benefitHome use monitorOccupational and mental health servicesHobby clubs and gymFree parking spaceBicycle or subsidized commuter ticket benefitEmployee awards and team social eventsGood learning opportunities, e.g. LinkedIn Learning licenseand more!

required_skills: Analytical Skills, Analytics, Data Analysis, Data Analytics, and MathematicsCommunication, Key Performance Indicators, Looker (Software), Mobile Games, and Statistical Analysis
location: Netflix · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  1 week ago  · Over 50 applicants
job_description:
Next Games is a Netflix Game Studio, focusing on creating compelling fans-first interactive experiences by combining the stories of well-known movies and shows with engaging game mechanics. An unwavering focus on fans and fun gameplay is at the core of the studio’s game development, free from the constraints of free-to-play.As a Senior Games Analyst you will be an integral part of our very international Business Intelligence team working in Helsinki, Finland. We are looking for someone with both experience with and passion for analyzing mobile games, and a knack for unearthing actionable insights for game teams and related stakeholders.In this role you are both expected to take on analytics ownership for one of our game titles, as well as act as a mentor to other analysts in the BI team. In addition, you will play an important role in supporting our stakeholders with the design and implementation of larger model applications such as churn/retention prediction. We also partner closely with the Netflix Games Data Science & Engineering team through mutual initiatives across the games portfolio around building predictive models, conducting statistical analysis and deriving business insights.As a Senior Games Analyst, Your Responsibilities Will Include Working as a dedicated analyst for one of our game titles, carrying out various tasks to help the team meet their data-related needs, such as:Help design and implement actionable KPIs in the subscription-based business model, and provide actionable analysis based on theseProvide analysis on the in-game economy (inflation rate, bottlenecks, churn rate, etc.) in collaboration with the development and production teamsDesign and build actionable dashboards for monitoring and reporting, and educate and assist other end users in doing the same to increase self-serve capabilitiesDesigning, building and maintaining our game data pipelines in collaboration with our data engineers to meet specific reporting and analytics needsTaking an active role in feature planning and mapping out the future of the respective game title in collaboration with the game teamHaving a proactive approach to analytics - actively communicating findings and methodologies to the game team and other stakeholders, and proposing new ideas for tools, processes and practicesActing as a mentor for more junior team members to aid with their career development and help level up the BI teamDevising methodologies around testing and validation (including A/B testing) for new and existing gamesOther broader research initiatives as they come up
Requirements Extensive practical quantitative and statistical analysis experience, including advanced statistical methodologiesPractical experience with designing and running A/B testsPractical experience in a general data analysis language such as SQL, Python/RExperience with data modeling, schema design, and designing and building robust data pipelinesExperience with BI tools such as Looker, Tableau or PeriscopeExcellent communication skills, and the ability to turn mathematical analyses into clear action As a senior, you are naturally able to own and prioritize your work, manage deadlines, and help others do the same
Appreciated, But Not Hard Requirements A degree (BS/MS/PhD) in a quantitative field (econometrics, mathematics, physics, statistics, engineering, economics, etc) helps us assess your skills. But, if you have the skills without a degree in a relevant area, we’d still love to hear from you.Prior experience with similar work in the gaming industryPrior experience specifically with using Tableau as a primary BI toolPrior experience with mentoring other team members or leading small teamsPrior experience with designing and implementing Machine Learning models and experiments

job_description:
Innostaako sinua numeroiden ja datan pyörittäminen? Oletko ylpeä viestinnällisistä taidoistasi? Haluaisitko tehdä töitä sosiaali- ja terveydenhuollon datan parissa?Jos vastasit kyllä, voit olla meidän etsimä Data Coordinator! Me Nordic Healthcare Groupilla teemme yhteiskunnallisesti merkittävää työtä suurella sydämellä ja välittävien kollegoiden ympäröimänä. Autamme asiakkaitamme rakentamaan parempaa ja vaikuttavampaa sosiaali- ja terveydenhuoltoa, joka edistää potilaiden ja loppuasiakkaiden hyvinvointia.Meidän Solutions-liiketoimintamme keskittyy tiedolla johtamiseen ja tuemme asiakkaitamme paremmassa päätöksenteossa erilaisten datavetoisten tuotteiden avulla. Datakoordinaattori on avainroolissa kehittäessämme tiedolla johtamisen tuotteita ja palveluita asiakkaillemme, ja tiivis yhteistyö muiden dataosaajien kanssa on edellytys tehtävässä onnistumiselle. Tehtävässä pääset uppoutumaan esimerkiksi suunterveydenhuollon tuotteisiimme, mutta myös tilanteen mukaan työskentelemään muiden sosiaali- ja terveydenhuollon osa-alueiden parissa.Datakoordinaattorina tehtäviisi kuuluu datatuotteisiin ja -projekteihin liittyvä tiedonkeruu ja tiedonkeruuprosessin kehittäminen. Tehtävään sisältyy jatkuva kommunikaatio asiakkaan puolen datan toimittajien kanssa, varmistaen että heidän toimittama data on oikeassa muodossa tuotetiimin käytettävissä. Lisäksi datakoordinaattorina seuraat ja kehität datan laatua ja eheyttä yhdessä muiden NHG:n asiantuntijoiden kanssa.Meillä NHG:llä... Tulet työskentelemään aidosti merkityksellisten teemojen ympärillä ja saat vastuuta heti ensimmäisestä päivästä lähtien – tarjoamme sinulle rutkasti oppia ja sopivasti haasteitaPääset osaksi tunnetusti loistavaa työyhteisöä ja avointa ilmapiiriä – meillä tehdään töitä asiantuntevasti, mutta pilke silmäkulmassaSaat tueksesi kannustavat ja iloiset työkaverit – meillä kollegoiden kanssa pääsee viettämään aikaa myös työn ulkopuolella, mm. tiimipäivien, urheilutempausten ja afterworkien muodossaSinua on vastassa oma Buddy, joka on nimetty juuri sinulle – Buddy auttaa sinua pääsemään osaksi NHG:n porukkaa sekä tukee työhön ja organisaatioon liittyvissä kysymyksissäSaat työtilat ja työkaverit Helsingissä, Tampereella, Oulussa, Jyväskylässä, Kuopiossa tai Kouvolassa, mutta myös joustavan mahdollisuuden työskennellä etänäSaat käyttöösi työsuhde-etumme, joihin kuuluu mm. lounasetu, virike-etu, työterveysvakuutus, sairaan lapsen hoitopalvelu ja työsuhdepyörä
