job_title: Data Science Manager (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
required_skills: Data Science, User Experience (UX), and User Interface DesignBusiness Insights, Cluster Analysis, Cost Engineering, Market Analysis, Neural Networks, Predictive Modeling, and Quantitative Data
location: Agoda · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  2 weeks ago  · 10 applicants
job_description:
About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.Get to Know our Team:The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.The Opportunity:We think of Data Science in Agoda differently. For us, a data scientist is a fusion of core production skills with analytic and business skills. We’ve brought top talents from (literally) all over the world who focus relentlessly on building products which utilize ML and AI as their main edge. We know that when you infuse ML and technology, you move from good to great and that is our mission. Our Data Science managers are action driven leaders that can form vivid vision and successfully direct their people to execute it while being strongly rooted in the details and practice.As a Data Science Manager, you will:Drive the growth of your team and build a diverse, entrepreneurial team. You are a developer of people. You love leading diverse teams of professionals with both qualitative and quantitative backgrounds using data-driven and insights-led approaches to respond quickly in a dynamic, competitive, and fast changing industry.Get your hands dirty. Tackle complex problems in the online travel and ecommerce space using a range of ML and data analysis methods. Use our huge data repositories to push our business metrics to their bounds, directly and indirectly. Foster a culture that constantly raises the bar for us and others and supports the freedom to explore and innovate.Work on tough problems. Can we detect causation between metrics and bookings? How can automatically answer our users’ questions? How do we tune our AB testing platform to ensure we aren’t optimizing noise? How do we measure experiment success to properly trade off type I and II errors? What is the ideal caching strategy for prices and how do build an ML model to implement it? How can you detect anomalies within more than one million time-series that we track daily? Can you separate between bots and human traffic? Can you make our across-data-centers replication into smart replication using ML models? These are just a few of the diverse questions we tackle and some which you will lead your team to crack. You will be impacting every aspect of the business and it will require various techniques, from diving deep into data with SQL and Big Data tools, all the way to deploying modern machine learning models.Deliver results. Work directly with the heads of the business departments and the product management team. Influence them with compelling product ideas based on data insights that can move the dial on our business.In this Role, you’ll get to:  Balance quantitative data analyses with qualitative user insights to uncover how our users book travel to drive new and existing product impactBuild, validate, test, and deploy machine learning or other data science models to predict and influence the behavior of consumers with the goal of optimizing products & processesTest and validate insights via rapid experimentation and deploymentInterface with business/operation teams and key stakeholders at all levels to formulate solutions & product changes informed by your findingsLeverage data to help the business answer questions around further expansion, products, process optimization, cost optimization, customer acquisition/retention/churn and any other business goals that can be addressed through data insightsForm strong, cross-functional relationships with designers, product managers, software developers, and marketers who build, design, and optimize our technology and tools
What you’ll Need to Succeed: Vast analytical problem-solving capabilities & experienceExperience in leading a team of both researchers and analysts preferably in an ecommerce, tech, banking, advertising or management consulting environmentStatistical knowledge and extreme proficiency in SQL. Comfortable with R, Python and Tableau. Experience with big data technologies (Hadoop/Vertica) is a plusStrong understanding and implementation experience of predictive modeling algorithms such as regressions, time series, neural networks, clustering, decision trees and heuristic models, with familiarity dealing with tradeoffs between model performance and business needsExperience combining user research and data science methodologies across multiple products and teamsExperience with research applications pertaining to user experience, marketing, and market insightsFantastic communication skills that enable you to work cross-functionally with product managers, tech geeks and design gurus, building solid relationships with a diverse set of stakeholdersThe ability to convey complex solutions to a less technical personBias for actionAdvanced degree (MSc/PhD) in Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Operations Research, Physics or Mathematics/Statistics preferred
We welcome both local and international applications for this role. job_title: Enterprise Architect, Financial Crime Prevention Architecture
required_skills: Architecture, Architecture Governance, Business Architecture, Communication, Crime Prevention, Enterprise Architecture, Enterprise Solution Design, General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), Technical Solution Design, and Technology Architecture
location: Nordea · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  5 days ago  · 4 applicants
job_description:
Job ID: 19964 This is an opportunity for you to make a difference in shaping the future of Nordea’s financial anti crime landscape as part of the Financial Crime Prevention Architecture unit in Group Architecture. We are now looking for an Enterprise Architect to define the future architecture for this area that is of critical importance to the bank and that will in the coming years be executing some very large and exciting change initiatives.About this opportunityWelcome to the Financial Crime Prevention Architecture unit. Our key focus is to drive the vision and strategy for the financial crime prevention domain in the bank and support change initiatives to deliver IT solutions that meet both short and long term expectations. We design our solutions using modern architectural patterns and state-of-the-art technology, all from selecting and integrating external standard solutions to developing or adapting custom solutions. We are looking for an experienced enterprise architect with an agile mindset who will take responsibility for developing the vision and target architecture needed for supporting the financial crime prevention processes in the bank. As Enterprise Architect, you’ll play a central role in proactively driving the creation of the business and IT architecture needed to support a very complex and fascinating area of the financial services industry.What you’ll be doing: Be responsible for developing the business vision and strategy for the financial crime prevention domain in Nordea.Be accountable for developing transition and target architectures that provide explicit guidance and steering for the area.Provide architecture solution design and architectural leadership that includes creation of content relating to business, application, data, process and technology architecture viewpoints. Collaborating closely with business stakeholders, other architects and the technology organization.Provide architectural leadership and guidance for the major change initiatives in the area. Provide support with architecture governance for the area and educate and assist stakeholders with Group Architecture’s governance framework and associated processes. Provide guidance to business stakeholders, architects and other team members as needed. You will play a lead role in a team of experienced architects that has the mandate to define the future architecture for a very important area in the bank. 
Who you areCollaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us. To succeed in this role, we believe that you: Communicate and influence at all levels of the organisation and explain complex concepts in clear and understandable ways to anchor the architecture perspective.Build effective relationships with other architects and stakeholders across the organisation to facilitate alignment of the enterprise architecture in relation to other domains.Fluent in English and having excellent communication skills with the ability to document and present complex topics to different audiences.Keep focus on your own continuous development and learning as well as mentor others to build knowledge and improve overall effectiveness.
 Your experience and background:  10+ years of work experience in architecture and related areas.Strong background in driving vision and strategy work in business architecture. Solid experience in solution, data and technology architecture.Demonstrated ability to drive development of target and transition architectures and to craft fit-for-purpose solution design content that provides explicit guidance for large and complex transformation initiatives. Proficient with business analysis, software engineering, integration and orchestration, technical solution design, and risk and quality management.Prior experience in full-service banking, e.g. from the Financial Crime Prevention area or across lines of business i.e. Retail, Wholesale, Institutional, Wealth and Insurance.
 If this sounds like you, get in touch! Next stepsSubmit your application no later than 06/11/2023. At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are. Only fo candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.Only fo candidates in Poland: Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

job_title: Senior Threat Detection Engineer - 5G Cybersecurity Platform
required_skills: Computer Science and CybersecurityCommunication, Ethical Hacking, Information Security, Network Security, Penetration Testing, Problem Solving, Vulnerability Assessment, and Vulnerability Management
location: Ericsson · Jorvas, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  1 day ago  · 32 applicants
job_description:
About This OpportunityJoin our dynamic team as we build a cutting-edge 5G cybersecurity platform to safeguard telecom networks worldwide. These networks play a crucial role in establishing national mission critical networks that will shape the future of the connected world. We are committed to ensuring the safety and security of these networks by providing relevant and up-to-date monitoring and mitigating for potential threats.What You Will DoAs a Threat Detection Engineer, you will be responsible for analyzing threats specific to the telecom context and developing detection rules based on various attack scenarios. This role requires a deep understanding of different attacking techniques and tactics outlined in frameworks such as the MITRE ATT&CK, D3FEND and FiGHT frameworks. The protected environment primarily relies on Linux and cloud-based systems, making proficiency in these areas essential.Key Responsibilities: Analyze threats to the telecom context and identify potential vulnerabilities.Develop robust detection rules based on known attack scenarios and emerging threats.Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure the effectiveness of detection mechanisms.Continuously monitor the threat landscape and stay updated with the latest attack techniques and tactics.Test and refine detection rules to enhance accuracy and minimize false positives.Contribute to the improvement of the overall cybersecurity architecture and strategies.
You will bring  Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or a related field.Proven experience (3+ years) in hands-on development of detection mechanisms to protect enterprise or government security contexts.In-depth understanding of open source and commercial security tools in the Linux and cloud domains. (e.g. Splunk, Falco, Crowdstrike, AWS/Azure/GCP security tools)Familiarity with frameworks such as MITRE ATT&CK and their application in threat detection.Proficiency in analyzing network traffic and logs to identify potential threats.Strong problem-solving and analytical skills to assess complex security issues.Excellent communication and collaboration abilities to work effectively in a team environment.Ability to adapt quickly to evolving technologies and industry trends.
Why Join Us: Opportunity to work on a groundbreaking 5G cybersecurity platform that will shape the future of telecom networks globally.Be part of a product development organization composed of industry-leading experts in telecom security and product development.Collaborative and inclusive work environment that encourages innovation and professional growth.The chance to contribute to global cybersecurity and protect critical networks.
If you are passionate about cybersecurity and possess the required skills and experience, we invite you to join our team. Apply today and help us build a secure future for telecom networks worldwide!Why join Ericsson?At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and inventiveness to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.What happens once you apply?Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.]]>

job_title: People Leader in KYC Customer Risk Scoring
required_skills: Data Analysis and Data AnalyticsAnti-Money Laundering, CTF, Coaching, Communication, Counter-Terrorist Financing, KYC Verification, Leadership, and Presentations
location: Nordea · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  1 day ago  · 4 applicants
job_description:
Job ID: 17366  We are looking for a strong KYC Risk Specialist who will lead the KYC Customer Risk Scoring team in the Know Your Customer (KYC) organisation in Group Financial Crime Prevention (GFCP). This is an opportunity for you to be a part of Nordea’s Financial Crime Prevention and you will be working with highly competent people in an energetic and dynamic organisation. Compliance and integrity go hand in hand. It’s all about making sure that we’re a trusted partner to both our customers and society – the foundation for great customer experiences.That’s where you come in. Working with us, you’ll help ensure that compliance underpins every decision we make and every action we take.Together, we are passionate about building a Bank that makes a difference – one where you can learn and grow. Will you help us lead the way in embedding compliance to transform the future of banking?Your future responsibilitiesYou will have a crucial role in ensuring the safety and soundness of our operations by leading our Know Your Customer (KYC) risk scoring team and be responsible for developing and implementing robust customer risk assessment methodologies. You will be defining the requirements towards the KYC tools in Nordea as well as ensuring that risk issues are addressed appropriately as well as risk based. What you’ll be doing: Formulating and executing the strategic vision for KYC Customer Risk Scoring in alignment with Nordea’s overall risk management objectivesDesigning and refining risk scoring models to accurately identify and quantify potential risks associated with customer onboarding, transactions, and existing accountsEnsuring compliance with all relevant regulatory requirements and industry best practices related to KYC, Anti-Money Laundering (AML), and Counter-Terrorism Financing (CTF), ensuring that our customer risk scoring methodology is taking the most recent movements in the market into considerationLeveraging data analytics and machine learning techniques to enhance the accuracy and efficiency of customer risk assessmentWorking closely together with other experts in Know Your Customer and Collaborating with various departments, including Compliance and Operations to integrate risk scoring systems seamlessly into our operationsEngaging, coaching and empowering team members to make sure that project deliverables and goals are metLeading a team of highly skilled professionals across the Nordics and with ambition to move into Poland and Estonia
Welcome to a very international team, with highly skilled specialists in Know Your Customer, the daily language will be English as we have staff in all Nordic capitals, Poland and Estonia.Who you are Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. The four key values that guide us in being at our best and that we expect all our colleagues to be committed to. To build a successful career with us, you’ll work well with others and always act with the customer’s needs in mind. You love learning and trying new things, and you’re excited about bringing your ideas to the table. You’re honest and dependable, willing to speak up even when it’s difficult, and committed to empowering others. You’re passionate about doing a great job.You are structured and have high quality standards, and you always strive to find the solution that is best for Nordea. Your background: Skilled people leader, with documented experience in leadership Proven experience in risk management, particularly in developing risk scoring models and methodologiesIn-depth knowledge of KYC, AML, CTF, and relevant regulatory frameworksProficiency in data analysis toolsExcellent communication and presentation abilities to interact with stakeholders at all levelsExperience from building and/or maintaining Risk Scoring Models or MethodologiesProfessional certifications in risk management will be a plusPrior experience in the financial services industry, particularly in banking or fintechProfessional English skills
 If this sounds like you, we look forward to welcoming you to the team!  Next stepsSubmit your application no later than 03/12/2023. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Bjørn Wegener, +45 25292855, wegener@nordea.com.At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are. Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered. Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

job_description:
Are you ready to bring the future to our customers and boost their performance? We are now looking for a Reliability Engineer to our industrial internet solutions in Pulp and Energy business!We believe you are currently working as a Reliability engineer in the industry and have knowledge of the needs and problems regarding reliability that our customers encounter, and want to take the next career development step.We are looking for a customer-oriented reliability and maintenance professional, who have genuine interest in using data for improving our customer´s performance and reliability. We expect you to share our passion for technology and the commitment to move our customer’s performance forward, as well as our internal development targets.Key accountabilities: You improve our customer’s performance and reliability by using data and solutions.You continuously develop new VII offering applicable for Pulp and Energy Services in good co- operation with Valmet VII team, Agreement team and other stakeholders.You continuously identify new ideas from customers and colleagues, and drive R&D initiatives.For assigned reliability applications you will be the Product owner.You give proactive technology and sales support for Valmet Area Sales Organizations and Agreement business.You actively follow-up markets and competitors offering.
We expect you to have Experience as a reliability engineer, from our customer´s industry and an understanding of their needs and problems regarding reliability and maintenance.M.Sc. or B.Sc. in engineering, pulp and/or energy technology, automation, physics, information technology or another relevant field. Basic knowledge of pulp and energy technology and process is preferred.High interest in developing new solutions and applications. Experience from industrial internet and data analytics is an advantage.Experience of working in customer interface, sales experience is an advantage.
In addition, you communicate fluently in English and either Swedish or Finnish. Willingness to travel globally is also essential. You have excellent communication skills which enables you to operate in a global business environment. You have the ability to quickly build relationships and achieve results both individually and as part of a team.We offer a great opportunity to take part in the important development of our Pulp and Energy Services Industrial Internet offering and business, in an international and inspiring working environment, where you will be able to develop your professional skills and enjoy rewarding challenges.In this role, you will be a member of our Global Agreement and Lifecycle Concept Development team in Pulp and Energy Solution (PES) and work in close co-operation with our central Valmet Industrial Internet (VII) team. The position is preferably located in one of our major office locations in Sweden or Finland, but other locations are also an option.Interested? If this sounds like something you are looking for and you are ready to go forward with your career, send your application with your CV already today, we work with continuous selection so the position is filled when the right candidate is found, the job add expires 30 November 2023. Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.For more information about this position, please contact Robert Kölby, Senior Manager Agreements and Lifecycle Concept Development, Pulp and Energy Solutions, +46706091337, robert.kolby@valmet.com.When everything works togetherValmet is where the best talent from a wide variety of backgrounds comes together. Our commitment to moving our customers’ performance forward requires creativity, technological innovations, service know-how – and above all, teamwork.Join the team! www.valmet.com/careers

required_skills: C (Programming Language), Programming, and Software DevelopmentC#, Communication, Computer Performance, Desktop Computers, Multithreading, Software Design, and Windows Desktop Administration
location: UL Solutions · Espoo, Uusimaa, Finland  1 week ago  · 11 applicants
job_description:
Job DescriptionTechnology is an indispensable part of our daily lives. But how do you find the devices that will deliver the best performance for your professional and personal needs?UL benchmarks help people measure, understand and manage computer hardware performance. We create the industry's most trusted and widely used benchmarks for desktop computers, notebooks, tablets, smartphones, and VR systems. 3DMark — The Gamer’s Benchmark — is used by hundreds of press publications and millions of gamers, overclockers, and system builders around the world.We are looking for a Windows Software Developer to join our growing Procyon development team. We create the industry's most trusted and widely used benchmarks for desktop computers, notebooks, tablets, smartphones, and VR systems. Our development culture values innovation and personal initiative. We are looking for a developer who is able to design, implement and maintain reliable cross-platform solutions using modern working methods and quick release cycles.You will be working with a team of passionate and highly skilled engineers that take pride in developing high-quality software.Responsibilities Design and develop new benchmark tests from start to finish Design and develop new applications to support our benchmark development on all aspects of an application’s life cycle Collaborate with engineers from our industry partners Analyzing data to make development decisions 
QualificationsWho you are  You are passionate about technology. You are quick learner who loves new challenges At least 5 years of experience in software design and development using C# or C++ in a Microsoft Windows desktop environment. You have worked in project teams using the Agile/Scrum methodology. You have successfully delivered products to customers. You are familiar with concepts such as UI programming, multithreading, and unit tests. Good communication skills. 
Bonus points  For being passionate about computer performance For Java development experience For Adobe products, Microsoft Office products, or other popular industry-standard programs For scripting software automation For web development 
What’s In It For You You’ll have a meaningful impact on the way people compare and choose the devices they rely on every day. You’ll have the power to make decisions and play a key role in shaping the future of computer performance benchmarking. Work and learn with a team where everyone is enthusiastic and always wanting to help others. Lot’s of freedom to select the tools and methods you use to do computer performance benchmarking. We will provide the environment and hardware you need to succeed. You will have possibility to build your own pc if you wish to You’ll work at the cutting edge of new technology, an excellent opportunity to improve your existing skills while learning new ones. We encourage a healthy work-life balance, with flexible working hours Be part of our community. Launch parties and weekly breakfasts at the office. Even if you work full-time remotely, we can arrange online team events . Mission: For UL, corporate and social responsibility isn’t new. Making the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place has been our business model for the last 125 years and is deeply engrained in everything we do. You will shape the way we approach and deliver our solutions to promote safe living and working environments for people everywhere. People: Ask any UL employee what they love most about working here, and you’ll almost always hear, “the people”. Work with colleagues, who you can listen and learn from and challenge each other so that you can continually push for excellence and results. Interesting work: Your work at UL will challenge you to try fresh approaches, be empowered to drive change and help you gain in-depth experience in your field. And as a global company, in many roles, you will get international experience working with colleagues around the world. Grow & achieve: Growth and development are part of our DNA. Grow & achieve with targeted development, reward and recognition programs as well as our very own UL University that offers extensive training programs for employees at all stages as well as a technical training track for applicable roles. 
UL is a global safety science organization with more than a century of expertise and innovation in the fields of product safety testing, inspection and verification services. UL partners with businesses, manufacturers, trade associations, regulatory authorities, and governments to play a key role in the development and harmonization of national and international standards.We create 3DMark, PCMark and VRMark, the world’s most popular benchmarks. We work with leading technology companies to develop benchmark tests for PCs, notebooks, tablets, smartphones, and VR systems. Our software is used throughout industry, by hundreds of press publications, and by millions of people around the globe. Find out more at https://benchmarks.ul.com/.Working at UL is an exciting journey that twists and turns daily. We thrive in the twists and revel in the turns. This is our every day. This is our normal. Curious? To learn more about us and the work we do, visit UL.com

job_title: Senior Server Engineer, Hay Day or Brawl Stars
required_skills: Databases, Linux, and Shell ScriptingApplication Servers, Concurrent Programming, Data Architecture, Distributed Systems, Java, Scripting, and Server Side
location: Supercell · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  6 hours ago  · 32 applicants
job_description:
We are now looking for experienced Senior Server Engineers to join either the Hay Day, Clash of Clans or Brawl Stars team. As a Server Engineer at Supercell, you are an integral member of a game team, working closely with other game developers and focusing on making sure that our hundreds of millions of monthly players get the best, most uninterrupted experience possible. Depending on the game and your own interests, you can focus more on the general game server infrastructure or new game feature development – and sometimes you do both.Communication between server engineers in different game teams is absolutely vital to our success. Our server engineers frequently share learnings, both successes and failures, across game teams to make each team better. You must be humble, pragmatic and willing to admit and explain your mistakes. That way, the next time something goes wrong, we'll all be better prepared.If you have experience in developing live systems and using virtualized computing, and you understand what it means to support a system with large user volumes, you might just be the person we're looking for!Responsibilities Design, implementation, deployment and maintenance of highly scalable and available backends for live gamesContribute to best practices on reliability and availabilityTroubleshoot and tune high-volume sharded database systemsPeriodically offer round-the-clock, first-line support to the production environments, as part of a rotating on-call dutyGame teams are typically small, and server engineers will also have the chance to contribute to game design discussions
Requirements Excellent Java programming skills, including experience with server-side Java, concurrency handling, and distributed systemsGood experience with Linux shell and scripting languagesDatabase design and implementation skills, and good SQL knowledgeExperience with cloud computing (e.g. AWS) and TerraformBeing passionate and committed to tasks, and in general an autonomous person with high levels of initiative and energyAn open and respectful attitude towards others and their work
Nice-to-haves Knowledge of network protocols and non-blocking IOPrevious working experience on high-throughput live systems is a big plus. If absent, then at least a solid appreciation of the challenges involved is expectedPrior experience in game development is a plus but not required as long as you are passionate about gamesExperience in server development without application servers
Benefits And CompensationLuring you in with glitter, glamour, and gems is not what we seek to do. We develop Supercell as an employer for you to do your best work and to call this the best experience in your professional life.We want you to enjoy your time here fully, so we structure our compensation and benefits to serve this purpose. It starts with perceiving you as a human being, not a resource.About SupercellWe are a game company based in Helsinki, Finland, with offices in San Francisco, Seoul and Shanghai. Since our launch in 2010, we've released five games globally – Hay Day, Clash of Clans, Boom Beach, Clash Royale and Brawl Stars.To make five games, we've killed dozens along the way. That's because we're obsessed with quality. Our goal is to make the best games – played by millions, enjoyed for years and remembered forever. To achieve this goal, we create the best possible teams and give them the freedom and independence that are core to our success.You Might Love It Here...If you love to think, talk, play and make games, Supercell is the place for you. We're made up of proactive, independent teams with the freedom to do what they think is best for their players, our games and the company.We know it takes more than independence to make great games, so we also take good care of our people, providing them with the compensation, work environment and resources they need to succeed.This position is in Helsinki, but you're not?Luckily, moving to Helsinki is easier than you might think. No matter where you would be moving from, our dedicated people will help you from beginning to end. We're here to make sure the process is as smooth as possible for you, your family and whoever and whatever you're bringing along.

job_description:
Revvity is currently looking forFinancial AnalystTurku/FinanceThe Turku Site, Wallac Oy, with 650 employees, represents one of Revvity’s major manufacturing and product development sites for newborn, maternal fetal health, and prenatal screening. As the global market leader in newborn screening, our solutions have tested over 560 million babies worldwide for life-threatening diseases.The Revvity finance team is focused on driving value creation and keeping the company financially safe, while growing personally and professionally. We are goal-oriented, collaborative and enthusiastic to develop but still have eye for detail.As a member of Revvity finance team, you will participate in the execution of the annual operating plan, product costing, monthly forecast process and Financial Reporting and Analysis for the Global Operations team covering Turku and Baesweiler Operations. The successful candidate must have good communication skills in Finnish and English, analytical and dynamic mindset, excellent IT skills and effortless multicultural social skills.We are looking for candidates who display high potential for professional growth to take on more senior responsibilities in the future. As a team, we will support you in learning to excel in this position, and grow your skills for any future challenges.Responsibilities include: Various management accounting tasks such as monthly financial analysis, forecasting and month-end closing activities, e.g preparing entries for review and booking the entries in SAP.Annual product costing and budgeting.Delivering accurate and timely business intelligence to Operations leadership and finance teams.Collaboration with key internal stakeholders (local/global).Utilizing business intelligence systems and developing financial reporting tools.
Role Requirements: Master’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Management, or related field.Proficiency in IT skills is required, e.g Mastery of Excel is a prerequisite.Good verbal and written communication skills and data-driven analytical mindset.Good Finnish and English skills.Eager to learn.Highly motivated goal-oriented self-starter.Excellent interpersonal skills.
What we offer: Inspiring leadership and exceptional employees.Continuous learning, personal and professional growth.Dynamic and innovative culture.Collaborative and diverse environment.
Revvity Turku Site is a drug free site and a medical examination for new employees includes a drug test.If you are interested in the position and feel that you have the necessary skills and experience, please apply as soon as possible, at the latest by November 5th via the link below. Please note we will start interviews as soon as we find suitable candidates.

job_description:
Job ID: 20163 Welcome to the BISO (Business Information Security Officer) team! We add value by challenging and supporting the business areas to improve their information security capabilities and ways of working. As BISO, you’ll play a valuable role in bridging the core security functions with the Nordea business. What you’ll be doing: The Business Information Security Officers (BISOs) team is part of the 2. line Group Security Officer organisation.The BISO team enable 1. line in understanding, identifying, managing and monitoring information security risks and requirements, as well as translating and advising on how risks can impact business. We support business COOs and their management teams in understanding how information security threats affects their business, and how they should consider to protect what is important to the business areas and their customers.Together with the teams in Chief Security Office the BISOs perform information security best practices and frameworks, and monitor framework efficiency.The BISOs participate in various risk fora and information security communities.
 You’ll join a team of dedicated and skilled security professionals. The role is based in Finland, Sweden or Poland.Who you are Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  To succeed in this role, we believe that you: Can juggle many topics and activities at the same time.Can balance information security risks with business opportunities.You are a team player able to express information security concepts in business terms.
 Your experience and background:  You have comprehensive information security experience.Bachelor's degree or higher in any of the related sciences is relevant (e.g. Technology, Information Technology, Information Security). However, please also contact us if you have been working in the field of information security for a long time and have another background.
 If this sounds like you, get in touch! Next stepsSubmit your application no later than 14/11/2023. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Ole Madsen.At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are. For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

job_description:
Job ID: 17474Would you like to join our international team, to support us in work on Adobe Experience Platform? We are now looking for a Senior IT Analyst to help us with a mission of simplifying and transforming our business & IT landscape.  In Nordea, we’re harnessing the power of technology to reinvent the future of banking. A tech revolution is underway – and you can make an impact. Though we’re a Nordic bank, we’re also one of the largest IT employers in Tricity and Warsaw. Working with international teams in an inspiring working environment, you’ll have lots of opportunities to expand your skills and advance your career. About this opportunity Welcome to the Agile Execution team. We are a part of Data Systems in Group Data Management Office. As the Senior IT Analyst, you’ll play a valuable role in building and supporting strong and productive teams. What you’ll be doing: Helping to design advanced solutions around Adobe Experience Platform & DataCreating and maintaining relevant documentation including requirements, functional and technical specification that define and support the solutionActing as a bridge between business needs and developers, to ensure the delivery of high quality IT solutionsWorking closely together with stakeholders across Nordea to understand the expected outcome and elicit business featuresManaging delivery dependencies towards other teams and organization units across NordeaWorking in an Agile environment as an integral part of the cross-functional agile delivery team 
You’ll join a team of great individuals, where continuous learning is a virtue. The role can be based in Gdynia, Gdańsk, Warsaw or Helsinki. Who you are Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us. To succeed in this role, we believe that you have: Experience with data analysis (Excel, SQL)Experience working with distributed systems Experience collecting and managing business requirements to design, develop and deliver IT solutionsAbility to understand and to create technical documentation (i.e. Confluence)Excellent communication and stakeholder managementGood understanding of the Agile mindset and valuesExperience working with business end usersAbility to grasp new technologies quickly (on high level) and ability to ask right questions 
Desirable:  Previously worked on implementation of various Adobe Experience Cloud technologies, especially Adobe Experience Platform and/or Adobe Campaign

required_skills: Build Strong Relationships, Complex Transactions, Data Privacy, Internal Investigations, Legal Advice, Legal Compliance, Legal Matters, Policy Writing, Presentations, and Professional Skills
location: dentsu · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  1 day ago  · 45 applicants
job_description:
Job Title:General CounselJob Description:Join our team at Dentsu as an ambitious and experienced legal professional, ready to embrace new challenges and contribute to shaping our success here in Finland and the Baltics. This role is tailor-made for individuals with a keen commercial outlook and comfortable providing professional and strategic support to our Finnish and the Baltics leadership and organization. Be a part of our journey to excellence!About the role:The General Counsel for Finland and the Baltics oversees legal matters at an executive level in Dentsu Finland and Dentsu Baltics. We are looking for a commercial legal executive with experience in fast-paced, customer-focused settings. You should possess experience in industries such as Technology, Media, and Telecommunications (TMT), consumer markets, or other dynamically changing fields. International exposure and a broad legal skill set encompassing commercial law, contract management, IP, IT, data protection, and compliance are crucial. While optional, DPO capabilities are beneficial, and HR-law knowledge is a plus.The ideal candidate is proactive, hands-on, and solution-oriented. They build strong relationships with local leadership, brands, and networks. People leadership skills are vital, and adaptability in an innovative, fast-paced environment is key. A business mindset aligning with company needs is essential. Reporting primarily to the EMEA Deputy General Counsel and secondarily to the CEO in Finland, the position is based in Helsinki.The role is currently envisaged to be part-time (3 days/week).Key accountabilities:  Provides legal advice to Dentsu at all levels, ensuring compliance with laws and safeguarding business interests. Drafts and negotiates complex contracts, aiming for advantageous terms. Supports commercial teams in negotiations for favorable legal and business terms. Conducts training and risk management for senior management. Assists the executive team in strategic legal matters. Regularly reviews project progress and takes corrective actions. Establishes best practices in compliance, contracts, IP, data protection, IT, litigation, and M&A. Develops employees, aligns legal priorities, and optimizes outside counsel use. Manages litigation efficiently, reporting to senior management. Leads legal and compliance projects, including potentially acting as DPO for specific markets. Understands business needs while ensuring compliance with laws and regulations. Results-driven, commercially-minded "Business Partner" to Dentsu's leadership in Finland and the Baltics. Proactively engages with the market leadership team. 
Professional skills: Around 8-10 years of post-qualification experience, including some law firm background. Qualified to practice law in Finland. Ideally have knowledge/experience of working with the Baltic countries. Proven leadership in handling complex transactions. Significant experience and knowledge of key legal principles relating to commercial law, contract management, intellectual property, IT, data protection, and compliance. Employment law knowledge is a plus. Skilled in risk management, compliance programs, policy drafting, and training. Experience in leading internal investigations and working with regulators. Familiarity with financial principles and corporate governance for multinational companies. Effective senior management communication and presentation abilities. High integrity and emotional intelligence (EQ). Fluent in both Finnish and English. 
About dentsu:Dentsu Group is a global marketing communications company headquartered in Tokyo, Japan. It is one of the largest advertising and media firms in the world. The company offers a wide range of services in advertising, marketing, communication, and digital media, catering to clients across various industries.We help clients to win, keep, and grow their best customers and achieve meaningful progress for their businesses with the best-in-class services and solutions in media, CXM, and creative. For more information please see: www.dentsu.com.The dentsu L&C team comprises approximately 250 lawyers and compliance and data protection professionals across the world.Working with us:Joining dentsu, you’ll join a team of 48,000 people. It’s an opportunity to produce career-defining work. Along the way, you’ll team up with inspiring colleagues and encounter a richness of clients, cultures, and experiences.  We offer exciting challenges, a great working environment, memorable experiences, and opportunities to shape your future.Additional information:We offer a part-time permanent position with a 6-month probationary period, and you will be based at our office in Helsinki, Finland. We look forward to receiving your application.For any questions, please contact:Linda Ye, Talent Acquisition PartnerLinda.ye@dentsu.comLocation:HelsinkiBrand:DentsuTime Type:Part timeContract Type:Permanent

required_skills: Coaching & Mentoring, Continuous Process Improvement, Kaizen, Lean Processes, Lean Projects, Observation, Operational Excellence, Resolving Issues, Statistical Analysis, and Workshop Facilitation
location: Nordea · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  1 week ago  · 26 applicants
job_description:
Job ID: 19681 Would you like to work as Operational Excellence (OX) Expert Supporting Group Business Support Operations? We are now looking for an Operational Excellence/Lean Methods Expert to manage and develop the OX methodology and support with the implementation of it in Operational Service Lines. We enable and initiate sustainable Continuous Improvement activities leading to great customer experiences and improved efficiency in Nordea Operations.In Nordea, we know that great customer experiences require a team that leads the way in first-class service and operations. We’re more than just a Nordic bank, we’re one of the largest employers in Poland. With us, you’ll work with skilled, international teams in a bright, modern office. The lively and collaborative atmosphere offers plenty of opportunities to learn and grow as you build your career with us.About this opportunityWelcome to the Operational Excellence and Data unit within the Automation, Data & Change organization. As the Operational Excellence/Lean Methods Expert, you’ll play a valuable role in shaping the way Operational Excellence as a capability is further implemented and developed in Nordea Operations – the part of the organisation running all of Nordea’s customer related operations and thereby supporting the Business Areas in delivering products and services to our customers.What you’ll be doing: Drive implementation of Operational Excellence/Lean system (Daily Management, Continuous Improvement, Structured Problem Solving, Gemba walks, Layered Audit etc.) in service environmentFacilitate Kaizen events and other improvement projectsSupport the business in resolving issues, using the known Lean and 6S tools, the CI methodology, Kaizen events and Problem Solving as a way to improve Quality, Delivery, Cost and Employee SatisfactionCatalyse improvement culture by sharing, implementing, and sustaining best practices across different service linesDevelop and deliver Operational Excellence/Lean training programmes together with Nordea Learning Team
You’ll join a fun, collaborative and dynamic team with great atmosphere. Our team consists of experts from different Nordic locations and Poland. job_title: Master thesis AI for 5G/6G Radio Networks
required_skills: Computer Science, Data Science, Pattern Recognition, Programming, and Programming LanguagesCommunication, Java, Problem Solving, Wireless Engineering, and Wireless Technologies
location: Ericsson · Jorvas, Uusimaa, Finland  1 week ago  · 31 applicants
job_description:
Why join Ericsson?We are a world leader in the rapidly changing environment of communications technology – by providing hardware, software, and services to enable the full value of connectivity.You’ll play a part in using your skills and creativity to push the boundaries of what’s possible. To build never-seen-before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems.Join a team of like-minded innovators driven to go beyond the status quo to build what’s next.At Ericsson, you can be an explorer, a change maker and a force for good.Our purpose: To create connections that make the unimaginable possible.Our vision: A world where limitless connectivity improves lives, redefines business and pioneers a sustainable future.Our values: Our culture is built on over a century of courageous decisions, in a place where co-creation and collaboration are embedded in the walls and where our core values of professionalism, respect, perseverance and integrity shine through in everything we do.About This Opportunity5G and 6G technologies are developing fast to meet the demands of the future. The growing traffic in wireless networks combined with the emergence of new services and devices leads to new challenges. To address these challenges, new methods involving AI and machine learning are essential.You will join a team within Ericsson Research focused on developing solutions for future wireless networks. Our work extends to novel applications like AR/VR and industrial use cases, including remote-controlled robots and machines.While our team is based in Jorvas, Finland, we collaborate closely with Ericsson teams worldwide.In this master thesis project, you will explore how machine learning can be used to optimize the performance of 5G and 6G networks for time critical communication.You’ll get the opportunity toCollaborate with your supervisor around selected features within the dynamic 5G/6G network landscape.Your mission? To apply the power of machine learning to optimize these features across diverse traffic patterns. You'll use a sophisticated system simulator, meticulously crafted to model various aspects of the wireless network.You will detail your work in a master's thesis, sharing your discoveries for the teams at Ericsson dedicated to this dynamic field.Key Skills Ongoing studies in telecommunication, computer science, or related fieldsProficiency in programming languages, such as Java or Python.Proficiency in digital and wireless communications.Proficiency in machine learning.Independent working ability with collaboration skills.Strong analytical and innovative problem-solving skills.
What We OfferInterns who join us will enjoy an outstanding chance to make connections, to make change, to make a real difference. We are always looking for interns to become permanent members of our Ericsson team, so you’ll have the opportunity to discuss your future with us during your internship.Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we cultivate it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team.Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. required_skills: Finnish and SwedishBudgeting, Customer Profitability, Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG), Financial Understanding, Microsoft Dynamics 365, Presentations, SAP Products, and Statutory Accounting Principles (SAP)
location: Orkla Finland · Vantaa, Uusimaa, Finland  1 week ago  · 33 applicants
job_description:
Orkla Care Finland provides Finnish homes with high-quality products for personal wellbeing, health and wound care, for home care and cleaning, as well as basic garments and underwear that fit the Finnish taste. Sustainability is part of everything we do and we want to make sustainable choices easier. This is why we continually develop products, where we take the environment into account both in production and use. Our most well-known brands are Möller, Nutrilett, Sana-Sol, Jordan, L300, Salvequick, Norlyn, Pierre Robert and Black Horse. In 2021, our turnover amounted to 60 million euros and we had 79 employees.Are you looking for a new challenge in finance to further develop your skills as a BI & Sales Controller? We are waiting for your application to join our experienced and energetic Finance team in Vantaa!You will be responsible for developing the Business Intelligence environment and providing the organization with financial insights into the business in a proactive manner.You will develop the BI landscape, e.g. Power BI & SAP analysis to support business in Finland in order to make data easily available for decision-making, forecasting, and the budget process. There is a strong focus and support in the Orkla group on BI development.Additionally, your focus will be on monitoring and presenting customer profitability, analyzing campaigns, and supporting with forecasting, on a regular basis and ad hoc. You deepen financial understanding with employees and play an active role in delivering reports and challenging colleagues in the sales department. You support sales to achieve their financial targets and help them in the budget and planning process. You will report to the Finance Manager in Finland.You are curious and determined, easy to approach, with commitment, engagement and the will to bravely create and contribute to a successful business. You are a team player and react with speed to changing circumstances and working conditions according to business needs.This is what we look for in our new employeeEssential to your success is relevant experience in BI systems and controlling. If you have worked in an FMCG business, SAP, or D365 FO environment, it will be an asset to you. We expect you to have a relevant education and to be fluent in both written and spoken Finnish and English. Knowledge of Swedish is an advantage. You have a good ability to structure and analyze complex information and make it understandable for employees on all levels. Additionally, you have excellent Excel skills.As a person, you are structured, analytical, and innovative with a strong drive to develop and the ability to execute.What can we offer?At Orkla , you are constantly learning – from different brands, experiences, people, markets, parts of the value chain, training, and ways of thinking. We are focused on providing new ways for people to develop different skills and how to use them to enhance the difference you can make – to Orkla brands, to the business, and to the world.We are committed to providing our employees with a dynamic environment surrounded by credible and trusted brands and countless opportunities to learn and grow. There are many companies to believe Orkla is the right place for you to work, here are some of the reasons why Orkla offers a unique and energizing workplace that encourages both commercial curiosity and freedom to fly.The ability to work with strong local brands combined with the backdrop of a growing international company, gives our employees the opportunity to really make a difference and see the impact of their work.We are part of Orkla Health portfolio company, and you can find more information about Health at https://www.orklahealth.com/Locally, we operate under the name Orkla Care Finland which is formed by two companies: Orkla Care Oy and Pierre Robert Oy. Find out more about our local businesses:https://www.orkla.fi/tietoa-meista/orkla-care-finland/Locally we can offer you:  Significant role in a constantly developing and growing business Professional development within an experienced team A great working atmosphere and caring culture - We Care! Personnel discounts on our own products Discount on various services and products through the employee benefits program Wide health care services including dental care Sports, culture, and lunch benefits Mobile phone benefit Flexible work community – we love to meet at the office but also work from home
For further information on this exciting role, reach out to Mika Häkkinen, Finance Manager, by phone +358 40 722 4219 on Thursday 26th October at 14-15, Tuesday 31st of October at 15-16, or Thursday 9th of November at 15-16.Excited to join our talented team? Please submit your CV and application with a salary request by 12th November 2023. As we are keen to have the new colleague onboard, we will start reviewing applications during the application period.Please note that we are not able to receive applications via email due to GDPR reasons. Click the link below to apply for the position.

job_description:
Join Nordcloud and make your mark on the European IT industry. Help our clients thrive on their cloud journey in solution areas such as infrastructure, migration, data, and security.Currently, we are looking for an Azure Cloud Architect for our team in Finland. Your daily responsibilities: Participating in various customer projects, from new infrastructure builds and migrations to audits and big dataImplementing cloud infrastructure to deep-diving with our customers by giving workshops and design recommendations to technical teams and stakeholdersYou will become a trusted advisor for high-profile enterprises and jointly manage the customer relationship and roadmap with the Nordcloud account teamHaving the opportunity to engage with our customers from the very start of the customer journey to the cloud and own your role in the customer projects until it’s finished
As we have varying opportunities to work internationally, some readiness to travel in Finland and other locations in Europe is required.We are looking for you to check our requirements within the: Hands-on experience with network, security, storage, and databases within Azure You know your way around the building blocks of Azure
Hands-on experience with automation and Infrastructure-as-Code tools (like Terraform, or similar) You like automating tasks and hate doing manual changes
Experience with scripting Comfortable in one programming language (like C#, Python, bash)Comfortable with the shell and Azure-CLI tool.You use scripting to automate and create glue code between services
Communicating, designing, and guiding the implementations of our customer cloud solutions We favor clear-minded, curiosity, and attention to detail over extensive but messy knowledge

As you work directly with customers, social skills and a customer service attitude are a mustFluent communication skills in English and Finnish
We encourage you to apply, even if you don’t meet all of the requirements. We value your growth potential and enthusiasm!What do we offer in return? Individual training budget and exam fees for partner certificationsFlexible working hours and hybrid/remote working modelLaptop and equipment of your choiceLocal package such as extensive private health care and wellness benefits
Please read our Recruitment Privacy Policy before applying. All applicants must have the right to work in Finland.About NordcloudNordcloud, an IBM company, is a European leader in cloud advisory, implementation, application development, managed services, and training. We are triple-certified across Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud and Amazon Web Services, and we are recognized as a 'Visionary' by Gartner for Public Cloud IT Services. With 10 European hubs and over 1300 employees, we are known for our innovative cloud-native solutions and we have delivered over 1000 successful cloud projects.Learn more at nordcloud.com and follow the #NordcloudCommunity.

job_title: Country Manager for LYKO- the up and coming beauty playground in Finland
required_skills: Beauty, Commercial, Cosmetics, E-Commerce, Management, Marketing, Omni-Channel Marketing, Retail, Sales, and Skin Care
location: LYKO · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  1 week ago  · Over 50 applicants
job_description:
We're not like everybody else. Maybe you aren't either? Are you fierce when it comes to maximizing sales, building brands, and bubbling with exciting ideas and energy? Tired of hearing no and staying inside the box? You know you have the potential to create something big, you just need to get the chance. This is your platform! We are a challenger in the beauty industry, and while we have a market leading position in Sweden and are concurring shares of the finish market day by day– the main part of the journey is still a head of us.Today, we are present in 8 countries, and one day we’re gonna be the greatest in Beauty Europe- to make that happen we believe that a local presence and adaptation are keys to success! You are most likely brave enough to test different ways that turn out to be wrong – we firmly believe that taking these risks are necessary for finding out what's truly right! The only thing we won't budge on is the way you go about things: humbleness, teamwork, and enjoying the ride are all cornerstones of our business culture, and you will be an important bridge to your market!So, what´s up in your market then?📍Today, we are serving the finish beauty shoppers online as well as in our Flagship store in central Helsinki. We have a local organization, with Retail, Marketing, and Customer Services, doing magical stuff with the finish market. With the guidance of YOU, your business smartness and understanding of local needs and opportunities, together with the power of our central organization, the Finnish business and organization will excel further- and so will you!Job description (or source of joy, challenge, adventure, focus area or whatever word you wanna use)As Country Manager your focus will be on the overall, omnichannel, Commercial opportunities in your local market. While you identify opportunities and brings the power of local, you pair up with the central organization to maximize the strength behind your efforts, and to further build out opportunities that comes through inclusion and synergies.Local Marketing will report into you, and while other teams are reporting in respective centralized streams globally (such as Retail and Customer Service), you will facilitate and role model collaboration and team spirit across the local teams, as well as for collaborations between the local commercial team and centralized, global, teams (such as Online, Strategy & Brand, etc). Increasing sales, margins, and profits 📊 deep dives into numbersBuilds out and nurtures relationships with local suppliers and brands🤝 can we elevate each other?Increasing brand awareness using a marketing strategy that challenges and stand out🔊 don’t be afraid of increasing the volume, the bigger risk lies in not being heard
We can promise you that you will be faced with many challenges and things to do that we haven’t listed above, not because we are sloppy, but because we like to build the rocket ship while riding it- and hey, this role is actually fresh from the oven, no one has had it before, so no blueprints should be expected.Okay, let´s say that again- this role is a new one. While we recently installed the roles of Country Managers in our emerging markets earlier this year, we now will do this for our mature markets in the Nordics as well. As we grow our organization, market shares, and business presence, we are reshaping our ways of working, and believe in a model of centralized functions together with local organizations. Have we gotten the hang of it yet? Nope! Are we feeling some pain due to this? Yep! Are we learning, calibrating, and celebrating where we can? Absolutely!Who You AreExperience-wise, there are several different possibilities that might have prepared you for this role. You have previously grown a plant from a seed – in any field! Maybe you built an organization, a brand, or a business? We don't like long lists of requirements – it's your individual skills that count in the end, but ok, here's our best guess: You have experience from the beauty industry and have established great relationships within it. While you know the ins and out of this industry, you are not determined to keep the status quo of it. Let´s change things up!As a relationship builder, you easily identify relevant stakeholders on the partner and supplier side, and know how to get them engaged.With a mind for numbers and strong business acumen, you enjoy diving deep into the numbers, analyzing trends, and identifying opportunities.Revenue, sales margin, share of sales; you speak the language and loves to translate it into real business impact.What does commercial strategies and plans look like in a beauty context? When the profit is lagging behind- who are the usual suspects, and how does one pinpoint the strongest category opportunities? You have delivered the answers for this in your earlier positions.Solid understanding of how to build and develop a brand, and how to do it with a touch of crazy.Great Omnichannel experience.Experience from leading others. You know how to create engagement within a team, and you are a true coach as well as learner of your peers.You have successfully used your skills in creative problem solving and am not afraid to approach a challenge you haven’t faced before. While you are at it, we hope you share your learnings with the rest of us!As our voice in the local market, you need to be fully fluent in Finnish, and English.
So, gorgeous, is this you? And if so , are you ready to join the party?Apply quickly and easily, no resume or cover letter needed!Does this sound like the right job for you? Apply quick and easy without a CV or cover letter! Instead, we ask you to answer some short questions. Please apply as soon as possible, but no later than 14th of November, 2023.Any questions about the journey ahead and what we're looking for will be answered by our Chief Sales Officier, Nordics (potentially your new manager), Lotta Onajin, lotta.onajin@lyko.com. For questions about the hiring process, please contact our Talent Acquisition Friend, Anna.stenbeck@lyko.com Mindful of data privacy, we kindly ask you not to send us any resumes over email.
 
So, what´s up in your market then?📍

At Tieto Germany, our development and consulting portfolio ranges from industry solutions and data-driven business to customer experience management and SAP services for digital consulting and transformation. required_skills: Data WarehousingFinancial Consolidation, Hyperion, Hyperion Financial Management (HFM), Solution Architecture, and System Administration
location: Talented: a Witted company · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  1 week ago  · 6 applicants
job_description:
Cargotec is at the forefront of the transformation in the cargo handling industry. Our cargo handling solutions and services make global trade smarter, better and more sustainable. As leaders in ports, on roads, and at sea, our business areas Kalmar, Hiab and MacGregor have a unique position to optimise global cargo flows and create sustainable customer value.Are you a passionate finance technology professional? Do you know Hyperion (HFM) like the back of your hands? Cargotec IM is now looking for an experienced Solution Architect to strengthen the technology and process competence in the Hyperion team!As a Solution Architect at Cargotec, your main responsibility is to manage our Hyperion (HFM) application. You will get to lead the development of the HFM solution landscape according to our HFM roadmap in order to better support our business in our strategic targets. This includes the development and maintenance of, for example, the metadata, security, calculation rules, and data conversions as well as the interfaces to and from the application. In this role you will get to build new things, for example through application rebuilds, as well as clean and update old structures.Although the work itself is quite independent, you won’t be left alone in this role as you will have your team members to rely on. Additionally, we work in a cross-functional setup meaning that you will also get to engage with various stakeholders in Business, Finance and the rest of the IM functions. Together, you will collaborate to develop the application and provide solutions for ongoing projects. As an expert of HFM you will also get to support and train users globally as well as correspond to monthly maintenance tasks.To succeed in this role… In order to succeed in this role, you should have strong practical knowledge of data warehousing, specifically of the Hyperion (HFM) finance consolidation system. You also need a strong background in transferring business requirements into system solutions as well as designing solutions based on enterprise level architectural guidelines. Hands-on expertise in customising as well as readiness to manage configurations will also come in handy in this role.As a Solution Architect, you will be guiding the development of the HFM application forward and therefore we expect you to have a relevant Master’s or Bachelor’s degree and at least 5+ years of relevant work experience from e.g. change management and application administration tasks. A can-do attitude with a positive and collaborative approach will also help you collaborate and achieve the tasks at-hand better.Why should you join our team?We’re offering you a position as a driver of strategy execution and an active role as a digital trailblazer to make an impact in our global organisation and the cargo handling industry. You will get to work together with great colleagues from various backgrounds inspired by shared, ambitious goals. We value collaboration in our open and inclusive culture. You will also get flexible working possibilities, meaning that you can also work remotely from home. If you prefer to work at a proper office, we will have a desk waiting for you either at the Helsinki, Tampere or Kaarina office.We also offer you a comprehensive benefits package geared to boost your health and well-being. As a Solution Architect, performance-based incentives are also a part of your total package and you will get to grow as a professional through all of our learning and development possibilities as well as our career progression opportunities.Join us to make a difference - and have fun while doing it! Submit your application down below. Please note that the interview process may begin with suitable candidates before the closing date of the job posting.Cargotec and its businessesCargotec (Nasdaq Helsinki: CGCBV) enables smarter cargo flow for a better everyday with its leading cargo handling solutions and services. Cargotec's business areas Kalmar, Hiab and MacGregor are pioneers in their fields. Through their unique position in ports, at sea and on roads, they optimise global cargo flows and create sustainable customer value. Cargotec has signed the United Nations Global Compact Business Ambition for 1.5°C. The company's sales in 2022 totalled approximately EUR 4 billion and it employs around 11,500 people. www.cargotec.com

job_title: Senior Developer Relations Manager, Researcher Engagement
required_skills: Analytical Skills, Computer Science, and Pattern RecognitionApplied Mathematics, Communication, Computational Physics, Computer Graphics, Developer Relations, High Performance Computing (HPC), and SDKs
location: NVIDIA · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  1 day ago  · 37 applicants
job_description:
We are looking for a Developer Relations Manager to lead and expand NVIDIA’s engagements with the research community in EMEA . This is a dynamic, leadership role responsible for strategic relationships with top researchers and premier academic institutions, guiding and contributing to programs that help researchers solve their most challenging computational problems using NVIDIA’s technologies and platforms.In this high-profile position you will serve as an expert in research topic areas such as generative AI, LLMs, simulation, computer vision, graphics , and drive engagement with top researchers to increase NVIDIA SDK adoption. You will play a significant role in defining use cases for NVIDIA’s products such as NVIDA NeMo, Modulus, Omniverse, Deepstream, Clara . Ideal candidates will have a technical background in accelerated computing, computational science, computer vision and deep learning . Growing and cultivating relationships with the most influential researchers leading the AI revolution is a critical mission. This role is very closely aligned with our strategic priorities.What You Will Be Doing Develop a rich ecosystem of strategic research partners and help them achieve their goals through close and active collaboration, acting as a technical authority on NVIDIA SDKs and frameworks for consultation and competitive analysis.Promote NVIDIA’s portfolio of SDKs and accelerate its adoption within the academic research community.Champion the use of NVIDIA technology stack among researchers in generative AI, LLMs, simulation, computer vision, graphics .Work with NVIDIA product, program, and engineering management teams to communicate software and hardware requirements that will improve the value of our solutions to the academic community.Collaborate with Deep Learning Institute (DLI), product/framework teams, and NV Research to ensure developer enablement materials are best-in-class and fully aligned with technology roadmaps.Serve as a spokesperson, representing NVIDIA in local and global strategic events such as conferences, workshops, briefings, meetups, and academic seminars.Survey relevant research and business literature to identify emerging trends, notable innovations, and opportunities to improve NVIDIA products, and communicate these insights to internal stakeholders.
What We Need To See M.S./Ph.D. in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Data Science, Computational Physics, Applied Mathematics, or equivalent experience.8+ years of experience with multiple NVIDIA technologies (SDKs), preferably in Generative AI, Simulation, LLMs, Graphics, or Computer Vision.Experience in conducting research in domains such as high-performance computing, computer vision, image analysis and processing, computer graphics, deep learning, simulations, computational physics, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, robotics, digital twins.Experience in working with industry, ideally experience working in industry in a role influencing researchers.Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and local language .Experience speaking publicly to technical and scientific audiences.Proven ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and learn new technologies quickly.Demonstrated ability to influence and work with extraordinary product and engineering teams across multiple levels in the organization.
Ways To Stand Out From The Crowd Existing relationships with a wide range of leading researchers and top research institutions.Experience developing and deploying projects using NVIDIA SDKs.MBA degree with focus on strategic management is a big plus.
NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most resourceful and hardworking people on the planet working for us. If you are creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
