job_title: Expert to KYC Instructions and Procedures
required_skills: Analytical Skills and EnglishCommunication, Crime Prevention, Financial Instruments, KYC Verification, Negotiation, Norwegian, Simplification, and Stakeholder Management
location: Nordea · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  1 week ago  · 10 applicants
job_description:
Job ID: 19913  We are now looking for skilled Norwegian-speaking Expert to ensure the KYC instructions the team owns are relevant in supporting compliance, proportionality, effectiveness and efficiency of KYC processes, and measures across Nordea.  At Nordea, we’re committed to being a partner our customers and society can count on. Compliance and integrity go hand in hand. It’s all about making sure that we’re a trusted partner to both our customers and society – the foundation for great customer experiences. That’s where you come in. Working with us, you’ll help ensure that compliance underpins every decision we make and every action we take. Together, we are passionate about building a bank that makes a difference – one where you can learn and grow. Will you help us lead the way in embedding compliance to transform the future of banking?  About this opportunityWe are KYC Instructions and Procedures team within Nordea Group Financial Crime Prevention in the 1st Line of Defence. We add value by owning and improving Nordea’s KYC Working Instructions, as well as working with implementing new and changing requirements & guidance on the area of our responsibility. We are also constantly engaged with stakeholders across all Business Areas, Group Financial Crime Prevention, Group Financial Crime Compliance and Group Legal to secure high quality KYC processes which are compliant, proportionate, effective and efficient.  As the Expert in the team, you’ll play valuable role in driving continuous improvement and simplification of the KYC instructions end-to-end across all Business Areas and countries. More specifically, you act as subject matter expert for the Working Instructions applicable in Norway. What you’ll be doing: Joining in driving the continuous improvement and simplification of KYC instructions the team owns, and ensuring they remain compliant and relevant for their purpose.Working in initiatives implementing regulatory change and supporting the development of KYC processes in order to strengthen Nordea’s Financial Crime risk management.Participating in team activities to ensure the relevant procedures are functioning end-to-end, such as the process governing the customer regulatory scope or analysis and assessment of new regulations and requirements. Collaborating with stakeholders across KYC unit, Business Areas, Group Business Support function, Group Financial Crime Compliance, and Group Legal.Advising and supporting the business in understanding and managing financial crime risk.Taking ownership of maintaining your own knowledge and awareness of the regulatory & risk environment relevant for KYC.
 You’ll join a team of KYC experts spread across Copenhagen, Helsinki, Gdynia, Oslo and Stockholm with backgrounds from financial crime prevention, compliance, risk, legal and business. The role can be based in Estonia, Finland, Norway, Poland or Sweden.Who you are Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  To succeed in this role, we believe that you: Have experience in KYC measures and in writing instructions or procedures, or comparable experience in the financial industry.Have proven skills with respect to excellent stakeholder management, clear communication both in writing and speaking, as well as analytical and structured approach. Enjoy learning and are excited about driving change and bringing your ideas to the table.Are enthusiastic and drive tasks, and are willing to speak up – even when it’s difficult.Actively live by Nordea’s values of collaboration, ownership, passion and courage.Are fluent in English and in Norwegian, both written and spoken.Are self-driven and take responsibility for your own tasks
 Your experience and background:  In minimum a Bachelor’s degree and 3 years of relevant professional experience or strong background in Financial Crime prevention within the financial industry.Certifications such as ICA, ACAMS or related qualifications will be considered an advantage.
 If this sounds like you, get in touch! Next stepsSubmit your application no later than 14/11/2023. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Tuomas Sarpakunnas, tuomas.sarpakunnas@nordea.com. At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are. Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered. Only for candidates in Sweden - For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com. Only for candidates in Poland - Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

location: UPM - The Biofore Company · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  1 week ago  · 26 applicants
job_description:
Would you like to join a global, growing company that innovates for a more sustainable tomorrow? UPM could be the team for you. We are frontrunners in developing renewable alternatives to fossil-based materials. Besides enabling both businesses and consumers make more sustainable choices, we strive to create a positive UPM experience for all our employees around the world. We live by our values – trust and be trusted, achieve together, renew with courage. Join us in creating a future beyond fossils!We are now looking for a Legal Trainee to join our legal team in Helsinki, Finland, for a full-time and fixed term position (preferably from February to mid-September 2024).Greetings from your future manager“Come and join UPM’s motivated and diverse team of legal professionals. Being part of UPM’s legal team gives you an opportunity to understand and work closely with UPM’s different functions and business areas and build a broad competence. Good collaboration with our functions is crucial for succeeding in this interesting position. Bring your experience and expertise, high performing UPM legal function welcomes your insight!” – Anna Salonen, Group Counsel, ContractingWhat You’ll DoYou will be responsible for and assist Legal Team members in versatile assignments, including: Supporting UPM’s group functions and business areas in various contract law related engagements and contracting process developmentAssisting in legal tech related tasks and projects; andAssisting in other tasks in the legal function, such as information and data collection, legal translation work, preparation of background materials and legal research as well as acting as back-up for our legal professionals.
The Legal Trainee reports to the Group Counsel, Contracting, and is a member of UPM Group Contracting Team.Who You AreWe are looking for a person with positive attitude, service-oriented mindset and genuine interest to learn and grow as legal professional. In this position you will need to be able take ownership of your own work and manage multiple responsibilities and tasks concurrently while remaining focused on the key priorities. In addition, the person we are looking for has: Studies in law, with approximately 50–75% of the studies completedFluent English and Finnish skills, written and oral
Earlier work experience is not a must, but the following are seen as assets: Earlier work experience in law firm or in-house law departmentEarlier knowledge/studies in contract law, IPR, data protection, IT and/or legal tech is highly appreciated
The position will be further tailored depending on the chosen candidate’s background.This Is What We Offer For You A meaningful job – We have an inspiring purpose ‘We create a future beyond fossils. Our work is impactful and transformative.A caring community – Our community is built on great team spirit and shared commitment. We care about each other and the well-being of our colleagues. We support the work-life balance of all our employees.Development opportunities – We offer you great opportunities to learn and grow throughout your career. We are an international, multi-business organization offering plenty of avenues for personal growth.Responsible employer - Sustainability is at the core of everything we do. We are committed to ambitious, science-based sustainability targets in all areas from climate change to biodiversity. We foster diversity and inclusivity, offering a work environment in which everyone can be themselves.
Learn about our Rewarding and our Ways of workingAdditional InformationFor more information, please contact Group Counsel, Contracting, Anna Salonen, tel. +358505549441.Please apply via the link and attach your CV and cover letter latest on 12th of November 2023. Please notice that we will go through the applications already during the application period and may invite candidates for interviews already before the end of the application time.For support with submitting your application, please contact the HR Service Center at careers@upm.com or tel. +358204146600.A security background check may be performed for those selected to UPM positions, in accordance with the company recruitment guidelines and the Security Clearance Act 726/2014.UPM Legal Function is a global function with around 40 professionals assisting UPM’s business areas and global functions in a variety of legal matters, including areas of contracts, corporate transactions and financing, as well as corporate governance and compliance.

job_title: (Senior) Data Architect - Tietoevry Tech Services Finland
required_skills: Big Data, Data Integration, and Data WarehousingData Architecture, Data Lakes, Data Modeling, Data Vault, Real Estate Development Projects, Snowflake, and Snowflake Cloud
location: Tietoevry · Jyväskylä, Central Finland, Finland Reposted  9 hours ago  · 1 applicant
job_description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.Would you like to work in a place which is not just a work but a community where you can exchange opinions and have sparring with your colleagues? A place where you can grow your competence in systematic manner. Would you like to take a dip into lake between meetings? Do you prefer having daycare assistance from your employer in case you child is sick? Is flexibility and balance between work and off-work important to you so that you can for example pick your kids from school during the day without any guilt? Would you like to move into electric car but do not want to own one and instead use company car? Are you a person who likes to work with the latest technology while having experience in transformation projects and want to join one of the largest tech companies in the Nordics? Do you want to be the Merging Force Between Technology and Humanity? Then this is the place for you!Did you know that the Tietoevry is: A workplace where the job grows with youA work environment centered around you
When working for Tietoevry you can: Be the one creating a society for everyone Build a career for the long-runBecome the merging link between technology and creativityMake the impact that you find meaningfulBenefit from our reward system and other bonuses
“That’s great. So, how is the job like?”In this position there are two main directions that you would utilize:  Business to technology: In this direction you would be working closely with customer business, IT and other stakeholders with your Tietoevry colleagues to translate their business goals into IT architecture and finally into technical solutions utilizing cloud native tools and services. Technology to business: In this approach, you would bring thoughts and ideas on how our customers can benefit from cloud solutions in the best possible way.
"This is interesting. What kind of skills should I have?"As an data architect you will be responsible for providing consultancy services in transformation projects for clients. In short, you will help our customers implement their business strategy, by turning their objectives into action.Your key tasks will include delivering consulting engagements. This might include: Over 4 years of experience in a technical customer-facing role in product development and/or other data or SW development projects.Experience in working with cloud environments, preferably Azure, also Google/AWS experience is appreciatedData Platform design, architecting data solutions for analytical and operational use cases, working with DataOps structureHands-on experience in working with big data integration and processing tools such as Azure Data Factory, Databricks and SparkRealtime architecture; streaming dataHands-on experience in working with Data Lakes and Data WarehousesExperience with Snowflake and Azure Synapse and familiarity on SQL and SQL-based analytics. Python, R, or dbtUnderstanding of Public, Private, & Hybrid Cloud StrategiesExperience in Data Vault or other data modeling methodologiesUnderstanding of information security and privacy issues related to cloud solutionsGood communication skills and ability to work independently with the customer representativesFluent in Finnish and English, both oral and in writing
You are the ideal candidate for this position if you have a strong drive combined with a proactive way of working. Delivering superior customer value is your top priority. You have excellent analytical and problem solving skills, and the capability to develop and present clearly high level abstractions. You are an engaged and open-minded team player with excellent communication skills. You are proactive and service-minded in your work and distinctly self-motivated and you enjoy working with clients of different backgrounds and positions.What We Can Offer YouWe offer you a competitive compensation package and the chance to make a difference. With us you will be at the forefront of emerging businesses and technology, exchanging ideas with the best professionals. You will cooperate with colleagues in an international and evolving working environment and increase your knowledge in a variety of areas, from R&D to creative new business models and services.Furthermore we offer you a challenging position with great opportunities for professional growth. With us you will have the opportunity to directly influence your career development. If you have a good idea, people will listen to you. We believe that trust fosters freedom and creativity. Our culture is built on transparency and active sharing – a truly open environment.Land your dream jobDid we get you inspired? We look forward to hearing from you! Send us your application through www.tieto.com/careers. Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we’ll reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today.If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Mauri Tusa, via e-mail mauri.tusa@tietoevry.com.

required_skills: Computer ScienceCommunication, Non-Functional Requirements, Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs), Non-functional Testing, Quality Assurance, Reliability, Reliability Testing, Test Planning, and Test Strategy
location: Nordea · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland Reposted  2 weeks ago  · 31 applicants
job_description:
Job ID: 15280  Would you like to be a part of Quality Assurance community and enable, as well as improve non-functional testing in development initiatives? We are now looking for a non-Functional Test (NFT) Lead who will drive and manage the non-functional testing in Core Banking Programme, and take the NFT centre of excellence team to the next level of expertise. At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger. About this opportunity Welcome to the international team of Quality Assurance. We add value by increasing production stability and cost efficiency while creating and deploying new solutions to our customers. As the NFT Lead for the Core Banking Programme, you’ll play a valuable role in increasing quality of delivered solutions, focusing on the different quality attributes. What you’ll be doing: Responsible for driving NFT activities to meet common goals of Nordea test strategyPrioritise tasks associated with Nordea level SAFe non-functional requirementsContinuous improvements of best practices to ensure applications are delivered as per high Nordea standardsR&D activities to identify and evaluate new NFT toolsCoach and mentor team members for complex NFT challengesAccountable for preparing the Non-Functional Test PlanCommunicate the NFT report to business stakeholders and align on the Go-Live approachOwn the NFT related risks and their mitigation plans
 You’ll work as part of the NFT centre of excellence and will have possibility to share ideas, learnings and get inspirations from some of the exceptionally talented people in NFT area. The role can be based in Nordic capital cities: Stockholm, Helsinki or Poland: Gdynia, Gdańsk or Warsaw.  Who you are Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  To succeed in this role, we believe that you have: Experience in non-functional testing and analysis (performance and/or reliability testing), as well as troubleshooting and optimization of enterprise solutionsAbility to create non-functional testing strategies and execute on the sameProactive, innovative and solution driven mindset. Are eager to learn and comfortable with delivering a variety of tasks in an evolving and changing environmentHigh degree of structure, flexibility, planning and prioritization skills, and deliver in a timely manner, with focus on qualityStrong communication skills
 Your experience and background:  Minimum Bachelor in Computer Science, Information Systems or related discipline, or equivalent work experience10+ years of experience in the non-functional testing disciplineExperienced team lead, accustomed to work with distributed teamsExpert knowledge of Load Runner (Performance Center), JMeter, Gatling, AppDynamics, Burp SuiteExperience in CI/CD / DevOps toolchainsDemonstrated development (any programming language) and automation experienceFluent in English, spoken and written
 If this sounds like you, get in touch! Next stepsSubmit your application no later than 17/12/2023. At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are. For candidates in Sweden only - For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.For candidates in Poland only - Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdfWe reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

job_description:
**This role could also be based in our Warsaw office**At Scandit, we are developing smart data capture technology that enables smart devices to capture data from barcodes, IDs, text and objects. Our newest product, ShelfView, is a machine learning-powered platform for retail that enables real time shelf visibility and empowers more intelligent and efficient store operations. With our scalable data capture technology via robots and mobile devices, retailers are on track to save tens of millions in operating expense and in turn generate tens of million more in value for their customers. For more information, please check our product website.We are now looking for a new colleague to join the ShelfView team and work on providing a scalable backend to power visual product recognition. You will be responsible for evolving our backend to scale product data ingestion and provide low latency recognition.If these challenges sound interesting to you, we’d love to hear from you!***Please note, this role can be based remotely in the following countries: Switzerland, Finland, Poland, France, Italy, Spain, Germany and the UK.***Scandit is a high-growth tech scaleup from Switzerland with offices in Zurich, Boston, Warsaw, London, Tampere, Tokyo and Singapore. (Please note this role may require some travel to our Zurich office from time to time).About The RoleAs a Senior Backend Engineer, you will be helping us to build a stable and scalable backend for visual product recognition. This includes making critical technological choices, design and implementing data stores and pipelines, and optimising low latency recognition services. Additionally, you'll guide and mentor other talented engineers within our team.What You Will Do Designing and managing product data ingestion, storage, processingCreating and maintaining data pipelinesOptimise computer vision model serving in high latency / high throughput as well as low latency scenariosDesign and maintain external and internal service APIsMentor other engineers in the teamProactively drive initiatives and projects, prioritising tasks and resources as necessary
Our Tech Stack Python / DjangoPostgresPubSubGCS / AWSGitlab
Who You AreYou are an experienced software developer who is passionate about building, shipping, and running software products in the cloud. You firmly believe in the power of small incremental changes over major rewrites and emphasise quick feedback in development processes, as well as when mentoring others. Your focus lies on producing maintainable code. You recognise that software development encompasses both technology and human interaction. While you stay on top of the latest tech trends, you value proven technologies. You thrive on tackling open problems, taking ownership and effectively overcoming obstacles.Ideally, you: 7+ years of professional experience as backend engineer shipping software in the cloud.You have played a critical role in shipping products with a server side component that had a scalability challenge (throughput, latency) and using a diverse tech stack.You are involved in a technical leadership role that includes mentorship and project delivery.Are fluent in multiple languages, Python and Golang being your strongest.Have first hand experiences with Databases (schema, document oriented) and -stores, service oriented architectures, cloud data pipelines (stream and batch), Docker, KubernetesAre familiar with TDD, Automation Testing, Continuous Integration, Continuous DeliveryAs a strong plus, you worked on a scalable machine learning model powered product in an industry setting.You are willing to go beyond your role, your team and (sometimes) your comfort zone to make a cross-functional impact on the business
What We OfferHere are just some of the reasons why people choose to build their career at Scandit: A highly skilled team and a fun environment where you can put your enthusiasm for cutting-edge technologies to useExcellent office infrastructure, optimised for hybrid working in Zurich, Warsaw, Tampere, and London.Excellent support for remote work across the UK, France, Italy, Spain, and GermanyInnovation hackathons People-first cultureGlobal team outings Festive/end of year all company celebrations Your birthday off An attractive individual equity plan in a high growth company Do good and give back with 2 impact days where you are able to give time to one of our trusted nonprofit partnersSpecific benefits related to the location you are joining
Who We AreCould your code give superpowers? Whether enabling delivery drivers to make quicker deliveries, matching a patient with their medication or allowing retailers to make store operations more efficient, our technology automates workflows and provides actionable insights to help businesses in a variety of industries. This means we have no shortage of technical challenges for engineers like you. Join us, as we continue to expand, grow and innovate, and help take Scandit to the next level.We are proud to be “GREAT PLACE TO WORK” accredited in the UK, USA, Japan, Finland & Switzerland and “GREAT PLACE TO WORK FOR WELLBEING” in the UK.Imagine The What. job_description:
Position: Data Contributor  Project Location: Finland (Remote) Engagement Model: Task Based  DataForce by TransPerfect is currently looking for contributors to participate in our Human Centric Image Collection project in Finland.  The project seeks to build a large set of annotated images to help machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) systems perform more fairly and ethically across a diverse range of people.  Task description: For the project, you will be required to submit a set of 12 pictures (10 project pictures following our instructions + 2 additional selfie photos). This is a fully remote project and you can participate from the comfort of your home.  Requirements To participate you must meet the following qualifying criteria:  Reside in FinlandBe at least the age of majority under the laws of your jurisdiction. Be able to submit 12 photos with a minimum resolution of 8 MP, following specific instructions shared by our Team. Be able to involve a friend or a relative in the project who is willing to appear on some of the photos (2 out of 12) and to provide their consent, following specific instructions shared by our Team. Read and agree to the project's informed consent form. Provide self-reported demographic information (e.g., ancestry, pronoun, nationality, country of residence, age). 
  Available payment methods:  As payment method, we offer PayPal and Gift Card. All submitted photos will be reviewed by our Quality Assurance team to ensure the quality standards outlined in the project guidelines are met. 
 For more information, please contact us at dataforce.sourcing@transperfect.com  DataForce by TransPerfect is part of the TransPerfect family of companies, the world’s largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business, with offices in more than 100 cities worldwide.  We offer high-quality data for Human-Machine Interaction to some of the most prestigious technology companies in the world. Our division focuses on gathering, enriching and processing data for Machine Learning in different AI domains.  To learn more about DataForce please visit us at https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce

location: RELEX Solutions · Finland Reposted  6 hours ago  · 31 applicants
job_description:
RELEX Solutions create cutting-edge optimisation software to help retailers and consumer brands drive profitable growth. With growth comes opportunities, and we embrace both. Within our platforms, our teams are driving change, working with international colleagues and the latest tech stack to develop solutions that transform into a pioneering end product; it’s tangible and impactful – for our customers and the world.Our technology team: Our Technology team enjoy a challenge. They’re hungry to learn, and don’t hesitate to ask what, why, and how. They get to work with various technologies to create high quality scalable applications (just imagine, thousands of stores, millions of products, and billions of rows of raw data!). Their expertise positively impacts the environment and business processes around the world; alongside international colleagues, they drive change and develop solutions that become our pioneering end product. From functional programming, machine learning and interesting algorithms, to building big data pipelines, they’re behind it all. They can work in a flexible way, remote or in-office – after all, they contribute to all our achievements, so we reward them with genuine work-life balance and access to every opportunity.We are now looking for a (Senior) DevOps Engineer to join our RELEX family in Helsinki or Lisbon. You will be part of Critical Tools team of four people, who will help you succeed in your new role. Together the team is responsible for configuration and maintenance of the internal services that are crucial for the whole company and allow other teams to function effectively.What you’ll be doing: Developing, integrating, and optimizing Secret Management, with a focus on identifying enhancements and automating solutions using tools such as HashiCorp Vault and Azure KeyVault.Managing Infrastructure as Code for various services utilizing Terraform within a hybrid cloud environment, including Azure, on-premise Kubernetes, and AWS.Setting and promoting company-wide best practices in areas like code management, automation, security, and quality control from a DevOps standpoint.
What you’ll bring to the table: A strong foundation in Secret Management and preferably experience with HashiCorp VaultSolid understanding of DevOps principles, focusing on Infrastructure as Code, Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment across hybrid cloud environments like Azure, AWS, and On-Prem.Fluent English communication skills
What we consider as an advantage: Proficiency with GitLab, GitLab Runner, and familiarity with similar systems (such as GitHub, GitHub Action, BitBucket, Jenkins, or Bamboo) Experience with containers and KubernetesExperience with deployment and management of public cloud infra: Azure and/or AWSExperience in software development in one or more modern programming languages (such as Python, Java, Go, C# etc.)
RELEX FinlandRELEXians can be found around the world, but here we’re based in Helsinki. We’re passionate about using our technology to improve sustainability and change the world. Our office provides a great space for you to socialise, exercise and even take time out in our relaxing areas. We make sure our unique approach to flexibility and work-life balance comes across loud and clear; we’re conveniently located, there’s plenty of public transport and you can even bring your pet to the office!Across RELEX, our people are supported and rewarded. In Finland, we go even further. As well as: A competitive salaryFlexible and hybrid workingExtensive physical and wellbeing supportUp to 8 weeks of annual leave per yearA true hybrid-working policy (home and office)
We also offer a range of benefits to support you, your family, and your life situation. We value your work-life balance and provide flexible hours with RELEX specific parental leave agreements. As we’re a diverse team of smart, motivated and fun people, we also have an office gym, host monthly sports and culture events (think kayaking, brewing club and more), offer a mobile phone package and bike leasing.We’re on a journey with our pioneering technology and exciting growth, which is why we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for everyone. We can’t wait to see what challenges you’ll overcome and what problems you’ll solve. Join us and work with the best. Be curious. Be RELEX – Apply today.Being part of RELEX means being heard, feeling valued and knowing that you can be yourself because you belong. We believe in actions, not words, regarding diverse hiring and employment practices. We take DE&I seriously. We champion and benefit from global diversity. We’re creating and evolving our culture to welcome everyone and value every idea.Are you the one we’re looking for? Apply today and become a part of our RELEX family!Please note that we will fill this position as soon as we’ve found the right person, so we recommend that you act quickly. If you have questions, Ana Raposo (ana.raposo@relexsolutions.com) from our Talent Acquisition is happy to answer them via email.

required_skills: Data Analytics, Databases, Extract, Transform, Load (ETL), and SQLBusiness Intelligence (BI), DAX, Dashboards, Embedded SIM (eSIM), Negotiation, and SAP BusinessObjects
location: AFRY · Greater Lahti Area  3 days ago  · 4 applicants
job_description:
Yrityksen kuvausCubiq Analytics on analytiikkatalo, jossa alan parhaat osaajat haluavat olla töissä. Tehtävämme on toteuttaa suomalaisissa organisaatioissa ennennäkemättömiä läpimurtoja datan avulla.Työpaikan kuvausTyön kuvausOnko voima kanssasi? Hyvä! Etsimme tiimiimme jo kokemusta kerryttänyttä Senior Power BI -konsulttia. Oletko sinä etsimämme vahva osaaja?Tehtävänäsi on kehittää asiakkaillemme pilvipohjaisia analytiikkaratkaisuja Power BI:n avulla. Valomiekkoja emme tällä kertaa tarvitse, mutta Power BI:n tulisi olla hyvin hyppysissäsi. Haemmekin tiimiimme jo kokemusta kerryttänyttä osaajaa, joka hallitsee datan visualisoinnin lisäksi myös sen mallinnuksen. Senior konsulttina olet oman alasi asiantuntija ja jaat osaamistasi mielelläsi niin Cubiqin sisällä kuin asiakastöissäsi: otteesi on sparraava ja tuot aktiivisesti uusia ideoita esiin.Power BI -tekemisemme kasvaa kohisten, mutta talostamme löytyy jo valmiiksi muita Power BI -osaajia, eikä asioita tarvitse pähkäillä ja pallotella koskaan yksin. Cubiqille tullessasi tuletkin osaksi yhteisöä. Meillä töitä tehdään vahvasti tiimeissä, ja asiakkuuden koosta riippuen tiimissäsi on monesti myös Data Engineerejä ja/tai web-devaajia. Asiakkaamme ovat suuria ja keskisuuria suomalaisia yrityksiä ja julkishallinnon organisaatioita, mikä takaa mielekkäät projektit ja oman osaamisen kehittymisen. Emme ole toimialasidonnaisia, joten asiakkaamme ja toimeksiantomme vaihtelevat laidasta laitaan. Pääsetkin laajentamaan ymmärrystäsi datan ja analytiikan arvoketjun valjastamisesta organisaation tarpeisiin hyvin monipuolisesti.Rekrytointiprosessin aikana kartoitamme osaamistasi ja intohimoasi analytiikkaa kohtaan, jotta olisimme paras mahdollinen match toisillemme. Meillä ei ole turhaa byrokratiaa, joten rakennamme roolisi ja urapolkusi näiden keskustelujen ja kiinnostuksenkohteidesi pohjalta.PätevyydetMitä toivomme sinulta? Olet data-analytiikan asiantuntija, jolla on jo kokemusta +3 vuotta Power BI -kehittämisestä. Sinulla on myös silmää visuaalisuudelle ja UX:lleOlet aidosti kiinnostunut asiakkaiden liiketoiminnastaTakataskustasi löytyy Data Analyst -sertifikaatti (esim. Power BI Data Analyst Associate)Sinulla on osaamista datanmallinnuksesta / ETL:stäSinulla on osaamista tietovarastoinnista (esim. SQL) ja siihen liittyvistä menetelmistä (mm. tähtimalli)DAX on hyvä ystäväsiJaat mielelläsi osaamistasi ja kommunikointi on vahvuutesiTyöskentelet sujuvasti sekä suomeksi että englanniksi
LisätietojaMiksi Cubiq?Olemme osa globaalin insinööri-, suunnittelu- ja konsultointiyritys AFRYn Management Consulting -liiketoimintayksikköä. Meillä pääset osaksi energistä ja osallistavaa yhteisöä, jossa on loistava tekemisen meininki ja työtäsi arvostetaan. Saat vaikuttaa aidosti asioihin ja luotsata omia visioitasi eteenpäin. Vapauden ja vastuun lisäksi takaamme joustavan työympäristön sekä kilpailukykyiset edut. Toimistomme sijaitsevat Helsingissä, Lahdessa, Tampereella ja Turussa.Mitä mieltä töistään ja Cubiqista on meillä Power BI:llä päivittäin ratkaisuja tekevä Senior konsultti Johanna?“Cubiqilla työskentelyssä parasta on työkaverit sekä vaihtelevat projektit. Monipuolisten työtehtävien ansiosta pääsen kehittämään omaa osaamistani, sillä asiakkaiden tarpeet ja ympäristöt ovat erilaisia. Välillä rakennan talouden Power BI -sovellusta ja seuraavana päivänä kehitän asiakkaan Azure-ympäristöä. Omien taitojen syventyminen onkin takuuvarmaa, ja Cubiqilla on tullut opittua lyhyessä ajassa paljon!”Jos tulevat työkaverisi ja työkulttuurimme kiinnostavat, voit kurkata meininkiämme nettisivuiltamme https://cubiq.fi tai somekanaviltamme LinkedInistä, Instagramista tai Facebookista nimellä @cubiqanalytics.Innostuitko?Jos edellä kuvattu kolahti, laita hakemusta tulemaan ja liitä kylkeen CV:si. Käymme hakemuksia läpi säännöllisesti ja kontaktoimme haastatteluihin nopeasti sopivien henkilöiden osuessa kohdalle. May the force be with you!Lisätietoa roolista ja asiakkuuksista saat Vesa Pukilta, puh. 040 066 6114 tai vesa.pukki@afry.comHaku alkaa: 1.11.2023Haku päättyy: 22.11.2023Työsuhteen tyyppi: KokopäiväinenAloitusajankohta: Sovittavissa joustavastiAFRYllä muutos on työtämme. Muutos kumpuaa rohkeiden ihmisten ja ideoiden kohtaamisista, kun teemme yhteistyötä, kehitämme uusia teknologioita ja sisäistämme haastavia näkökulmia. Näin rakennamme tulevaisuutta. Etsimme aktiivisesti uusia osaajia avoimiin, osallistaviin ja monimuotoisiin tiimeihimme ympäri maailman. Tule mukaan vauhdittamaan muutosta kohti kestävää tulevaisuutta.

job_title: Senior or Principal Scientist, AI-Driven Corporate Foresight & Strategy
required_skills: Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Research SkillsForesight, Futures Studies, Futures Thinking, Project Management, Project Planning, Strategic Planning, Strategic Thinking, and Strategy
location: VTT · Espoo, Uusimaa, Finland  1 week ago  · 15 applicants
job_description:
Are you passionate about advancing research, development, and deployment of AI-based solutions to pioneer data-driven foresight and create future-proof strategies for businesses? Are you seeking a job that combines academic freedom with industry impact? Do you want to take a key role in the development of a research agenda, project portfolio and toolbox for cutting-edge AI solutions in corporate foresight and strategy design? If so, we might just offer what you have been looking for!VTT is one of the leading applied research organisations in Europe. What unites us at VTT are curiosity, a passion for learning, a devotion to finding solutions to global challenges, and answers to our customers’ needs. Our cross-disciplinary community of over 2000 brilliant minds focuses on creating impact through science-based innovation. Get to know us further by exploring VTT's tech & infra.We are looking for an ambitious Principal or Senior Scientist to join our Corporate Foresight & Strategy team!In this role – supported by our experienced research team and in collaboration with our national and global expert networks – you will take an active role in developing and integrating AI-based approaches into our highly ambitious research and development agenda with the ultimate aim of providing actionable insights and future-proof strategy designs for businesses.The purpose of our multi-disciplinary team of 10 professionals is to research, develop and deliver strategic foresight services for our corporate clients to help them create and capture future growth opportunities, anticipate and navigate looming business threats, and build up their proprietary foresight capabilities. Our customers typically are medium to large cap enterprises with needs to ground medium- to long-term strategy into data-driven foresight. That said, we often gladly join forces with VTT’s other teams in the research area to serve clients from the public sector as well. Using our research agenda as a source of innovation, a central part of this position is to participate in the development of our offering and creating new international openings.With us, your responsibilities will be:As a key expert in AI-driven corporate foresight, you would contribute in the following ways: Take ownership of the research, development and application of AI-based approaches to creating strategic foresight in both the scientific and commercial domains.Develop an ambitious research agenda for AI-driven foresight that will deepen the science-based understanding of the potential of AI, and serve as the foundation for internal methodology and service development.Connecting with VTT’s other AI-focused research teams for support, take charge of developing VTT’s proprietary AI methodologies for use in the context of strategic foresight.Scan the environment for existing AI solutions that we can readily adopt to support in the execution of the team’s mandate.Establish your position as a foresight expert to contribute as a full member to the team’s fundamental activities. This includes designing, acquiring and implementing foresight-related research, development and innovation projects in both the scientific and commercial domains in Finland and the international stage.Participate actively in creating and developing the broader research and service offering of the team.Strengthen the team’s profile and networks on the global business arena through your own networks and luminous presence as an AI-related thought leader in relevant channels.As a seasoned scientist and expert, help younger talents to develop in their career.
Who we are looking for:We seek candidates with a proven track record in rigorous scientific inquiry and private sector collaboration, particularly in AI-based approaches for actionable business intelligence. Your drive to expand the global knowledge on AI's potential is critical. You should be passionate about developing cutting-edge customer applications, taking a leading role in our research, offering development, and ambitious customer projects. Effective teamwork, project planning, acquisition and implementation as well as the ability to initiate and maintain industry collaborations for strategic foresight are essential.The ideal candidate for this position would have several of the following qualifications: A broad understanding and experience in applied AI development and application for the generation of actionable business intelligence across industry sectors.A specific background in strategic foresight will set you apart as a strong candidate but is not requiredAn ability to use different types of research methodology, data and AI-technology and contextualize them in various use cases across industrial sectors.A high level of ambition and a goal-oriented mindset that ensure a high quality and impact of the project work implemented for our customers.Strategic thinking skills with an ability to execute.Preferably, you have a PhD or equivalent scientific foundation, with excellent academic credits.Proven experience from systematic project management and customer work.Team player with good communication skills.You have excellent skills in the English language. Knowledge of Finnish and additional languages is an asset.
As a person, we hope that you are:For this position, we're looking for someone dedicated to real-world customer solutions, bridging theory and practice in a solution-oriented manner. You should be motivated to plan, execute, and lead ambitious research and customer projects, drawing upon expertise from across VTT to build successful project teams. Effective communication and the ability to apply foresight in tool development and customer strategy design are valuable assets.With VTT, you’ll enjoy: Visionary work in technology. We offer positions at the cutting-edge of technology and engineering, from next-generation microelectronics and quantum technology to automation and robotics, energy systems, and more. Our research agenda is dedicated to creating sustainable growth by solving systemic and technological challenges, so your work will go towards creating a real, positive impact. Read more about our strategy – the path of exponential hope.Fascinating projects, excellent research environment. Our researchers get to work on a combination of cutting-edge academic research and applied customer projects locally and internationally. At VTT, you'll have state-of-the-art research facilities, such as Micronova, the Finnish research infrastructure for micro-, nano-, and quantum technologies. Great career opportunities, superb colleagues. At VTT, excellence in research is a strategic priority. We offer long-term positions and stable career paths in top-level research. People tend to stay with us for over ten years since there are always new roles and responsibilities to grow into. Collaborating in a cross-disciplinary community with superb colleagues is a source of learning, inspiration, and fun. Read more about our organisational culture as the builder of the world's most meaningful place to work.Support for your well-being. Our people are our main asset, so we take good care of them. We aim to nurture excellent team spirit and leadership and offer versatile well-being services to enable a good work-life balance. On top of 6 weeks of paid holidays, we offer exercise and culture benefits, hobby clubs, and voluntary well-being services such as meditation and cognitive ergonomics training.
Apply now and join our community of brilliant minds!Please send your CV and application with your salary request via our recruitment system as soon as possible but at the latest by 12 November 2023. We will process applications as they come in and fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate. A security clearance procedure may be conducted during the recruitment process.Interested and want to know more?For more information about the position, you can contact Antti Tahvanainen, Research Team Leader, Corporate Foresight & Strategy. E-mail. antti-jussi.tahvanainen@vtt.fi or tel. +358445351797 on Friday 27 October from 2 pm to 3 pm or Monday 6 November from 2 pm to 3 pm (Finnish time).We look forward to hearing from you! Job location: Espoo or Tampere, Finland.Apply between 24 October 2023 and 12 November 2023 23:59 (Europe/Helsinki)Employment type: Full-time, Permanent

required_skills: Application Security, Communication, Cyberark, Data Privacy, Enterprise Solution Design, Information Security, Multi-factor Authentication, Network Security, SailPoint, and Technical Solution Design
location: Nordea · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  2 weeks ago  · 14 applicants
job_description:
Job ID:19983  Would you like to be part in shaping the future with us? At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast – and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That’s why we’re deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We’re creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together – and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.  Are you our new Senior IT Security Specialist? We are looking for a Senior IT Security Specialist with experience from IT analysis, solution designer and/or architect work to join Nordea’s Identity Access Management (IAM) area.  Our teamYou will be part of a team investigating, designing and implementing IAM solutions and that focus on delivering new functionality to our changing demands. This is an opportunity for you to be part of a team of dedicated people eager to support our mission to Protect the Bank: De-risked, Compliant, Secure & Protected. About this opportunityWelcome to the Identity Access Management (IAM) team working with development, design  and requirements. We add value by delivering functionality to support the increasing security demands of Nordea as well as underpin the operational and service delivery units of IAM. As a Senior IT Security Specialist in Identity & Access Management, you will play a valuable role in maturing our IAM tools, both on the front-end and integrating with existing bank systems on the back-end. You will be part of forming the IAM set up by translating business, security and regulatory requirements into short term and long term roadmaps for the IAM framework. What you will be doing Drive & contribute to analysis and investigations on new requirements (regulatory, business, technology etc.) and continuous improvements/maturation affecting the IAM landscape.Guide the design, architecture, and integration of the tools in the IAM control framework and secure alignment with Nordea values, goals and security strategySupport the design, implementation, and maintenance of the technical IAM platform and ensuring the IAM architecture and solution design remains up to date and effectiveSupport the design, planning, and implementation of application and IT infrastructure on-boarding to the IAM control frameworkProvide support and expertise to Business Areas and Technology on IAM tool utilisation.Proactively identifying any bridge gaps between IAM goals and technical capabilities
 Who you areCollaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – qualities we look forward to share with you. To succeed in this role, we believe that you Have broad and extensive experience of the IAM area, with focus on analysis, investigations, solution design and architecture.Are comfortable in prioritising and making decisions in complex technical settings Are a good listener and have an analytical skillset that can bring theory into practical usageStrong driving force, being well structured and thorough, and having excellent technical skillsHave the ability to communicate clearly both in environments with It-analysts, developers, scrum masters as well as business stakeholders.Have a problem-solving attitudePassionate about maturing, simplifying and enhancing our current IAM setup.Are creative and have a strong desire for innovation and continuous learning to stay current with IAM technology
 Your experience and background Subject-matter expertise across all IAM topics relating to both on-premises and cloud enterprise technology, and the relationship between the architecturesParticipated in design and implementation of Identity and Access Management governance processes and driven IAM standards adoptionReview and management of technical IAM security roadmapsWell educated in general aspects of Information SecurityExperience with SailPoint and CyberArk implementation, or equivalentGood understanding of Multi-Factor authentication and Privileged Access Management Fluency in both written and spoken English is a must8+ years of practical experience in the field of IT is required.  5+ years of direct Information Security experience.Your educational background is master’s or bachelor’s degree, or equivalent
 LocationThis positions is based in Helsinki, Finland. If this sounds like you, get in touch! Next Steps Please submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than 30/11/2023. Please note that we review applications as they arrive. For more information, you are welcome to contact Head of IAM Governance, Åsa Lybeck at asa.lybeck@nordea.com.  Kindly also note that a background check is mandatory for our positions.  At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

required_skills: EnglishAttention to Detail, Communication, IEC 62304, ISO 13485, ISO 14971, Information Security Management, Medical Devices, QSR, and Record Keeping
location: Topcon Healthcare Europe · Oulu, North Ostrobothnia, Finland  5 days ago  · 12 applicants
job_description:
Do you want to have a direct impact on developing the world's leading health technology software? Do you dream of working with products that genuinely improve the quality of life for people across the globe? Great, because we have a job opening for you!What kind of work is this?As a QARA Specialist/Senior Specialist, you will work as a part of the QARA team. You will support our software development project teams and provide guidance on the applicable regulations and standards governing the products in development. You may also support regulatory submissions and product licensing globally. Developing and maintaining the Quality Management System is one of the continuous key tasks for this role.Your role will include the following core duties: Prepare and update technical filesCoordinate the release readinessCollaborate close with product development and product management teamsCommunicate and coordinate with stakeholdersDrive, maintain and improve the CAPA process and guide cross-functional teamsActively participate in/carry out internal auditsEnsure compliance with medical device regulation and standardsUpdate/draft procedures
The position is located in Oulu, offering the flexibility of a hybrid work model, allowing you to work both in the office and remotely. The start date for the position can be arranged flexibly to accommodate your scheduleWhy should I apply for a job at Topcon Healthcare Solutions?You can come here as you are. We appreciate all personality types and truly believe that a good team consists of a wide range of different, unique characters. Our team of over 150 professionals in Finland has a relaxed atmosphere, and we think that a bit of humor makes work a lot easier.You will be involved in a great workplace with a start-up atmosphere. You will sense the enthusiasm and can-do attitude. while our global parent company brings stability and supports our product development and growth. Our team is at the cutting edge of the software and technology industry and is constantly following industry trends.You don’t have to get stuck in your career development, because you’ll have a chance to learn new skills and take on new responsibilities. We are growing fast and you can grow with us to new roles.In return for your input, we offer you salary in the range of 4100 - 5100 euro/month depending on your experience, and benefits such as a lunch benefit, education program, sports, massage and culture vouchers, and leisure-time insurance.What do you expect from me?To succeed in this position, you should have: Relevant Bachelor’s or Master’s degree, e.g., Health Technology and InformaticsExperience and knowledge of regulatory framework in medical devices and demonstrated ability to interpret regulations and make informed decisionsExperience with medical device standards and regulations (MD Directive/Regulation, ISO 13485)Attention to detail in setting, conducting, and documentingRecords keeping in compliance with Company policy and regulatory requirementsExcellent communication skills in English, both written and oral. Finnish is seen as an advantage
We also value: Experience with software as medical deviceWorking knowledge of ISO 14971, IEC 62304 and IEC 62366 and US FDA QSRExperience with ISO/IEC 27001 or other information security management systems is seen as an advantageExperience with cybersecurity in medical devicesExperience in performing internal auditsExperience with medical device registrations
I want this job! What should I do next?If this job excited you and you identified yourself with the description of the person we are looking for, please send your application (including salary request) with your CV to us no later than November 15th and we will see if we would fit together!Candidates are considered on a rolling basis, and we will contact each applicant personally by email. If you want to talk about the task in more detail, please contact our hiring manager Anita Jansen (+358 40 564 9883) on November 2nd between 11:00 - 12:00 or on November 09th between 11:30-12:30 (Finnish time).Who is Topcon?  Topcon Healthcare sees eye health differently. Our vision is to empower providers with smart, value-driven and efficient technologies for enhanced care. Keeping pace with the ever-changing landscape of the healthcare industry, Topcon Healthcare offers the latest integrated solutions, including advanced multimodal imaging, vendor-neutral data management and ground-breaking remote diagnostic technology.Topcon Healthcare Solutions is part of Topcon Corporation. We specialize in providing modern software solutions for eye care. Our primary target is to offer the whole workflow from the clinical device connection to archiving and telemedicine. Our solutions have been designed in cooperation with physicians and other healthcare professionals to provide excellent usability and performance. Our customers are optical retailers, clinics and hospitals.

required_skills: Data Analytics, Databases, Extract, Transform, Load (ETL), and SQLBusiness Intelligence (BI), DAX, Dashboards, Embedded SIM (eSIM), Negotiation, and SAP BusinessObjects
location: AFRY · Turku, Southwest Finland, Finland  3 days ago  · 3 applicants
job_description:
Yrityksen kuvausCubiq Analytics on analytiikkatalo, jossa alan parhaat osaajat haluavat olla töissä. Tehtävämme on toteuttaa suomalaisissa organisaatioissa ennennäkemättömiä läpimurtoja datan avulla.Työpaikan kuvausTyön kuvausOnko voima kanssasi? Hyvä! Etsimme tiimiimme jo kokemusta kerryttänyttä Senior Power BI -konsulttia. Oletko sinä etsimämme vahva osaaja?Tehtävänäsi on kehittää asiakkaillemme pilvipohjaisia analytiikkaratkaisuja Power BI:n avulla. Valomiekkoja emme tällä kertaa tarvitse, mutta Power BI:n tulisi olla hyvin hyppysissäsi. Haemmekin tiimiimme jo kokemusta kerryttänyttä osaajaa, joka hallitsee datan visualisoinnin lisäksi myös sen mallinnuksen. Senior konsulttina olet oman alasi asiantuntija ja jaat osaamistasi mielelläsi niin Cubiqin sisällä kuin asiakastöissäsi: otteesi on sparraava ja tuot aktiivisesti uusia ideoita esiin.Power BI -tekemisemme kasvaa kohisten, mutta talostamme löytyy jo valmiiksi muita Power BI -osaajia, eikä asioita tarvitse pähkäillä ja pallotella koskaan yksin. Cubiqille tullessasi tuletkin osaksi yhteisöä. Meillä töitä tehdään vahvasti tiimeissä, ja asiakkuuden koosta riippuen tiimissäsi on monesti myös Data Engineerejä ja/tai web-devaajia. Asiakkaamme ovat suuria ja keskisuuria suomalaisia yrityksiä ja julkishallinnon organisaatioita, mikä takaa mielekkäät projektit ja oman osaamisen kehittymisen. Emme ole toimialasidonnaisia, joten asiakkaamme ja toimeksiantomme vaihtelevat laidasta laitaan. Pääsetkin laajentamaan ymmärrystäsi datan ja analytiikan arvoketjun valjastamisesta organisaation tarpeisiin hyvin monipuolisesti.Rekrytointiprosessin aikana kartoitamme osaamistasi ja intohimoasi analytiikkaa kohtaan, jotta olisimme paras mahdollinen match toisillemme. Meillä ei ole turhaa byrokratiaa, joten rakennamme roolisi ja urapolkusi näiden keskustelujen ja kiinnostuksenkohteidesi pohjalta.PätevyydetMitä toivomme sinulta? Olet data-analytiikan asiantuntija, jolla on jo kokemusta +3 vuotta Power BI -kehittämisestä. Sinulla on myös silmää visuaalisuudelle ja UX:lleOlet aidosti kiinnostunut asiakkaiden liiketoiminnastaTakataskustasi löytyy Data Analyst -sertifikaatti (esim. Power BI Data Analyst Associate)Sinulla on osaamista datanmallinnuksesta / ETL:stäSinulla on osaamista tietovarastoinnista (esim. SQL) ja siihen liittyvistä menetelmistä (mm. tähtimalli)DAX on hyvä ystäväsiJaat mielelläsi osaamistasi ja kommunikointi on vahvuutesiTyöskentelet sujuvasti sekä suomeksi että englanniksi
LisätietojaMiksi Cubiq?Olemme osa globaalin insinööri-, suunnittelu- ja konsultointiyritys AFRYn Management Consulting -liiketoimintayksikköä. Meillä pääset osaksi energistä ja osallistavaa yhteisöä, jossa on loistava tekemisen meininki ja työtäsi arvostetaan. Saat vaikuttaa aidosti asioihin ja luotsata omia visioitasi eteenpäin. Vapauden ja vastuun lisäksi takaamme joustavan työympäristön sekä kilpailukykyiset edut. Toimistomme sijaitsevat Helsingissä, Lahdessa, Tampereella ja Turussa.Mitä mieltä töistään ja Cubiqista on meillä Power BI:llä päivittäin ratkaisuja tekevä Senior konsultti Johanna?“Cubiqilla työskentelyssä parasta on työkaverit sekä vaihtelevat projektit. Monipuolisten työtehtävien ansiosta pääsen kehittämään omaa osaamistani, sillä asiakkaiden tarpeet ja ympäristöt ovat erilaisia. Välillä rakennan talouden Power BI -sovellusta ja seuraavana päivänä kehitän asiakkaan Azure-ympäristöä. Omien taitojen syventyminen onkin takuuvarmaa, ja Cubiqilla on tullut opittua lyhyessä ajassa paljon!”Jos tulevat työkaverisi ja työkulttuurimme kiinnostavat, voit kurkata meininkiämme nettisivuiltamme https://cubiq.fi tai somekanaviltamme LinkedInistä, Instagramista tai Facebookista nimellä @cubiqanalytics.Innostuitko?Jos edellä kuvattu kolahti, laita hakemusta tulemaan ja liitä kylkeen CV:si. Käymme hakemuksia läpi säännöllisesti ja kontaktoimme haastatteluihin nopeasti sopivien henkilöiden osuessa kohdalle. May the force be with you!Lisätietoa roolista ja asiakkuuksista saat Vesa Pukilta, puh. 040 066 6114 tai vesa.pukki@afry.comHaku alkaa: 1.11.2023Haku päättyy: 22.11.2023Työsuhteen tyyppi: KokopäiväinenAloitusajankohta: Sovittavissa joustavastiAFRYllä muutos on työtämme. Muutos kumpuaa rohkeiden ihmisten ja ideoiden kohtaamisista, kun teemme yhteistyötä, kehitämme uusia teknologioita ja sisäistämme haastavia näkökulmia. Näin rakennamme tulevaisuutta. Etsimme aktiivisesti uusia osaajia avoimiin, osallistaviin ja monimuotoisiin tiimeihimme ympäri maailman. Tule mukaan vauhdittamaan muutosta kohti kestävää tulevaisuutta.

job_description:
Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.We are looking for a Junior HR Business Partner at ABB Oy, Marine & Ports division in Vuosaari, Helsinki.The position is a fulltime and permanent. In this position you will implement variety of human resources management tasks in Marine & Ports local division and work closely with Local HRBP Wilhelmina Suominen. We offer hybrid work option and wish you also enjoy working in our renovated and modern office in Helsinki, Vuosaari.You will have an opportunity to work with skilled professionals across organization in various roles. This role offers a great learning opportunity, ability to influence and do meaningful and creative work.Our culture and benefits reflect our values: courage, care, curiosity and collaboration. The most appreciated benefits according to our personnel are at the moment e.g. an annual performance bonus, employee share acquisition program, continuous learning opportunities, bicycle and other wellbeing and family benefits.This position reports toLocal Division HR Business PartnerYour responsibilities Leadership: Supporting local division line managers with defined daily operative HR processes, implementing ABB Marine & Ports HR policies and procedures. Applying production workers collective agreement in practice. Assisting in resolving employee relations issues and disputes. Supporting in HR reporting and master dataPeople initiatives: Supporting line managers in employee engagement survey actions and follow-up procedures. Supporting in planning employee development actionsPeople engagement: Developing employee engagement practices and well-being modelsPerformance management: Assisting with our tailored performance management process and conducting people review processHR Projects: Participating in HR Projects; contributing especially to the renewal of the HR system. Implementing change management actions, and contributing to process improvement Internal communication: Supporting in HR internal communications, maintaining a positive work environment
Your background Preferably you are recently graduated with Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in HR or few year’s of relevant work experience from the fieldCustomer orientated mindset is a must as well as ability to work at all levels of the organizationHigh level of attention to detail, problem-solver and – a positive “can do” attitudeAbility to handle sensitive and confidential information in a professional mannerYou are familiar working with Excel and eager to further develop in Excel and PowerBIAbility to work proactively and demonstrate ownership in your actionsExcellent communication skills in Finnish and English 
More about usABB Marine & Ports supplies world-leading technologies that are driving the evolution of sustainable shipping. Electrical propulsion, data-driven decision support and integrated solutions for ship and shore from ABB are paving the way to a zero-emission marine industry, providing greater efficiency and reliability to shipowners, and preparing vessels to meet the demands of tomorrow. Our automation and electrical solutions are making port and terminal operations safer, greener and more productive. ABB Marine & Ports operates in 26 countries and has 2,000 employees. www.abb.com/marineWorking with ABB Marine & Ports, you'll have the chance to make a real difference. Your efforts will help drive the transition toward sustainable and responsible practices in the maritime and port industries. Join us in creating a better, cleaner future for the planet.In Finland, ABB has about 5000 employees, making it one of the biggest industrial employers in the country. ABB Finland serves its customers in over 20 locations and has production sites in Helsinki, Vaasa, Porvoo and Hamina. As a global company, we’re also able to offer international job opportunities.In case you would need further information, please contact Wilhelmina Suominen, Local Division HR Business Partner, tel. +358 50 335 8759 either Friday 10 November at 2–3 pm EST or Friday 17 November at 10–11 EST.Interested in joining the crew? Please apply for the position by Sunday November 26, 2023. We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.Work model: hybrid89253365

job_title: Enterprise Architect - Tietoevry Tech Services Finland
required_skills: Architecture, Architecture Frameworks, Communication, Enterprise Architecture, Master Data, Master Data Management, Microservices, Microsoft Dynamics, Presales, and Statutory Accounting Principles (SAP)
location: Tietoevry · Turku, Southwest Finland, Finland Reposted  1 week ago  · 5 applicants
job_description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.Your contribution and backgroundAs an enterprise architect you will be responsible for providing and selling consultancy services in transformation projects for clients. In short, you will help our customers implement their business strategy, by turning their objectives into action.Your key tasks will include delivering consulting engagements. This might include: Identifying business challenges and opportunitiesDesigning, modelling, optimizing and implementing winning enterprise architecture, IT landscape and roadmapSupporting our customers in implementing change and transformation initiatives in their organizationSupporting your team members proactively and sharing best practices with your colleagues and customersExperience in working with cloud environments, preferably Azure, also Google/AWS experience is appreciatedIndustry expertise on Manufacturing and / or Forest is big advantage.Participating in pre-sales activities. In the long term, we expect you to build and maintain professional customer relationships within customers.
You are the ideal candidate for this position if you have a strong drive combined with a proactive way of working. Delivering superior customer value is your top priority. You have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, and the capability to develop and present clearly high-level abstractions. You are an engaged and open-minded team player with excellent communication skills. You are proactive and service-minded in your work and distinctly self-motivated and you enjoy working with clients of different backgrounds and positions.In addition, we expect you to have: A minimum of five years’ experience in architecture related activitiesStrong architecture & technology experience and foresight covering some core systems like SAP or Microsoft Dynamics complemented with proven experience or understanding of modern API-first microservices, product information and/or customer master data managementFluency in Enterprise Architecture frameworks and methodologiesWorking knowledge of consulting practices and methods is preferredStrong will and ability to work as a part of a teamFluent Finnish and English, both oral and in writing.
What We Can Offer YouWe offer you a competitive compensation package and the chance to make a difference. With us you will be at the forefront of emerging businesses and technology, exchanging ideas with the best professionals.Furthermore, we offer you a challenging position with great opportunities for professional growth. With us you will have the opportunity to directly influence your career development. If you have a good idea, people will listen to you. We believe that trust fosters freedom and creativity. Our culture is built on transparency and active sharing – a truly open environment.Land your dream jobDid we get you inspired? We look forward to hearing from you! Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we’ll reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today.If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Mauri Tusa, via e-mail mauri.tusa@tietoevry.com.

job_description:
Position: Data Contributor Project Location: Finland(Remote) Engagement Model: Task-BasedDataForce by TransPerfect is currently looking for contributors to participate in our Human Centric Image Collection project in Finland. The project seeks to build a large set of annotated images to help machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) systems perform more fairly and ethically across a diverse range of people.Task description:For the project, you will be required to submit a set of 12 pictures (10 project pictures following our instructions + 2 additional selfie photos).This is a fully remote project and you can participate from the comfort of your home.RequirementsTo participate you must meet the following qualifying criteria: Reside in FinlandBe at least the age of majority under the laws of your jurisdiction.Be able to submit 12 photos with a minimum resolution of 8 MP, following specific instructions shared by our Team.Be able to involve a friend or a relative in the project who is willing to appear on some of the photos (2 out of 12) and to provide their consent, following specific instructions shared by our Team.Read and agree to the project's informed consent form.Provide self-reported demographic information (e.g., ancestry, pronoun, nationality, country of residence, age).
Available payment methods: As a payment method, we offer PayPal and Gift CardAll submitted photos will be reviewed by our Quality Assurance team to ensure the quality standards outlined in the project guidelines are met.
For more information, please contact us at dataforce.sourcing@transperfect.comDataForce by TransPerfect is part of the TransPerfect family of companies, the world’s largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business, with offices in more than 100 cities worldwide.We offer high-quality data for Human-Machine Interaction to some of the most prestigious technology companies in the world. Our division focuses on gathering, enriching, and processing data for Machine Learning in different AI domains.To learn more about DataForce please visit us at https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce
