required_skills: Computer Science, Data Warehousing, Databases, and Extract, Transform, Load (ETL)Business Understanding, Communication, Data Modeling, Snowflake, Snowflake Cloud, and Wizard
location: Schibsted Finland · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  5 days ago  · 35 applicants
job_description:
THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELLYou? A data engineer with an analytic mindset or an analyst with data engineering skills. Whether you have a few years of experience or have been around for a while, we’re interested in hearing from you.Role? As a Data Warehouse Engineer in our company, you will take part in constructing state-of-the-art Data Warehouses tailored for Nordic Marketplaces, empowering data-informed decisions. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders and cross-functional teams to engineer robust, agile solutions.Tech stack? AWS, Snowflake, Redshift, Matillion, Python, DBT, TableauLocation? You can apply to work at one of our hubs in Aarhus or Helsinki. Most of us work some days from home a couple of days a week and love meeting our colleagues weekly for collaboration. If you like, you can of course work from the office every day.Company? FINN.no in Norway, Bilbasen and DBA in Denmark, Oikotie and Tori in Finland, and Blocket in Sweden, recently joined forces, collectively forming Schibsted Nordic Marketplaces. Together, we serve over 325 million monthly visits in the Nordics. By joining forces, we are on a transformative journey toward becoming a next-generation marketplace. To achieve this ambitious goal, we're building a marketplace platform that will propel our verticals (Jobs, Mobility, Real Estate, ReCommerce) to a leading position in all countries. Our technology unit is instrumental to our success story, deploying new code to production over 1800 times per week.Why us? In this role, you will have an unique opportunity to build and form the Data Warehouse for Nordic Marketplaces to empower the organisation to take data driven decisions. We believe that the best solutions come in collaboration with others and that freedom and a sense of responsibility are more effective than detailed management.Sounds like your cup of tea? Check out the details below!WHO ARE YOU? A data wizard with at least Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (Computer science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance) Passionate about data as basis of analysis and decision support Profound business understanding and communication skills Manages fundamental data modelling techniques relevant to data warehousing Experience with our tech stack or equivalent ETL/ELT tools like Talend, BODS, Informatica or other data wrangling tools like DBT, Databricks, Fivetran, Spark, Airflow etc and you don’t need ChatGPT to write your SQL Experience with AWS services like Snowflake, S3, Lambda or other cloud platforms and comparable tools 
WHAT’S THE JOB LIKE?Day-to-day work & projects cookingAs a part of our team you will work in close collaboration with both domain teams and analysts as well as your peers within our team and sister teams. Having a structured and analytical mindset is essential, as well as being able to decipher domain data models and data products, and transform those into analytical models to support business requirements by analysts and other stakeholders. You will be working with building high quality data pipelines to feed those models for different verticals as well as horizontal models across. This will be done using the Schibsted Common Analytical Model as one of the core building blocks.ColleaguesWe are a large, distributed and highly diverse team spread across most out the Nordics and Poland. Our team consists of 12 people, with broad diversity in both background and age-span. We're part of the data platform area, together with other teams like data platform engineering, data management, recommendation as well as data enablement teams for data science and data mesh. We are one out of 50 teams of talented individuals with diverse backgrounds, intellects and identities.We work closely with the technical domain teams to understand the data we are dealing with as well as our main stakeholders within insight and analysts as well as functions like finance and sales. We work according to agile principles with continuous deployment and improvements. We meet up several times during the year in our different locations.Not everything is cotton candy clouds, so here’s the main opportunity to improveRight now we are navigating around in the new, Nordic organisation, balancing both the legacy systems while building the new stuff, which is both demanding and exciting at the same time.On the other hand, this brings along a great opportunity to leave your fingerprint on how our future Data Warehouse is drafted and to support the rest of the organisation with key metrics and analyses both during and after the transition! Is your curious mind asking for this kind of adventure?GOT YOUR ATTENTION? Let us hear from you!If you are looking for a workplace and the role in which you could share your knowledge and expertise, learn and grow, get inspired, be yourself, and make a difference, let us hear from you by 20.11.2023. We value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds.QUESTIONS?Engineering Manager Kristin Hybertsen is happy to provide information about the daily work and answer any questions you may have about the role. Kristin is best reached through Linkedin or email kristin.hybertsen(at)schibsted.com
 
THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELL

required_skills: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Data Mining, Data Science, Docker Products, MLOps, Machine Learning, Pattern Recognition, and Software DevelopmentCadence Encounter and Kubernetes
location: Wolt · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  1 week ago  · 31 applicants
job_description:
Job DescriptionTeam purpose and mission Working embedded with Data Scientists and other engineers to develop, deploy, scale and maintain impactful Machine Learning solutionsHelping data scientists and other engineers with Machine Learning and ML Platform & infrastructure related topics and questions. Increasing the level of ML engineering in the team.Monitoring, maintenance and troubleshooting of deployed solutionsContributing to our MLOps practices and liaising with the ML Platform teamWe have openings in multiple domains, such as personalisation & recommendations, search, logistics etc.
📍This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Berlin, Helsinki, or Stockholm, or you can work remotely anywhere in Finland, Sweden, Germany, Denmark, and Estonia. Read more about our remote setup here. If you live outside of these countries - not to worry! We provide relocation support to help you make your way to Finland, Germany or Sweden.Our humble expectations You are experienced in end-to-end machine learning deployments and maintenance of deployed solutions and have at least 3+ years of experience in ML/MLOps.Furthermore, you bring solid experience in scaling and troubleshooting machine learning deployments to the table. You can help with the technical issues the teams encounter.A good understanding of ML and MLOps principles as well as Software engineering experience in Python should complete your profile.Ideally you also have experience in Docker, Kubernetes, Flyte, Seldon Core.
Next StepsThe position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Michal SzafraniecAbout WoltWolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.Working in Product Development at WoltAt Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & InclusionWe want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.Join us today to build Wolt together!

job_description:
DATA ENGINEERSUOMEN PALLOLIITTO RYJalkapalloa jokaiselle! Visiomme on olla menestyvä jalkapallomaa - hyvinvoinnin kasvattaja.Haemme nyt joukkoomme Tiedolla Johtamisen palvelutiimiin Data Engineeriä.Suomen Palloliiton Data Engineerinä keskeinen tavoitteesi on tiedon jako kustannustehokkaasti, turvallisesti ja joustavasti Seurojen Palloliitossa. Pääset mukaan tiedolla johtamisen palvelutiimiin, jossa yhteistyössä muiden ammattilaisten ja sidosryhmien kanssa viet eteenpäin Palloliiton tiedolla johtamisen strategiaa kohti käyttäjäystävällisiä digitaalisia palveluita, sekä analytiikka ja datakehitystä. Datainsinöörinä keskeisiä tehtäviäsi ovat:  Suunnitella, dokumentoida ja toteuttaa automatisoituja tietohallintoprosesseja ja ohjelmointirajapintoja, jotka mahdollistavat päätöksenteon tueksi tarvittavan tiedon jakamisen.Organisaation dataputkien suunnittelu, kehitys, hallinnointi ja toteutusKehittää sisäisiä ja ulkoisia raportteja yhteistyössä muun tiimin kanssa.Raportoida, kehittää ja tukea datan hyödyntämistä organisaatiossa
Omaat kokemusta ainakin  Microsoftin Azuresta: datan hallinta, siirto ja käsittely (esim. Data Factory)API-rajapinnoistaTietokannoista: SQL, NoSQLVersiohallinnasta (Git), dokumentoinnista ja DevOps, DataOps CI/CD-periaatteista.Ohjelmointikielistä: Python (R ja muut ohjelmointikielet katsotaan eduksi).
Olet kiinnostunut data arkkitehtuurista, sekä merkityksellisestä työstä, jonka visiona on olla hyvinvoinnin kasvattaja Suomessa. Sinulla on korkeakoulututkinto soveltuvalta alalta sekä vähintään kolmen vuoden ammatillista kokemusta vastaavista tehtävistä. Olet yhteistyötaitoinen tiimipelaaja, joka viestii sujuvasti suomeksi sekä englanniksi. Tehtävässä raportoit tutkimus- ja kehityspäällikkö Ville-Pekka Inkilälle.LisätietojaTehtävä sijoittuu Helsingin toimistoomme Töölöön. Lisäksi tarjoamme joustavan etätyömahdollisuuden, sekä muut monipuoliset edut.Mikäli kiinnostuit tehtävästä, haethan tehtävään viimeistään 22.10.2023 alla olevasta linkistä.Wise IT tukee Suomen Palloliittoa tässä rekrytoinnissa. Mikäli haluat tehtävästä lisätietoja, olethan yhteydessä IT rekrytointikonsultti Tiia-Liina Aavistoon, tiia-liina.aavisto@wiseit.fi, +358401860696Suomen Palloliitto on Suomalaisen jalkapallon ja futsalin koti. Palloliitto vastaa maamme kaikesta jalkapallo- ja futsaltoiminnasta, ja sen kehittämisestä. Suomen Palloliiton tiedolla johtamisen -prosessi käynnistettiin virallisesti vuoden 2021 alussa, osana suomalaisen jalkapallon ja futsalin 2020-2024 strategista valintaa (Kehittyvä Seurojen Palloliitto). Tiedolla johtamisen tavoitteena on mahdollistaa menestyksekäs päätöksenteko ja toiminta lajiyhteisössä, välittämällä tutkittua ja pätevää tietoa jalkapallon sekä futsalin eri sidosryhmille. Prosessia edistää Palloliiton eri toimintojen edustajista koostuva ja säännöllisesti kokoontuva tiedolla johtamisen palvelutiimi, joka raportoi toiminnastaan johtoryhmälle.
 
DATA ENGINEER
SUOMEN PALLOLIITTO RY
 
Data Engineeriä.

Suunnitella, dokumentoida ja toteuttaa automatisoituja tietohallintoprosesseja ja ohjelmointirajapintoja, jotka mahdollistavat päätöksenteon tueksi tarvittavan tiedon jakamisen.Organisaation dataputkien suunnittelu, kehitys, hallinnointi ja toteutusKehittää sisäisiä ja ulkoisia raportteja yhteistyössä muun tiimin kanssa.Raportoida, kehittää ja tukea datan hyödyntämistä organisaatiossa

required_skills: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Computer Science, Data Analysis, Data Analytics, Data Science, Machine Learning, and Pattern RecognitionClient Presentation, Communication, and Feature Engineering
location: Avanade · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  1 week ago  · Over 50 applicants
job_description:
Job DescriptionAre you interested in pursuing a career in the world of AI and digital transformation? How about learning and developing your skills in the latest AI technology?Avanade is looking for individuals with a passion for technology who want to enter the exciting world of Artificial Intelligence. The Avanade AI Engineer Academy is a 6 week paid training program starting in March 2024. This Academy is designed to give you the skills and certifications so you can take your career to new heights in the field of data and artificial intelligence.This 100% online Academy will introduce you into the world of AI. Sessions will take place in English and combines theoretical and practical work modules. Avanade offers you the unique opportunity to kickstart your career in AI. You’ll join a group of participants like yourself from all over Europe, after completing Go Orange (our onboarding program), you will begin this instructor led training. This program is ideal if you:  Are excited about AI and the possibilities it brings organizations. Have a desire to train on the Microsoft Azure Cloud and/or if you already hold a Microsoft certification. Have some experience with Data Science, Python or Machine Learning. Are desiring to challenge yourself to join a consulting business. Are resourceful, a problem solver with a passion for technology. Are motivated, interested in learning and tech savvy. Have a very good level of written and spoken English and Finnish. 
 What will your role be after the Academy? After completion of the Academy, you will join our Nordic Team as an AI Engineer. You will develop AI solutions and services that help our clients achieve their business outcomes using AI & Analytics. This role requires data science skills such as exploration data analysis, feature engineering, and ML models training and testing. You will work with a range of technologies, including advanced analytics, computer vision, natural language processing (NLP), large language models (LLM), unsupervised learning, and optimization, all primarily powered by Microsoft Azure. You will also be involved in applying MLOps technology for deployments. Day-to-day you will:   Develop AI projects and solutions.  Assist in the preparation of client presentations and proposals.  Conduct research and analysis on AI and ML technologies and trends to stay up to date with the latest advancements.  Contribute to the creation of custom training materials and code examples for a wide variety of AI solutions.  Work with senior team members to analyze current business practices and identify future opportunities for leveraging advanced analytics and AI solutions. 
 Key Skill   :  You have experience with Python or other programming languages.  You are passioned about Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.  You have a few years of experience in data science and are familiar with exploration data analysis, feature engineering and ML models (training and testing).  Knowledge of Microsoft Azure services is a plus, but we’re open to other cloud technologies such as AWS or Google Cloud!  You have strong communication skills and can explain complex concepts to your team members.  Written and verbal communication skills in English and Finnish.  You possess a bachelor’s and/or Masters in a field such as Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Statistics, Mathematics or Physics. An equivalent combination of education and experience will also suffice. 
 Why would you choose Avanade?  You will become part of an active and growing AI community. Your future colleagues will help you with questions and challenges. Moreover, there is a pleasant, informal working atmosphere, and we like to organize social activities outside of working hours.We have a flexible work arrangement, so you can decide whether you work from home or join us at the office.Knowledge development is our focus, and we ensure this by offering training opportunities. With your passion, you can use the latest Microsoft technology to make a daily difference for our customers in the Enterprise market. We have a strong focus on the career and development opportunities of all our people. Everyone has a career advisor who will work with you to create guide you in choosing from the many training opportunities we offer. A diverse environment where respect for our clients, our teams, and the world around us is at the heart of everything we do. Together we do what matters. 
The AI Academy starts on the 1st of March, 2024.About AvanadeAvanade is the leading provider of innovative digital, cloud and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day, our 59,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.We have been recognized as Microsoft’s Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60,000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies, we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.We are a people first company, committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business, we are building a sustainable world and helping people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

job_description:
Introduction:Join an industry-leading team at the forefront of mobile gaming innovation! We are seeking a talented Competitive Intelligence Analyst to play a pivotal role in our quest for success.Role Goals:As a Lead Competitive Intelligence Analyst, your mission is to provide critical insights that will drive our organization's growth and competitiveness in the dynamic world of mobile gaming. You will be expected to support both organic (existing games, new game initiatives) and inorganic growth (M&A, investments) activities. Continuous Insights Sharing: Collaborate effectively by sharing real-time competitive insights across teams.Comprehensive Genre Updates: Deliver monthly presentations and updates, shedding light on new developments and essential insights.Market Trend Snapshots: Keep a finger on the pulse of emerging market trends and recommend strategic actions, whether introducing new features, investments, or product innovations.Focused Analysis: Conduct in-depth analyses on specific topics of interest to the organization, such as the impact of certain new features / trends, product breakdowns, market leaders.Competitor Profiling: Create detailed profiles of key competitors, dissecting their strengths, weaknesses, and opportunities.Data Visualization Prowess: Create engaging and informative reports and dashboards to effectively identify trends and opportunities, and to convey findings effectively.Product & Investment Strategy: Inform the Company’s Product & Investment strategy by translating key market findings into actionable insights
Most wanted Highly experienced in the mobile gaming industry, with a particular focus in product development and market research.Deep understanding of mobile game features, trends and drivers of success.Proven ability to formulate hypotheses, validate with data, and translate insights into actionable strategies.Proficiency in integrating diverse datasets with deep product knowledge.Strong analytical and research skills including proficiency in various market research tools and data analysis techniques.Exceptional communication and presentation skills.Highly attuned to key trends in the mobile gaming industry and a commitment to staying updated on these.Previous experience in competitive intelligence or market research.A well-established industry network.Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Business, Marketing, Economics, or Statistics).

required_skills: Data Analysis, Python (Programming Language), and SQLA/B Testing, Customer Acquisition, Data Modeling, Data-driven Decision Making, Google BigQuery, Mobile Games, and Software as a Service (SaaS)
location: Musopia · Helsinki Metropolitan Area  5 days ago  · Over 50 applicants
job_description:
How about a backstage pass to the music industry? Would you like to influence on how people learn to play music?Musopia is looking for a product and marketing oriented Senior Data Analyst to strengthen our senior team of Analysts and Data Engineers. You are a hands-on data analyst that does analysis and improves the collected data to identify key areas for growth and improvement, ranging from user acquisition to app features and in-app conversions. A modern data stack already exists in the company and is actively used, so you don’t need to start from scratch. You will work closely with other teams, but you would be part of driving the development of our daily data operations that critically supports both marketing and product decision making. RESPONSIBILITIES Collaborate closely with the product and marketing teams to establish, monitor, and communicate key KPI’s crucial for scalable Paid User Acquisition and customer behaviour.Spearhead data-driven decision-making across the company to ensure alignment with business objectives.Proactively identify bottlenecks, challenges, or opportunities for growth through data analysis.Design and maintain real-time analytics dashboards to provide actionable insights for key stakeholders.Articulate data-driven recommendations effectively to both technical and non-technical teams.Enable cross-functional teams with data-driven strategies and assist in setting targets.Continually optimize analytics related models and solutions to keep pace with evolving data requirements and industry standards.Foster a culture of curiosity, encouraging the team to dive deeper into data to uncover the "next big thing."
REQUIREMENTS Years of experience generating and communicating recommendations from data in mobile games or SaaS environmentsExperience in Paid User Acquisition and customer retentionBusiness understanding and capability of wording the management requirements and ability to present findings.Data modelling experience for self-service analytics, for example using dbt.Experience in building dashboards and visualizations (e.g., Preset, Looker, Tableau, Power BI or similar)Understanding of statistical analysis, for example ab testingVersion control (Git)Expert knowledge of SQL, and preferably Python skillsGreat collaboration and communication skills
NICE TO HAVE Experience in BigQuery or a similar cloud data warehouseLove for music!
We are currently working with modern data stack including Google Cloud, Firebase and BigQuery and Preset, but value diversity and your desire to learn beyond specific tools and technologies. Our team is super talented and easy-going, set to make an impact in the future of music business. When you join Musopia, please note that playing some musical instrument is not mandatory but there is a fair chance to learn, and you will even get paid for it!Come work with us and create awesome gamified, music e-learning apps from start to finish. Our team is super talented and easy-going, set to make an impact in the future of music business. We are primarily looking for full-time team members and we can consider remote mode too, depending on your situation. Our team base is in the center of Helsinki, with the possibility of regular remote work depending on projects.This position will be filled in cooperation with our recruitment partner Northstar Talent / Barona. To apply, please submit your application on-line ASAP.  ABOUT MUSOPIAMusopia’s team is developing a unique and truly global concept to ease the early steps of learning to play a musical instrument. Based in Vallila, Helsinki Finland, Musopia is a music software development studio with a mission to help people´s dream of playing an instrument come true. We can help these music lovers become music players with innovative and fun solutions.We work closely together with some of the biggest names in the music industry who share the same passion for creating engaging and efficient learning experiences, such as the world´s biggest ukulele brand Kala Brand Music and the massively popular online guitar teacher JustinGuitar and other music educators. We have turned toward a rapid and strong growth path thanks to our new partnerships and on-going trend around e-learning and application business.Please follow us at LinkedIn!
 
 RESPONSIBILITIES
 
Collaborate closely with the product and marketing teams to establish, monitor, and communicate key KPI’s crucial for scalable Paid User Acquisition and customer behaviour.Spearhead data-driven decision-making across the company to ensure alignment with business objectives.Proactively identify bottlenecks, challenges, or opportunities for growth through data analysis.Design and maintain real-time analytics dashboards to provide actionable insights for key stakeholders.Articulate data-driven recommendations effectively to both technical and non-technical teams.Enable cross-functional teams with data-driven strategies and assist in setting targets.Continually optimize analytics related models and solutions to keep pace with evolving data requirements and industry standards.Foster a culture of curiosity, encouraging the team to dive deeper into data to uncover the "next big thing."

required_skills: Analytical Skills, Data Analysis, Data Analytics, Data Management, and Extract, Transform, Load (ETL)Data Visualization, DataStage, Embedded SIM (eSIM), Problem Solving, and SAS (Software)
location: OP Financial Group · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  2 weeks ago  · 29 applicants
job_description:
Haemme Pohjola Vakuutuksen Korvauspalveluihin Data Analystia vakituiseen työsuhteeseen tukemaan liiketoiminnan kehittämistä ja päätöksentekoa raportoinnin ja analytiikan keinoin. Kanssamme pääset hyödyntämään merkittävää tietopääomaa ja laajentamaan osaamistasi vahinkovakuuttamisen sekä erityisesti korvauspalveluiden alueella.Data Analyst, Pohjola Vakuutuksen Korvauspalvelut Ensisijainen tehtäväsi Data Analyst -tehtävässä on edistää ja kehittää Korvauspalveluiden data- ja analytiikkakyvykkyyttä siten, että ne palvelevat liiketoiminnan tuloksellista johtamista. Analysoit ja visualisoit dataa tuottaen tietoa ja näkemystä liiketoiminnalle laadukkaan datan ja numeerisen analyysin kautta. Hallitset suuria datakokonaisuuksia, yhdistät dataa eri tietolähteistä sekä visualisoit ja konkretisoit havaintosi loppukäyttäjälle ymmärrettävään ja helposti hyödynnettävään muotoon.Olemassa olevan datan hyödyntämisen lisäksi tehtäviisi kuuluu myös kehittää dataympäristön laatua, sisältöä ja prosesseja sekä näihin liittyviä menetelmiä ja työkaluja yhdessä tiimisi ja sidosryhmien kanssa. Varmistat osaltasi, että korvauspalveluilla on käytössään kattavat ja tehokkaat analytiikka- ja raportointivälineet päivittäisen johtamisen ja uudistumisen mahdollistajina, sekä koulutat tarvittaessa liiketoiminnallisia tiimejä datan hyödyntämisessä.Tarkemmin tulevasta toimintaympäristöstäsiTehtävässä toimit osana Korvauspalveluiden Yhteiset kyvykkyydet -organisaatiota, joka tarjoaa vahvan tuen yhtenäisten vahinkoasioinnin prosessien ja digitaalisten palveluiden sekä työkalujen ja osaamisen kehittämisessä. Oman roolisi keskiössä on Korvauspalveluiden datan hyödyntäminen sekä sisällön ja laadun kehittäminen yhteistyössä Korvauspalveluiden johdon, asiantuntijoiden sekä Pohjola Vakuutuksen tietoarkkitehtuurin kehittäjien kanssa. Olet siis keskeisessä roolissa vaikuttamassa siihen, kuinka hyödynnämme parhaiten dataa mm. asiakaskokemuksen parantamiseksi sekä laadun ja tehokkuuden lisäämiseksi eri prosesseissa.… ja siitä, miksi tähän tilaisuuteen kannattaa tarttuaKetterän toimintatapamme myötä meillä luotetaan asiantuntijoihimme sekä kannustetaan tekemään rohkeita päätöksiä, ja odotamme myös sinun laittavan asiantuntijuutesi peliin ja kehittävän aktiivisesti toimintaamme. Tarjoammekin sinulle vastuullisen ja vaihtelevan tehtävän alueella, jonka merkitys liiketoiminnassa on keskeinen ja kasvaa jatkuvasti.Koska elämä on paljon muutakin kuin työtä, meille on ensisijaisen tärkeää, että henkilöstömme voi ja jaksaa hyvin. Pidämme arvossa työn ja vapaa-ajan tasapainoa ja työskentelemme joustavasti hybridityömallilla.Saat käyttöösi monipuoliset henkilöstöetumme, johon kuuluvat henkilöstörahasto sekä henkilökuntaehtoiset pankki-, vakuutus- ja lainapalvelut. Tarjoamme myös kattavan työterveyshuollon, laajan hoitokuluvakuutuksen sekä täysajan tapaturmavakuutuksen. Työssäjaksamiseen panostamme arjen tasapainolla ja joustavuudella sekä tarjoamalla käyttöösi lounas-, liikunta- ja kulttuuriedut sekä mahdollisuuden edulliseen lomailuun OPn lomaosakkeissa.Etsimämme osaajan tuntomerkit Olet aidosti kiinnostunut datasta ja sen hyödyntämisestä liiketoiminnan johtamisessa. Sinulla on kyky tunnistaa ja nähdä olennainen, sekä luovia sujuvasti lukuisten datalähteiden ja erilaisten dataan liittyvien toimeksiantojen parissa. Innostut liiketoiminnan kehittämisestä ja nautit siitä, että pääset tuottamaan reaaliaikaista näkymää ja havaintoja asioiden tilasta analyysin ja ohjelmoinnin keinoin.Arvostamme erityisesti seuraavaa teknistä osaamista Kokemusta liiketoimintalähtöisestä kokonaisvaltaisesta tiedon mallinnuksesta ja datan hyödyntämisestäKokemusta analytiikka- ja raportointityökaluista (esim. SAS, Databricks) tai datan visualisointityökaluista (esim. PowerBI, Tableau)Kokemusta tietokannoista ja ohjelmointikielistä (esim. Python, R, SQL, Spark)Arvostamme lisäksi osaamista ja ymmärrystä pilviympäristöistä (mm. Azure, AWS) sekä tietovarastoinnista ja ETL-ratkaisuista (esim. DataStage, Kafka)
Tulet työskentelemään niin tarkkojen yksityiskohtien kuin laajojen kokonaisuuksienkin parissa, mikä edellyttää sinulta kykyä hahmottaa asioiden välisiä yhteyksiä sekä ratkaisukeskeistä – toisinaan myös luovuutta vaativaa – työskentelyä. Toimit itseohjautuvasti ja vastuullisesti, ja osaat organisoida ja priorisoida työsi. Olet osallistuva tiimipelaaja ja hyödynnät rohkeasti kollegoiden asiantuntemusta ja tukea tarvittaessa. Rakennat tuloksellisesti yhteistyötä myös sidosryhmien kanssa, ja sinulla on erinomaiset vuorovaikutustaidot niin suomeksi kuin englanniksi.Miten tästä eteenpäin?Jos sinulla on mielessä kysymyksiä tehtävästä tai meillä työskentelystä, niin ota yhteyttä johtaja Seppo Turuseen (050 520 5802 tai seppo.turunen(a)pohjola.fi) 3.11.2023 klo 1300 – 1500 tai 7.11.2023 1500 – 1600 tai Lead Business Data Analyst Saku Saloon (050 4090846 tai saku.salo(a)pohjola.fi) 9.11.2023 1100 – 1400 tai 13.11.2023 1100-1300.Jos taas vakuutimme sinut jo siitä, että tätä mahdollisuutta ei kannata jättää väliin, voit hakea tehtävään 19.11.2023 mennessä oheisen linkin kautta.Finanssialalla luottamus ja vastuullisuus ovat toimintamme perusta, minkä vuoksi tehtävään valittavalle henkilölle tehdään tarvittavat tehtäväkohtaiset taustaselvitykset.OP Ryhmä on yhdenvertaisuutta ja monimuotoisuutta arvostava työyhteisö. Kannustamme kaikenlaisia henkilöitä hakemaan meille töihin ja toivotamme tervetulleiksi kaikki sukupuoli-identiteetit, eri-ikäiset sekä kulttuuri- ja vähemmistöryhmät.OP Ryhmä on Suomen suurin finanssiryhmä. Olemme asiakkaidemme omistama, yksi finanssialan houkuttelevimmista työnantajista Suomessa. Ryhmässämme työskentelee yli 13 000 alan ammattilaista, ja tuotamme sekä kehitämme pankki-, sijoitus-, vakuutus- ja kiinteistönvälityspalveluita neljälle miljoonalle asiakkaallemme. Lisätietoa OPsta työnantajana ja kaikki avoimet tehtävämme löydät osoitteesta www.op-careers.fi.

required_skills: Computer Science, Data Warehousing, Databases, and Extract, Transform, Load (ETL)Business Understanding, Communication, Data Modeling, Snowflake, Snowflake Cloud, and Wizard
location: Schibsted Finland · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  5 days ago  · 35 applicants
job_description:
THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELLYou? A data engineer with an analytic mindset or an analyst with data engineering skills. Whether you have a few years of experience or have been around for a while, we’re interested in hearing from you.Role? As a Data Warehouse Engineer in our company, you will take part in constructing state-of-the-art Data Warehouses tailored for Nordic Marketplaces, empowering data-informed decisions. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders and cross-functional teams to engineer robust, agile solutions.Tech stack? AWS, Snowflake, Redshift, Matillion, Python, DBT, TableauLocation? You can apply to work at one of our hubs in Aarhus or Helsinki. Most of us work some days from home a couple of days a week and love meeting our colleagues weekly for collaboration. If you like, you can of course work from the office every day.Company? FINN.no in Norway, Bilbasen and DBA in Denmark, Oikotie and Tori in Finland, and Blocket in Sweden, recently joined forces, collectively forming Schibsted Nordic Marketplaces. Together, we serve over 325 million monthly visits in the Nordics. By joining forces, we are on a transformative journey toward becoming a next-generation marketplace. To achieve this ambitious goal, we're building a marketplace platform that will propel our verticals (Jobs, Mobility, Real Estate, ReCommerce) to a leading position in all countries. Our technology unit is instrumental to our success story, deploying new code to production over 1800 times per week.Why us? In this role, you will have an unique opportunity to build and form the Data Warehouse for Nordic Marketplaces to empower the organisation to take data driven decisions. We believe that the best solutions come in collaboration with others and that freedom and a sense of responsibility are more effective than detailed management.Sounds like your cup of tea? Check out the details below!WHO ARE YOU? A data wizard with at least Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (Computer science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance) Passionate about data as basis of analysis and decision support Profound business understanding and communication skills Manages fundamental data modelling techniques relevant to data warehousing Experience with our tech stack or equivalent ETL/ELT tools like Talend, BODS, Informatica or other data wrangling tools like DBT, Databricks, Fivetran, Spark, Airflow etc and you don’t need ChatGPT to write your SQL Experience with AWS services like Snowflake, S3, Lambda or other cloud platforms and comparable tools 
WHAT’S THE JOB LIKE?Day-to-day work & projects cookingAs a part of our team you will work in close collaboration with both domain teams and analysts as well as your peers within our team and sister teams. Having a structured and analytical mindset is essential, as well as being able to decipher domain data models and data products, and transform those into analytical models to support business requirements by analysts and other stakeholders. You will be working with building high quality data pipelines to feed those models for different verticals as well as horizontal models across. This will be done using the Schibsted Common Analytical Model as one of the core building blocks.ColleaguesWe are a large, distributed and highly diverse team spread across most out the Nordics and Poland. Our team consists of 12 people, with broad diversity in both background and age-span. We're part of the data platform area, together with other teams like data platform engineering, data management, recommendation as well as data enablement teams for data science and data mesh. We are one out of 50 teams of talented individuals with diverse backgrounds, intellects and identities.We work closely with the technical domain teams to understand the data we are dealing with as well as our main stakeholders within insight and analysts as well as functions like finance and sales. We work according to agile principles with continuous deployment and improvements. We meet up several times during the year in our different locations.Not everything is cotton candy clouds, so here’s the main opportunity to improveRight now we are navigating around in the new, Nordic organisation, balancing both the legacy systems while building the new stuff, which is both demanding and exciting at the same time.On the other hand, this brings along a great opportunity to leave your fingerprint on how our future Data Warehouse is drafted and to support the rest of the organisation with key metrics and analyses both during and after the transition! Is your curious mind asking for this kind of adventure?GOT YOUR ATTENTION? Let us hear from you!If you are looking for a workplace and the role in which you could share your knowledge and expertise, learn and grow, get inspired, be yourself, and make a difference, let us hear from you by 20.11.2023. We value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds.QUESTIONS?Engineering Manager Kristin Hybertsen is happy to provide information about the daily work and answer any questions you may have about the role. Kristin is best reached through Linkedin or email kristin.hybertsen(at)schibsted.com

required_skills: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Data Mining, Data Science, Docker Products, MLOps, Machine Learning, Pattern Recognition, and Software DevelopmentCadence Encounter and Kubernetes
location: Wolt · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  1 week ago  · 31 applicants
job_description:
Job DescriptionTeam purpose and mission Working embedded with Data Scientists and other engineers to develop, deploy, scale and maintain impactful Machine Learning solutionsHelping data scientists and other engineers with Machine Learning and ML Platform & infrastructure related topics and questions. Increasing the level of ML engineering in the team.Monitoring, maintenance and troubleshooting of deployed solutionsContributing to our MLOps practices and liaising with the ML Platform teamWe have openings in multiple domains, such as personalisation & recommendations, search, logistics etc.
📍This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Berlin, Helsinki, or Stockholm, or you can work remotely anywhere in Finland, Sweden, Germany, Denmark, and Estonia. Read more about our remote setup here. If you live outside of these countries - not to worry! We provide relocation support to help you make your way to Finland, Germany or Sweden.Our humble expectations You are experienced in end-to-end machine learning deployments and maintenance of deployed solutions and have at least 3+ years of experience in ML/MLOps.Furthermore, you bring solid experience in scaling and troubleshooting machine learning deployments to the table. You can help with the technical issues the teams encounter.A good understanding of ML and MLOps principles as well as Software engineering experience in Python should complete your profile.Ideally you also have experience in Docker, Kubernetes, Flyte, Seldon Core.
Next StepsThe position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Michal SzafraniecAbout WoltWolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.Working in Product Development at WoltAt Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & InclusionWe want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.Join us today to build Wolt together!

DATA ENGINEERSUOMEN PALLOLIITTO RYJalkapalloa jokaiselle! Visiomme on olla menestyvä jalkapallomaa - hyvinvoinnin kasvattaja.Haemme nyt joukkoomme Tiedolla Johtamisen palvelutiimiin Data Engineeriä.Suomen Palloliiton Data Engineerinä keskeinen tavoitteesi on tiedon jako kustannustehokkaasti, turvallisesti ja joustavasti Seurojen Palloliitossa. Pääset mukaan tiedolla johtamisen palvelutiimiin, jossa yhteistyössä muiden ammattilaisten ja sidosryhmien kanssa viet eteenpäin Palloliiton tiedolla johtamisen strategiaa kohti käyttäjäystävällisiä digitaalisia palveluita, sekä analytiikka ja datakehitystä. Datainsinöörinä keskeisiä tehtäviäsi ovat:  Suunnitella, dokumentoida ja toteuttaa automatisoituja tietohallintoprosesseja ja ohjelmointirajapintoja, jotka mahdollistavat päätöksenteon tueksi tarvittavan tiedon jakamisen.Organisaation dataputkien suunnittelu, kehitys, hallinnointi ja toteutusKehittää sisäisiä ja ulkoisia raportteja yhteistyössä muun tiimin kanssa.Raportoida, kehittää ja tukea datan hyödyntämistä organisaatiossa

Data Factory)API-rajapinnoistaTietokannoista: SQL, NoSQLVersiohallinnasta (Git), dokumentoinnista ja DevOps, DataOps CI/CD-periaatteista.Ohjelmointikielistä: Python (R ja muut ohjelmointikielet katsotaan eduksi).
Olet kiinnostunut data arkkitehtuurista, sekä merkityksellisestä työstä, jonka visiona on olla hyvinvoinnin kasvattaja Suomessa. Sinulla on korkeakoulututkinto soveltuvalta alalta sekä vähintään kolmen vuoden ammatillista kokemusta vastaavista tehtävistä. Olet yhteistyötaitoinen tiimipelaaja, joka viestii sujuvasti suomeksi sekä englanniksi. Tehtävässä raportoit tutkimus- ja kehityspäällikkö Ville-Pekka Inkilälle.LisätietojaTehtävä sijoittuu Helsingin toimistoomme Töölöön. Lisäksi tarjoamme joustavan etätyömahdollisuuden, sekä muut monipuoliset edut.Mikäli kiinnostuit tehtävästä, haethan tehtävään viimeistään 22.10.2023 alla olevasta linkistä.Wise IT tukee Suomen Palloliittoa tässä rekrytoinnissa. Mikäli haluat tehtävästä lisätietoja, olethan yhteydessä IT rekrytointikonsultti Tiia-Liina Aavistoon, tiia-liina.aavisto@wiseit.fi, +358401860696Suomen Palloliitto on Suomalaisen jalkapallon ja futsalin koti. Palloliitto vastaa maamme kaikesta jalkapallo- ja futsaltoiminnasta, ja sen kehittämisestä. Suomen Palloliiton tiedolla johtamisen -prosessi käynnistettiin virallisesti vuoden 2021 alussa, osana suomalaisen jalkapallon ja futsalin 2020-2024 strategista valintaa (Kehittyvä Seurojen Palloliitto). Tiedolla johtamisen tavoitteena on mahdollistaa menestyksekäs päätöksenteko ja toiminta lajiyhteisössä, välittämällä tutkittua ja pätevää tietoa jalkapallon sekä futsalin eri sidosryhmille. Prosessia edistää Palloliiton eri toimintojen edustajista koostuva ja säännöllisesti kokoontuva tiedolla johtamisen palvelutiimi, joka raportoi toiminnastaan johtoryhmälle.

required_skills: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Computer Science, Data Analysis, Data Analytics, Data Science, Machine Learning, and Pattern RecognitionClient Presentation, Communication, and Feature Engineering
location: Avanade · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  1 week ago  · Over 50 applicants
job_description:
Job DescriptionAre you interested in pursuing a career in the world of AI and digital transformation? How about learning and developing your skills in the latest AI technology?Avanade is looking for individuals with a passion for technology who want to enter the exciting world of Artificial Intelligence. The Avanade AI Engineer Academy is a 6 week paid training program starting in March 2024. This Academy is designed to give you the skills and certifications so you can take your career to new heights in the field of data and artificial intelligence.This 100% online Academy will introduce you into the world of AI. Sessions will take place in English and combines theoretical and practical work modules. Avanade offers you the unique opportunity to kickstart your career in AI. You’ll join a group of participants like yourself from all over Europe, after completing Go Orange (our onboarding program), you will begin this instructor led training. This program is ideal if you:  Are excited about AI and the possibilities it brings organizations. Have a desire to train on the Microsoft Azure Cloud and/or if you already hold a Microsoft certification. Have some experience with Data Science, Python or Machine Learning. Are desiring to challenge yourself to join a consulting business. Are resourceful, a problem solver with a passion for technology. Are motivated, interested in learning and tech savvy. Have a very good level of written and spoken English and Finnish. 
 What will your role be after the Academy? After completion of the Academy, you will join our Nordic Team as an AI Engineer. You will develop AI solutions and services that help our clients achieve their business outcomes using AI & Analytics. This role requires data science skills such as exploration data analysis, feature engineering, and ML models training and testing. You will work with a range of technologies, including advanced analytics, computer vision, natural language processing (NLP), large language models (LLM), unsupervised learning, and optimization, all primarily powered by Microsoft Azure. You will also be involved in applying MLOps technology for deployments. Day-to-day you will:   Develop AI projects and solutions.  Assist in the preparation of client presentations and proposals.  Conduct research and analysis on AI and ML technologies and trends to stay up to date with the latest advancements.  Contribute to the creation of custom training materials and code examples for a wide variety of AI solutions.  Work with senior team members to analyze current business practices and identify future opportunities for leveraging advanced analytics and AI solutions. 
 Key Skill   :  You have experience with Python or other programming languages.  You are passioned about Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.  You have a few years of experience in data science and are familiar with exploration data analysis, feature engineering and ML models (training and testing).  Knowledge of Microsoft Azure services is a plus, but we’re open to other cloud technologies such as AWS or Google Cloud!  You have strong communication skills and can explain complex concepts to your team members.  Written and verbal communication skills in English and Finnish.  You possess a bachelor’s and/or Masters in a field such as Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Statistics, Mathematics or Physics. An equivalent combination of education and experience will also suffice. 
 Why would you choose Avanade?  You will become part of an active and growing AI community. Your future colleagues will help you with questions and challenges. Moreover, there is a pleasant, informal working atmosphere, and we like to organize social activities outside of working hours.We have a flexible work arrangement, so you can decide whether you work from home or join us at the office.Knowledge development is our focus, and we ensure this by offering training opportunities. With your passion, you can use the latest Microsoft technology to make a daily difference for our customers in the Enterprise market. We have a strong focus on the career and development opportunities of all our people. Everyone has a career advisor who will work with you to create guide you in choosing from the many training opportunities we offer. A diverse environment where respect for our clients, our teams, and the world around us is at the heart of everything we do. Together we do what matters. 
The AI Academy starts on the 1st of March, 2024.About AvanadeAvanade is the leading provider of innovative digital, cloud and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day, our 59,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.We have been recognized as Microsoft’s Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60,000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies, we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.We are a people first company, committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business, we are building a sustainable world and helping people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

 Written and verbal communication skills in English and Finnish. 
 
 
 You possess a bachelor’s and/or Masters in a field such as Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Statistics, Mathematics or Physics. An equivalent combination of education and experience will also suffice. 
 
 
 Why would you choose Avanade? 
 
 
You will become part of an active and growing AI community. Introduction:Join an industry-leading team at the forefront of mobile gaming innovation! We are seeking a talented Competitive Intelligence Analyst to play a pivotal role in our quest for success.Role Goals:As a Lead Competitive Intelligence Analyst, your mission is to provide critical insights that will drive our organization's growth and competitiveness in the dynamic world of mobile gaming. You will be expected to support both organic (existing games, new game initiatives) and inorganic growth (M&A, investments) activities. Continuous Insights Sharing: Collaborate effectively by sharing real-time competitive insights across teams.Comprehensive Genre Updates: Deliver monthly presentations and updates, shedding light on new developments and essential insights.Market Trend Snapshots: Keep a finger on the pulse of emerging market trends and recommend strategic actions, whether introducing new features, investments, or product innovations.Focused Analysis: Conduct in-depth analyses on specific topics of interest to the organization, such as the impact of certain new features / trends, product breakdowns, market leaders.Competitor Profiling: Create detailed profiles of key competitors, dissecting their strengths, weaknesses, and opportunities.Data Visualization Prowess: Create engaging and informative reports and dashboards to effectively identify trends and opportunities, and to convey findings effectively.Product & Investment Strategy: Inform the Company’s Product & Investment strategy by translating key market findings into actionable insights

required_skills: Data Analysis, Python (Programming Language), and SQLA/B Testing, Customer Acquisition, Data Modeling, Data-driven Decision Making, Google BigQuery, Mobile Games, and Software as a Service (SaaS)
location: Musopia · Helsinki Metropolitan Area  5 days ago  · Over 50 applicants
job_description:
How about a backstage pass to the music industry? Would you like to influence on how people learn to play music?Musopia is looking for a product and marketing oriented Senior Data Analyst to strengthen our senior team of Analysts and Data Engineers. You are a hands-on data analyst that does analysis and improves the collected data to identify key areas for growth and improvement, ranging from user acquisition to app features and in-app conversions. A modern data stack already exists in the company and is actively used, so you don’t need to start from scratch. You will work closely with other teams, but you would be part of driving the development of our daily data operations that critically supports both marketing and product decision making. RESPONSIBILITIES Collaborate closely with the product and marketing teams to establish, monitor, and communicate key KPI’s crucial for scalable Paid User Acquisition and customer behaviour.Spearhead data-driven decision-making across the company to ensure alignment with business objectives.Proactively identify bottlenecks, challenges, or opportunities for growth through data analysis.Design and maintain real-time analytics dashboards to provide actionable insights for key stakeholders.Articulate data-driven recommendations effectively to both technical and non-technical teams.Enable cross-functional teams with data-driven strategies and assist in setting targets.Continually optimize analytics related models and solutions to keep pace with evolving data requirements and industry standards.Foster a culture of curiosity, encouraging the team to dive deeper into data to uncover the "next big thing."
REQUIREMENTS Years of experience generating and communicating recommendations from data in mobile games or SaaS environmentsExperience in Paid User Acquisition and customer retentionBusiness understanding and capability of wording the management requirements and ability to present findings.Data modelling experience for self-service analytics, for example using dbt.Experience in building dashboards and visualizations (e.g., Preset, Looker, Tableau, Power BI or similar)Understanding of statistical analysis, for example ab testingVersion control (Git)Expert knowledge of SQL, and preferably Python skillsGreat collaboration and communication skills
NICE TO HAVE Experience in BigQuery or a similar cloud data warehouseLove for music!
We are currently working with modern data stack including Google Cloud, Firebase and BigQuery and Preset, but value diversity and your desire to learn beyond specific tools and technologies. Our team is super talented and easy-going, set to make an impact in the future of music business. When you join Musopia, please note that playing some musical instrument is not mandatory but there is a fair chance to learn, and you will even get paid for it!Come work with us and create awesome gamified, music e-learning apps from start to finish. Our team is super talented and easy-going, set to make an impact in the future of music business. We are primarily looking for full-time team members and we can consider remote mode too, depending on your situation. Our team base is in the center of Helsinki, with the possibility of regular remote work depending on projects.This position will be filled in cooperation with our recruitment partner Northstar Talent / Barona. To apply, please submit your application on-line ASAP.  ABOUT MUSOPIAMusopia’s team is developing a unique and truly global concept to ease the early steps of learning to play a musical instrument. Based in Vallila, Helsinki Finland, Musopia is a music software development studio with a mission to help people´s dream of playing an instrument come true. We can help these music lovers become music players with innovative and fun solutions.We work closely together with some of the biggest names in the music industry who share the same passion for creating engaging and efficient learning experiences, such as the world´s biggest ukulele brand Kala Brand Music and the massively popular online guitar teacher JustinGuitar and other music educators. We have turned toward a rapid and strong growth path thanks to our new partnerships and on-going trend around e-learning and application business.Please follow us at LinkedIn!
 
 RESPONSIBILITIES
 
Collaborate closely with the product and marketing teams to establish, monitor, and communicate key KPI’s crucial for scalable Paid User Acquisition and customer behaviour.Spearhead data-driven decision-making across the company to ensure alignment with business objectives.Proactively identify bottlenecks, challenges, or opportunities for growth through data analysis.Design and maintain real-time analytics dashboards to provide actionable insights for key stakeholders.Articulate data-driven recommendations effectively to both technical and non-technical teams.Enable cross-functional teams with data-driven strategies and assist in setting targets.Continually optimize analytics related models and solutions to keep pace with evolving data requirements and industry standards.Foster a culture of curiosity, encouraging the team to dive deeper into data to uncover the "next big thing."

location: OP Financial Group · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  2 weeks ago  · 29 applicants
job_description:
Haemme Pohjola Vakuutuksen Korvauspalveluihin Data Analystia vakituiseen työsuhteeseen tukemaan liiketoiminnan kehittämistä ja päätöksentekoa raportoinnin ja analytiikan keinoin. Kanssamme pääset hyödyntämään merkittävää tietopääomaa ja laajentamaan osaamistasi vahinkovakuuttamisen sekä erityisesti korvauspalveluiden alueella.Data Analyst, Pohjola Vakuutuksen Korvauspalvelut Ensisijainen tehtäväsi Data Analyst -tehtävässä on edistää ja kehittää Korvauspalveluiden data- ja analytiikkakyvykkyyttä siten, että ne palvelevat liiketoiminnan tuloksellista johtamista. Analysoit ja visualisoit dataa tuottaen tietoa ja näkemystä liiketoiminnalle laadukkaan datan ja numeerisen analyysin kautta. Hallitset suuria datakokonaisuuksia, yhdistät dataa eri tietolähteistä sekä visualisoit ja konkretisoit havaintosi loppukäyttäjälle ymmärrettävään ja helposti hyödynnettävään muotoon.Olemassa olevan datan hyödyntämisen lisäksi tehtäviisi kuuluu myös kehittää dataympäristön laatua, sisältöä ja prosesseja sekä näihin liittyviä menetelmiä ja työkaluja yhdessä tiimisi ja sidosryhmien kanssa. Varmistat osaltasi, että korvauspalveluilla on käytössään kattavat ja tehokkaat analytiikka- ja raportointivälineet päivittäisen johtamisen ja uudistumisen mahdollistajina, sekä koulutat tarvittaessa liiketoiminnallisia tiimejä datan hyödyntämisessä.Tarkemmin tulevasta toimintaympäristöstäsiTehtävässä toimit osana Korvauspalveluiden Yhteiset kyvykkyydet -organisaatiota, joka tarjoaa vahvan tuen yhtenäisten vahinkoasioinnin prosessien ja digitaalisten palveluiden sekä työkalujen ja osaamisen kehittämisessä. Oman roolisi keskiössä on Korvauspalveluiden datan hyödyntäminen sekä sisällön ja laadun kehittäminen yhteistyössä Korvauspalveluiden johdon, asiantuntijoiden sekä Pohjola Vakuutuksen tietoarkkitehtuurin kehittäjien kanssa. Olet siis keskeisessä roolissa vaikuttamassa siihen, kuinka hyödynnämme parhaiten dataa mm. asiakaskokemuksen parantamiseksi sekä laadun ja tehokkuuden lisäämiseksi eri prosesseissa.… ja siitä, miksi tähän tilaisuuteen kannattaa tarttuaKetterän toimintatapamme myötä meillä luotetaan asiantuntijoihimme sekä kannustetaan tekemään rohkeita päätöksiä, ja odotamme myös sinun laittavan asiantuntijuutesi peliin ja kehittävän aktiivisesti toimintaamme. Tarjoammekin sinulle vastuullisen ja vaihtelevan tehtävän alueella, jonka merkitys liiketoiminnassa on keskeinen ja kasvaa jatkuvasti.Koska elämä on paljon muutakin kuin työtä, meille on ensisijaisen tärkeää, että henkilöstömme voi ja jaksaa hyvin. Pidämme arvossa työn ja vapaa-ajan tasapainoa ja työskentelemme joustavasti hybridityömallilla.Saat käyttöösi monipuoliset henkilöstöetumme, johon kuuluvat henkilöstörahasto sekä henkilökuntaehtoiset pankki-, vakuutus- ja lainapalvelut. Tarjoamme myös kattavan työterveyshuollon, laajan hoitokuluvakuutuksen sekä täysajan tapaturmavakuutuksen. Työssäjaksamiseen panostamme arjen tasapainolla ja joustavuudella sekä tarjoamalla käyttöösi lounas-, liikunta- ja kulttuuriedut sekä mahdollisuuden edulliseen lomailuun OPn lomaosakkeissa.Etsimämme osaajan tuntomerkit Olet aidosti kiinnostunut datasta ja sen hyödyntämisestä liiketoiminnan johtamisessa. Sinulla on kyky tunnistaa ja nähdä olennainen, sekä luovia sujuvasti lukuisten datalähteiden ja erilaisten dataan liittyvien toimeksiantojen parissa. Innostut liiketoiminnan kehittämisestä ja nautit siitä, että pääset tuottamaan reaaliaikaista näkymää ja havaintoja asioiden tilasta analyysin ja ohjelmoinnin keinoin.Arvostamme erityisesti seuraavaa teknistä osaamista Kokemusta liiketoimintalähtöisestä kokonaisvaltaisesta tiedon mallinnuksesta ja datan hyödyntämisestäKokemusta analytiikka- ja raportointityökaluista (esim. SAS, Databricks) tai datan visualisointityökaluista (esim. PowerBI, Tableau)Kokemusta tietokannoista ja ohjelmointikielistä (esim. Python, R, SQL, Spark)Arvostamme lisäksi osaamista ja ymmärrystä pilviympäristöistä (mm. Azure, AWS) sekä tietovarastoinnista ja ETL-ratkaisuista (esim. DataStage, Kafka)
Tulet työskentelemään niin tarkkojen yksityiskohtien kuin laajojen kokonaisuuksienkin parissa, mikä edellyttää sinulta kykyä hahmottaa asioiden välisiä yhteyksiä sekä ratkaisukeskeistä – toisinaan myös luovuutta vaativaa – työskentelyä. Toimit itseohjautuvasti ja vastuullisesti, ja osaat organisoida ja priorisoida työsi. Olet osallistuva tiimipelaaja ja hyödynnät rohkeasti kollegoiden asiantuntemusta ja tukea tarvittaessa. Rakennat tuloksellisesti yhteistyötä myös sidosryhmien kanssa, ja sinulla on erinomaiset vuorovaikutustaidot niin suomeksi kuin englanniksi.Miten tästä eteenpäin?Jos sinulla on mielessä kysymyksiä tehtävästä tai meillä työskentelystä, niin ota yhteyttä johtaja Seppo Turuseen (050 520 5802 tai seppo.turunen(a)pohjola.fi) 3.11.2023 klo 1300 – 1500 tai 7.11.2023 1500 – 1600 tai Lead Business Data Analyst Saku Saloon (050 4090846 tai saku.salo(a)pohjola.fi) 9.11.2023 1100 – 1400 tai 13.11.2023 1100-1300.Jos taas vakuutimme sinut jo siitä, että tätä mahdollisuutta ei kannata jättää väliin, voit hakea tehtävään 19.11.2023 mennessä oheisen linkin kautta.Finanssialalla luottamus ja vastuullisuus ovat toimintamme perusta, minkä vuoksi tehtävään valittavalle henkilölle tehdään tarvittavat tehtäväkohtaiset taustaselvitykset.OP Ryhmä on yhdenvertaisuutta ja monimuotoisuutta arvostava työyhteisö. Kannustamme kaikenlaisia henkilöitä hakemaan meille töihin ja toivotamme tervetulleiksi kaikki sukupuoli-identiteetit, eri-ikäiset sekä kulttuuri- ja vähemmistöryhmät.OP Ryhmä on Suomen suurin finanssiryhmä. Olemme asiakkaidemme omistama, yksi finanssialan houkuttelevimmista työnantajista Suomessa. Ryhmässämme työskentelee yli 13 000 alan ammattilaista, ja tuotamme sekä kehitämme pankki-, sijoitus-, vakuutus- ja kiinteistönvälityspalveluita neljälle miljoonalle asiakkaallemme. Lisätietoa OPsta työnantajana ja kaikki avoimet tehtävämme löydät osoitteesta www.op-careers.fi.

required_skills: Computer Science, Data Warehousing, Databases, and Extract, Transform, Load (ETL)Business Understanding, Communication, Data Modeling, Snowflake, Snowflake Cloud, and Wizard
location: Schibsted Finland · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  5 days ago  · 35 applicants
job_description:
THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELLYou? A data engineer with an analytic mindset or an analyst with data engineering skills. Whether you have a few years of experience or have been around for a while, we’re interested in hearing from you.Role? As a Data Warehouse Engineer in our company, you will take part in constructing state-of-the-art Data Warehouses tailored for Nordic Marketplaces, empowering data-informed decisions. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders and cross-functional teams to engineer robust, agile solutions.Tech stack? AWS, Snowflake, Redshift, Matillion, Python, DBT, TableauLocation? You can apply to work at one of our hubs in Aarhus or Helsinki. Most of us work some days from home a couple of days a week and love meeting our colleagues weekly for collaboration. If you like, you can of course work from the office every day.Company? FINN.no in Norway, Bilbasen and DBA in Denmark, Oikotie and Tori in Finland, and Blocket in Sweden, recently joined forces, collectively forming Schibsted Nordic Marketplaces. Together, we serve over 325 million monthly visits in the Nordics. By joining forces, we are on a transformative journey toward becoming a next-generation marketplace. To achieve this ambitious goal, we're building a marketplace platform that will propel our verticals (Jobs, Mobility, Real Estate, ReCommerce) to a leading position in all countries. Our technology unit is instrumental to our success story, deploying new code to production over 1800 times per week.Why us? In this role, you will have an unique opportunity to build and form the Data Warehouse for Nordic Marketplaces to empower the organisation to take data driven decisions. We believe that the best solutions come in collaboration with others and that freedom and a sense of responsibility are more effective than detailed management.Sounds like your cup of tea? Check out the details below!WHO ARE YOU? A data wizard with at least Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (Computer science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance) Passionate about data as basis of analysis and decision support Profound business understanding and communication skills Manages fundamental data modelling techniques relevant to data warehousing Experience with our tech stack or equivalent ETL/ELT tools like Talend, BODS, Informatica or other data wrangling tools like DBT, Databricks, Fivetran, Spark, Airflow etc and you don’t need ChatGPT to write your SQL Experience with AWS services like Snowflake, S3, Lambda or other cloud platforms and comparable tools 
WHAT’S THE JOB LIKE?Day-to-day work & projects cookingAs a part of our team you will work in close collaboration with both domain teams and analysts as well as your peers within our team and sister teams. Having a structured and analytical mindset is essential, as well as being able to decipher domain data models and data products, and transform those into analytical models to support business requirements by analysts and other stakeholders. You will be working with building high quality data pipelines to feed those models for different verticals as well as horizontal models across. This will be done using the Schibsted Common Analytical Model as one of the core building blocks.ColleaguesWe are a large, distributed and highly diverse team spread across most out the Nordics and Poland. Our team consists of 12 people, with broad diversity in both background and age-span. We're part of the data platform area, together with other teams like data platform engineering, data management, recommendation as well as data enablement teams for data science and data mesh. We are one out of 50 teams of talented individuals with diverse backgrounds, intellects and identities.We work closely with the technical domain teams to understand the data we are dealing with as well as our main stakeholders within insight and analysts as well as functions like finance and sales. We work according to agile principles with continuous deployment and improvements. We meet up several times during the year in our different locations.Not everything is cotton candy clouds, so here’s the main opportunity to improveRight now we are navigating around in the new, Nordic organisation, balancing both the legacy systems while building the new stuff, which is both demanding and exciting at the same time.On the other hand, this brings along a great opportunity to leave your fingerprint on how our future Data Warehouse is drafted and to support the rest of the organisation with key metrics and analyses both during and after the transition! Is your curious mind asking for this kind of adventure?GOT YOUR ATTENTION? Let us hear from you!If you are looking for a workplace and the role in which you could share your knowledge and expertise, learn and grow, get inspired, be yourself, and make a difference, let us hear from you by 20.11.2023. We value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds.QUESTIONS?Engineering Manager Kristin Hybertsen is happy to provide information about the daily work and answer any questions you may have about the role. Kristin is best reached through Linkedin or email kristin.hybertsen(at)schibsted.com

location: Wolt · Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland  1 week ago  · 31 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Job Description

Team purpose and mission

Working embedded with Data Scientists and other engineers to develop, deploy, scale and maintain impactful Machine Learning solutions


📍This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Berlin,, or Stockholm, or you can work remotely anywhere in Finland, Sweden, Germany, Denmark, and Estonia. Read more about our remote setup here. If you live outside of these countries - not to worry! We provide relocation support to help you make your way to Finland, Germany or Sweden.







The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Michal Szafraniec



Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.



At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.



We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!

See more

DATA ENGINEERSUOMEN PALLOLIITTO RYJalkapalloa jokaiselle! Visiomme on olla menestyvä jalkapallomaa - hyvinvoinnin kasvattaja.Haemme nyt joukkoomme Tiedolla Johtamisen palvelutiimiin Data Engineeriä.Suomen Palloliiton Data Engineerinä keskeinen tavoitteesi on tiedon jako kustannustehokkaasti, turvallisesti ja joustavasti Seurojen Palloliitossa. Pääset mukaan tiedolla johtamisen palvelutiimiin, jossa yhteistyössä muiden ammattilaisten ja sidosryhmien kanssa viet eteenpäin Palloliiton tiedolla johtamisen strategiaa kohti käyttäjäystävällisiä digitaalisia palveluita, sekä analytiikka ja datakehitystä. Datainsinöörinä keskeisiä tehtäviäsi ovat:  Suunnitella, dokumentoida ja toteuttaa automatisoituja tietohallintoprosesseja ja ohjelmointirajapintoja, jotka mahdollistavat päätöksenteon tueksi tarvittavan tiedon jakamisen.Organisaation dataputkien suunnittelu, kehitys, hallinnointi ja toteutusKehittää sisäisiä ja ulkoisia raportteja yhteistyössä muun tiimin kanssa.Raportoida, kehittää ja tukea datan hyödyntämistä organisaatiossa

Data Factory)API-rajapinnoistaTietokannoista: SQL, NoSQLVersiohallinnasta (Git), dokumentoinnista ja DevOps, DataOps CI/CD-periaatteista.Ohjelmointikielistä: Python (R ja muut ohjelmointikielet katsotaan eduksi).
Olet kiinnostunut data arkkitehtuurista, sekä merkityksellisestä työstä, jonka visiona on olla hyvinvoinnin kasvattaja Suomessa. Sinulla on korkeakoulututkinto soveltuvalta alalta sekä vähintään kolmen vuoden ammatillista kokemusta vastaavista tehtävistä. Olet yhteistyötaitoinen tiimipelaaja, joka viestii sujuvasti suomeksi sekä englanniksi. Tehtävässä raportoit tutkimus- ja kehityspäällikkö Ville-Pekka Inkilälle.LisätietojaTehtävä sijoittuu Helsingin toimistoomme Töölöön. Lisäksi tarjoamme joustavan etätyömahdollisuuden, sekä muut monipuoliset edut.Mikäli kiinnostuit tehtävästä, haethan tehtävään viimeistään 22.10.2023 alla olevasta linkistä.Wise IT tukee Suomen Palloliittoa tässä rekrytoinnissa. Mikäli haluat tehtävästä lisätietoja, olethan yhteydessä IT rekrytointikonsultti Tiia-Liina Aavistoon, tiia-liina.aavisto@wiseit.fi, +358401860696Suomen Palloliitto on Suomalaisen jalkapallon ja futsalin koti. Palloliitto vastaa maamme kaikesta jalkapallo- ja futsaltoiminnasta, ja sen kehittämisestä. Suomen Palloliiton tiedolla johtamisen -prosessi käynnistettiin virallisesti vuoden 2021 alussa, osana suomalaisen jalkapallon ja futsalin 2020-2024 strategista valintaa (Kehittyvä Seurojen Palloliitto). Tiedolla johtamisen tavoitteena on mahdollistaa menestyksekäs päätöksenteko ja toiminta lajiyhteisössä, välittämällä tutkittua ja pätevää tietoa jalkapallon sekä futsalin eri sidosryhmille. Prosessia edistää Palloliiton eri toimintojen edustajista koostuva ja säännöllisesti kokoontuva tiedolla johtamisen palvelutiimi, joka raportoi toiminnastaan johtoryhmälle.
